name: The Holiday Market at Snowport 2024
categories: Date Idea, Festivals & Fairs, Outside, Seasonal, Shopping
description: They may be small, but local businesses bring our community to life in a big way. The Holiday Market at Snowport Presented by Constant Contact, features 120+ makers, more food than ever before, custom cocktail bars, festive decor, live music, and more. Plan your ideal Snowport adventure and reserve your spot at the Seaport Holiday Market on weekends. Skip the lines by downloading the Seaport Insider App. WHERE: The Holiday Market is located at 100 Seaport Boulevard, right next to The Current.WHEN: The Holiday Market at Snowport Presented by Constant Contact will be open seven days a week November 8 - December 29, 2024.The Holiday Market will be closed Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day.HOLIDAY MARKET HOURS: Monday - Thursday 3:00pm - 8:00pmFriday & Saturday 11:00am - 9:00pmSunday 11:00am - 8:00pmEXTENDED HOURS: During the peak holiday season (December 9 – December 29) the market will have extended hours.Monday - Thursday 11:00am - 8:00pmFriday & Saturday 11:00am - 9:00pmSunday 11:00am - 8:00pmFood & Beverage Tent by JetBlueThe Holiday Market has more food and beverage than ever before and you can enjoy it under the heated tent by JetBlue. The heated tent from JetBlue provides additional beer garden style seating and is also available for private and semi-private events. And while you're there, book your next warm-weather destination via JetBlue.Discover a variety of festive craft cocktails and warm drinks to enjoy, from the themed bars - the Jingle Bar adorned in hundreds of bells, The Dizzy Dreidel decked with spinning dreidels, Betty’s Bar to honor Snowport’s special guest, and The Blizzard Bar covered in snow. New this year, each holiday-themed bar will have its own signature cocktail & mocktail like the Betty the Yeti-ni and Dizzy Eggnog Dizzy.The Stage by Mohegan SunNew this year, The Stage by Mohegan Sun. Local musicians will perform live atop the Jingle Bar every Monday during market hours, playing original songs and holiday favorites. Mohegan Music Mondays is one of the best ways to listen to a diverse lineup of Boston’s most creative local musicians as they perform against the stunning backdrop of Seaport each week in an incredible concert series.Live music schedule: get festive with live music every week at The Stage by Mohegan Sun inside The Holiday Market at Snowport. Join us for a rotating line up of local artists who will take the stage on Mondays starting at 5:00PM.11/11: Lourde Childs11/18: Preston Lydotes11/25: Sofia Corts12/2: MAMO12/9: Jack Whitney12/16: Olivia Monarch12/23: AnaliseWinter Wish WallDiscover the Winter Wish Wall by Mass General Brigham Health Plan, a giant chalkboard where you can share your holiday wishes.Presents Place by LexusVisit Presents Place by Lexus, a stunning backdrop of colorful, oversized gifts with a new photobooth element allowing your and your friends to create the perfect holiday snapshot.The Mistletoe ArchDiscover love with our mistletoe arch. This 10-foot arch is adorned with beautiful holiday greenery, garland, and mistletoe, and “Kiss Me” written across the top.The Crafting CornerDiscover The Crafting Corner by The Maker’s Club with daily drop-in crafting sessions for adults and kids, and featuring activities like mason jar snow globes, wreath decorating, and sensory bins for kids.A New App To Plan Your Snowport Adventure (COMING SOON)Starting on November 1, download the Seaport Insider App to reserve a time to visit The Holiday Market. The app offers tickets for purchase, allowing guests an option to reserve a time slot where they can enter the market within a 30-minute window of their reservation.As in years past, The Holiday Market will continue to offer free admission via a General Admissions line to all, seven days a week. Timed entry ticket reservations are available on weekends only, Friday – Sunday.Weekend timed-entry ticket details:$12 per adult$6 per Veteran$6 per child (ages 6-17, children under the age of 5 are free)$1 per ticket sold benefits Boston XChange (BXC)Also use the App to plan your Snowport adventure. View neighborhood-wide special offers, events in the market and across the neighborhood, a gift guide, maps, and more.Download our Holiday Market Map to prep for your next visit. They may be small, but local businesses bring our community to life in a big way. The Holiday Market at Snowport Presented by Constant Contact, features 120+ makers, more food than ever before, custom cocktail bars, festive decor, live music, and more. Plan your ideal Snowport adventure and reserve your spot at the Seaport Holiday Market on weekends. Skip the lines by downloading the Seaport Insider App. WHERE: The Holiday Market is located at 100 Seaport Boulevard, right next to The Current. WHEN: The Holiday Market at Snowport Presented by Constant Contact will be open seven days a week November 8 - December 29, 2024. The Holiday Market will be closed Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day. HOLIDAY MARKET HOURS: EXTENDED HOURS: During the peak holiday season (December 9 – December 29) the market will have extended hours. Food & Beverage Tent by JetBlue The Holiday Market has more food and beverage than ever before and you can enjoy it under the heated tent by JetBlue. The heated tent from JetBlue provides additional beer garden style seating and is also available for private and semi-private events. And while you're there, book your next warm-weather destination via JetBlue. Discover a variety of festive craft cocktails and warm drinks to enjoy, from the themed bars - the Jingle Bar adorned in hundreds of bells, The Dizzy Dreidel decked with spinning dreidels, Betty’s Bar to honor Snowport’s special guest, and The Blizzard Bar covered in snow. New this year, each holiday-themed bar will have its own signature cocktail & mocktail like the Betty the Yeti-ni and Dizzy Eggnog Dizzy. The Stage by Mohegan Sun New this year, The Stage by Mohegan Sun. Local musicians will perform live atop the Jingle Bar every Monday during market hours, playing original songs and holiday favorites. Mohegan Music Mondays is one of the best ways to listen to a diverse lineup of Boston’s most creative local musicians as they perform against the stunning backdrop of Seaport each week in an incredible concert series. Live music schedule: get festive with live music every week at The Stage by Mohegan Sun inside The Holiday Market at Snowport. Join us for a rotating line up of local artists who will take the stage on Mondays starting at 5:00PM. 11/11: Lourde Childs 11/18: Preston Lydotes 11/25: Sofia Corts 12/2: MAMO 12/9: Jack Whitney 12/16: Olivia Monarch 12/23: Analise Winter Wish Wall Discover the Winter Wish Wall by Mass General Brigham Health Plan, a giant chalkboard where you can share your holiday wishes. Presents Place by Lexus Visit Presents Place by Lexus, a stunning backdrop of colorful, oversized gifts with a new photobooth element allowing your and your friends to create the perfect holiday snapshot. The Mistletoe Arch Discover love with our mistletoe arch. This 10-foot arch is adorned with beautiful holiday greenery, garland, and mistletoe, and “Kiss Me” written across the top. The Crafting Corner Discover The Crafting Corner by The Maker’s Club with daily drop-in crafting sessions for adults and kids, and featuring activities like mason jar snow globes, wreath decorating, and sensory bins for kids. A New App To Plan Your Snowport Adventure (COMING SOON) Starting on November 1, download the Seaport Insider App to reserve a time to visit The Holiday Market. The app offers tickets for purchase, allowing guests an option to reserve a time slot where they can enter the market within a 30-minute window of their reservation. As in years past, The Holiday Market will continue to offer free admission via a General Admissions line to all, seven days a week. Timed entry ticket reservations are available on weekends only, Friday – Sunday. Weekend timed-entry ticket details: $1 per ticket sold benefits Boston XChange (BXC) Also use the App to plan your Snowport adventure. View neighborhood-wide special offers, events in the market and across the neighborhood, a gift guide, maps, and more. Download our Holiday Market Map to prep for your next visit.

name: A Holly Jolly Good Time Holiday Market
categories: Art, Date Idea, Drinks, Food, Good for Groups, Kid Friendly, LGBTQ+, Meetup, Music, Party, Seasonal, Shopping
description: Join us on Saturday, November 16th from 12-5 PM for a Holly Jolly Holiday Market at Time Out Market! Discover unique, handcrafted gifts from LGBTQ+ makers and vendors, offering everything from artisanal jewelry to holiday-themed art. Enjoy live music, festive cocktails, and seasonal snacks as you shop. Kick off the holiday season with friends, good vibes, and support for local artisans!List of featured vendors coming soon. Join us on Saturday, November 16th from 12-5 PM for a Holly Jolly Holiday Market at Time Out Market! Discover unique, handcrafted gifts from LGBTQ+ makers and vendors, offering everything from artisanal jewelry to holiday-themed art. Enjoy live music, festive cocktails, and seasonal snacks as you shop. Kick off the holiday season with friends, good vibes, and support for local artisans!List of featured vendors coming soon.

name: The Festival of Italian Creativity
description: From November 14 to 22, the Consulate General of Italy in Boston is launching “The Festival of Italian Creativity”, an amazing range cultural events (music, cinema, art, literature and theater), science, technology and business seminars, Italian language labs, food tastings, inspirational guests and much more! All of the events and programs in the Festival, organized in cooperation with the October Italian American Heritage Month Committee of Massachusetts, are open to the public and FREE of charge with registration. The complete program of events is online at https://tinyurl.com/ItalyInBostonProgram and all events are available with a single registration at https://tinyurl.com/ItalyInBostonRegistration.The Festival is part of the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs designation of Boston as “2024 Capital of Italian Creativity in the World”. “The Festival of Italian Creativity is an extraordinary opportunity to promote Italy and highlight the many connections between Italy and Boston, as well as to celebrate the contributions of the Italian American community to the historic and contemporary fabric of the city”, said Arnaldo Minuti, Consul General of Italy in Boston. From November 14 to 22, the Consulate General of Italy in Boston is launching “The Festival of Italian Creativity”, an amazing range cultural events (music, cinema, art, literature and theater), science, technology and business seminars, Italian language labs, food tastings, inspirational guests and much more! All of the events and programs in the Festival, organized in cooperation with the October Italian American Heritage Month Committee of Massachusetts, are open to the public and FREE of charge with registration. The complete program of events is online at https://tinyurl.com/ItalyInBostonProgram and all events are available with a single registration at https://tinyurl.com/ItalyInBostonRegistration. The Festival is part of the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs designation of Boston as “2024 Capital of Italian Creativity in the World”. “The Festival of Italian Creativity is an extraordinary opportunity to promote Italy and highlight the many connections between Italy and Boston, as well as to celebrate the contributions of the Italian American community to the historic and contemporary fabric of the city”, said Arnaldo Minuti, Consul General of Italy in Boston.

name: Night Cap Cafe
description: Wake up & Smell the Coffee B*tches,Night Cap is a 8- night Pop-Up night cafe & listening lounge featuring a rotating Menu of DJs, Artists, Vendors, & Other Fun Sh*t in the lobby of Boston City Hall.From live house music from & stand-up comedy to queer speed dating, we offer bold experiences in an inclusive substance-free environment. *For the wine girlies out there, our Creative Collab Night will feature Rebel Rebel Wine Bar.* Check out art and goods from local vendors in a moonlit market place. Night Cap isn’t just another night out; it’s where culture and creativity meet over a cup of joe.Come play with us:Nov. 6th: Opening NightNov. 7th: Queer-Friend-Speed DatingNov. 12th: ✨Listening Lounge✨Nov. 13th: Comedy NightNov. 14th: Creative Meet Up w/ Rebel Rebel Wine BarNov. 19th: Fashion & Figure DrawingNov. 20th: Dungeons & Dragons Character WorkshopNov. 21st: Slumber Party Closing CeremonyEAT, SLEEP, DRINK, SHOP LOCAL. ~ pro tip: bring your own mug for $1 off ☕Check out our instagram to learn more about our vibehttps://www.instagram.com/night_cap_cafe/ Wake up & Smell the Coffee B*tches, Night Cap is a 8- night Pop-Up night cafe & listening lounge featuring a rotating Menu of DJs, Artists, Vendors, & Other Fun Sh*t in the lobby of Boston City Hall. From live house music from & stand-up comedy to queer speed dating, we offer bold experiences in an inclusive substance-free environment. *For the wine girlies out there, our Creative Collab Night will feature Rebel Rebel Wine Bar.* Check out art and goods from local vendors in a moonlit market place. Night Cap isn’t just another night out; it’s where culture and creativity meet over a cup of joe. Come play with us: EAT, SLEEP, DRINK, SHOP LOCAL. ~ pro tip: bring your own mug for $1 off ☕ Check out our instagram to learn more about our vibe https://www.instagram.com/night_cap_cafe/

name: The Sunday Bazaar
categories: Art, Festivals & Fairs, Pet Friendly, Shopping
description: It’s the season finale of our Sunday Bazaar at the Brighton Elks Lodge in Boston! If you’ve been missing out, this is your last chance until Spring!! On November 17th from 11am-5pm, over 100 small local businesses are popping up to sell art, vinyl, vintage, & more!**********************11/17 Announcements: Poster by @haunteddollco . Find them at the Bazaar on 11/17, or online: https://tinyurl.com/bdemwxct🐻‍❄️🫧 local legends @polarseltzer are giving out fun flavors of free fizz! DJ: The dynamic duo of @wileylovescats & @jessamy.shay are going to spin the day away! You may know them from the Space Exotica Lounge Night at @verasunionsq , an absolutely can’t-miss party of groovy vintage vibes! After you visit the market, check out our new store @thebrightonemporium nearby at 406 Western Ave 02135, with another 40 small local businesses! Open 11am-7pm Thursday to Monday.***Info & FAQs*** Date: 11/17 Time: 11am-5pmAddress:Enter from the lodge door at 326 Washington St. 02135, or the pedestrian gate at 14 Academy Hill Rd. 02135 Admission: free! Weather:- The Sunday Bazaar has both indoor and outdoor sections, it happens rain or shine. The outdoor section is in the rear parking lot, the indoor section is inside the Lodge.Transportation: Bus:- 57 line, right next to Washington St. @ Waldo Terrace stop.- 86 line, 2 min walk from Chestnut Hill Ave @ Washington St. stop Bike:- bike posts on Washington St.- chain-link fence to lock your bike at 14 Academy Hill Road Drive:Free public parking lots less than a 5-minute walk away:- 400 Market St.- 198 Wirt St. / 301 Washington St.- 49 Chestnut Hill Ave. (Library & Courthouse closed on Sundays)Plenty of free public street parking throughout Brighton Center. No public parking enforcement on Sundays! Accessibility: The whole facility is at grade, no stairs anywhere! ADA parking spaces available in all parking lots listed above. Pets: are welcome throughout the Bazaar! Applications: https://linktr.ee/thebrightonbazaar Vendor List (partial, may change):@a_decade_apart_vintage@abby.b.art@alliekeastjewelry@alltheragevintage@alwaysjean@angelcoshop@anniemorford @everupwardstudios@antheathreads@aprilsprintedgarden @swirlsnstones@arteri09@aurorawhimsy@beechstpottery@betsymcreative@big_bad_wolf_shop@blueheronclothingco@bmccormick86@buffalospidersantiques@burgerghost@burningbrewscandles@candigoldstein@caramics.pottery & @connieomg_@cgjewelrydesign@charliesellsvintage@citizenscrochet@cloud9resale@crvieart@cryptic_croc@danalicealice@dannydesignsma@deathcapdecor@e.h.rykiel@ebpotsporcelain@envision_lin@evoleye@faded_thrift@fearnodecay@feralfawnart@fibercat@fionaandhoney@flamchowdah@garbageworld404@goodformdesigns@heathdopaint@hecho_a_mano_@hendisvintage@hollystwpoetry@homesweethomestudio@hope.hypesquad@hudon.dave@iluminade11@jaxolinetheartist@jillklydon@jmsmagid_creations@knotty_hangers@lavender.splendid@lendahanddesigns@lincolnsunderwater@LinkaCreates@lynick_creations@marianneradnitzky@merchmerchmerch_screenprints@missmaaarisss@montgomery_green@moondrops__@morrow.little.candle@mrblobguy@mudhedz@nittlesart @fatalforage@olimclayco@ostrajewelry@phatfroots and @thedivine botanic@poodlepackgear@re.liv.d@rebookedboston@rememberingbunnies@replayedathletic@rexwraps@rlnhandmade@rutabaga_prints@sacredflameri@salemandsouth@salemwillow.witch@samkimceramics@sarshaha@saturnpeachart@Seabibidesigns@shopcocobunny@shopmadebymorgannicole@shoprideon@sisterscurated@sloburncandle@SpellboundCandleComp@srg.pottery@sugalski.ceramics@superettesignco@sweetestthingshop@thatscorpioartist@the.nymphs.curio@thecypruscabinet@therainbowrackboutique@thevintageaurora@thriftiebrookie@timeless_kitty; name: Harboring Creativity: Art Sale and Exhibit
description: Join us for East Boston’s vibrant art scene at “Harboring Creativity” on November 16th and 17th, from 11 AM to 4 PM at the ICA Watershed. Located at the heart of the Boston Shipyard, this free event will be showcasing 40+ artists from the Boston area including paintings, photography, and sculptures with art available for purchase. Boston Showcased artists will be hosting art seminars to share their creativity and experience in the art field. There will be various food options catered from local restaurants. Highlights in the film department include screenings of Abre tu Corazón: Historias de Imigrantes de Boston y Más Allá and short films by EBAG member Alberto Roblest. To reserve your free spot, RSVP at https://www.eastbostonartistsgroup.com/. East Boston Artist Group is a community that enriches the community through art, to learn more go to https://www.eastbostonartistsgroup.com/ Join us for East Boston’s vibrant art scene at “Harboring Creativity” on November 16th and 17th, from 11 AM to 4 PM at the ICA Watershed. Located at the heart of the Boston Shipyard, this free event will be showcasing 40+ artists from the Boston area including paintings, photography, and sculptures with art available for purchase. Boston Showcased artists will be hosting art seminars to share their creativity and experience in the art field. There will be various food options catered from local restaurants. Highlights in the film department include screenings of Abre tu Corazón: Historias de Imigrantes de Boston y Más Allá and short films by EBAG member Alberto Roblest. To reserve your free spot, RSVP at https://www.eastbostonartistsgroup.com/. East Boston Artist Group is a community that enriches the community through art, to learn more go to https://www.eastbostonartistsgroup.com/

name: Lamplighter's ✨ Magic 8th Birthday ✨
categories: Drinks, Games, Good for Groups, Party
description: ✨🎉 What is your destiny? Partying with us at Lamplighter's Magic 8th Birthday Party? Only the Magic 8 Ball can say...🎱 "It is decidedly so!"Enchant us with your presence on Friday, November 15 at our original 284 Broadway taproom to celebrate 8 years of Lamplighter and a bright future ahead!The swirling mists of destiny foretell:🍻 Fantastical Draft Lists: Sip on exclusive anniversary brews, fan-favorite classics, and some special offerings from our cellar.🌿 Indoor Brewery "Beer Garden": We’ll transform our production floor into an indoor beer garden, complete with extra standing room, games, and even more beer.🔮 Magical Musings: Try your luck spinning the wheel of fortune, have your fortune told, and commemorate it all in our photo booth!Plus, take home a custom Lamplighter Anniversary glass as a memento of the mystical event!This event is our way of saying thank you to the incredible community and supporters who have been with us on this amazing journey. Together, we've brewed success, one pint at a time. Let's celebrate, reminisce, and create new memories. Cheers to eight years!!Please note that this event is 21+ and guests must show a valid government-issued photo ID upon entry. Babies and kids are also welcome during our 21+ hours if accompanied by a parent or guardian. While our taprooms are family-friendly, we ask that you use your best judgment when planning a visit with children.All guests must pay a $10 fee on the door to gain entry to this event. We will accept cash, credit card, or apple pay.Please note that a free RSVP does not guarantee entry, all taproom space is first come first serve and due to capacity restrictions there may be a line. We'd recommend coming early to beat the line and have first dibs on taproom seating.Any questions, please reach out to [email protected] ✨🎉 What is your destiny? name: Snowbound Expo: The Boston Ski and Snowboard Show
categories: Festivals & Fairs, Kid Friendly, Shopping, Shows, Sports & Active Life
description: This is the biggest community meet-up of the year and perfectly timed for snow sport lovers who are getting ready for the season ahead.Get 50% off tickets with code CALENDAR. Click this link to redeem your discounted tickets: https://snowboundexpo.seetickets.com/event/snowbound-expo-2024/boston-convention-exhibition-center/2926543?OfferCode=CALENDARSnowbound Expo is a community event for everyone, regardless of background, ethnicity, sexual orientation or ability - if you love the mountains, this event is for you.Snowbound Expo brings together inspirational speakers, the latest gear, technology, apparel, and resorts creating a one-stop shop for snow sports enthusiasts like you.Snowbound Expo is for everyone, if you love the mountains, you don’t want to miss it. This is the biggest community meet-up of the year and perfectly timed for snow sport lovers who are getting ready for the season ahead. Get 50% off tickets with code CALENDAR. Click this link to redeem your discounted tickets: https://snowboundexpo.seetickets.com/event/snowbound-expo-2024/boston-convention-exhibition-center/2926543?OfferCode=CALENDAR Snowbound Expo is a community event for everyone, regardless of background, ethnicity, sexual orientation or ability - if you love the mountains, this event is for you. Snowbound Expo brings together inspirational speakers, the latest gear, technology, apparel, and resorts creating a one-stop shop for snow sports enthusiasts like you. Snowbound Expo is for everyone, if you love the mountains, you don’t want to miss it.

name: ALTARS, The Live Experience
description: An evening of multidisciplinary performances by world-class, Boston-based artists who address the times while celebrating the power of community. With an aim to battle the “danger of a single story,” we strive for ALTARS, The Live Experience to contribute nuanced, compelling, and deeply personal perspectives as we reimagine the future, while acknowledging and honoring the past.We are thrilled to feature exceptional, Boston-based artists, including:  Russell Gutta Ferguson, Krump champion and Season 6 winner of "So You Think You Can Dance” My’Kal Stromile, Boston Ballet dancer and US Presidential Scholar in the Arts Alondra Bobadilla, Boston’s first Youth Poet Laureate Phillip Young, GRAMMY-Nominated multi-instrumentalist SambaViva, internationally recognized Brazilian dance ensembleWe will also screen Mariona Lloreta's ALTARS, a short film that explores the aftermath of police brutality in a young family, followed by a Q&A with the evening's performers and short film cast.A reception with food by Palestinian Chef Abdulla Awad and Mexican-owned Travelmug Cafe, and non-alcoholic drinks by Curious Elixirs will wrap the evening alongside a DJ set by Ashton Lites.Find more information on getting to Hibernian Hall here.We hope you'll join us for an unforgettable evening in community! An evening of multidisciplinary performances by world-class, Boston-based artists who address the times while celebrating the power of community. With an aim to battle the “danger of a single story,” we strive for ALTARS, The Live Experience to contribute nuanced, compelling, and deeply personal perspectives as we reimagine the future, while acknowledging and honoring the past. We are thrilled to feature exceptional, Boston-based artists, including: We will also screen Mariona Lloreta's ALTARS, a short film that explores the aftermath of police brutality in a young family, followed by a Q&A with the evening's performers and short film cast. A reception with food by Palestinian Chef Abdulla Awad and Mexican-owned Travelmug Cafe, and non-alcoholic drinks by Curious Elixirs will wrap the evening alongside a DJ set by Ashton Lites. Find more information on getting to Hibernian Hall here. We hope you'll join us for an unforgettable evening in community!

name: Read My Lips Boston pop-up & free wine tasting at The Urban Grape
categories: Art, Date Idea, Drinks, Good for Groups
description: Come join us for a pop-up and free public wine tasting at The Urban Grape, a Black-owned and woman-owned wine shop that highlights BIPOC and LGBTQ+ producers! (Psst...Celebrities are known to stop by, and Issa Rae visited in June!)What's in store:💋 A freshly curated selection of (mostly) gently pre-loved and (some) new inclusive romance books!📚️ Blind dates with books: Let fate decide your next romantic adventure!⁠🌟 Staff recommendations: Handpicked stories that'll make you swoon.⁠🛍️ Fun swag, T-shirts, stickers, candles, and more: Because who doesn't love a little extra?⁠At each of our pop-ups, we donate 10% of our proceeds to a different non-profit. This month, a portion of the event proceeds will go to The Native American Disability Law Center. Help us do some good as we go into the holiday season! (Psst...Celebrities are known to stop by, and Issa Rae visited in June!) This month, a portion of the event proceeds will go to The Native American Disability Law Center. Help us do some good as we go into the holiday season!

name: FOUND at Arsenal Yards Vintage Market and Scavenger Hunt
categories: Date Idea, Good for Groups, Music, Shopping
description: ‼️ FOUND is popping up at @arsenalyards on Sunday, November 17th with 50+ vendors for a holiday market and scavenger hunt! 🎁📅 Sunday, November 17th⏱️ 11AM-4PM📍 130 Arsenal Yards Blvd, Watertown, MA🚗 Free parking🚍 Public transit: Take the Red Line to Central Square and take the 70 bus to the Watertown Mall stopPLUS we will be celebrating the grand opening of the new FOUND pop up store and jewelry bar at Arsenal Yards. We’re converting a former restaurant space into a unique and creative shopping experience for fans of diy projects and sustainable shopping. Make custom jewelry at the bar such as charm necklaces and Italian charm bracelets and shop vintage and collectibles throughout the former restaurant booths.Scavenge Hunt: We’re hiding 25 prize cards throughout Arsenal Yards. Turn in your FOUND card to the FOUND booth to claim prizes such as gift cards to Arsenal Yards businesses, vintage clothing and goods, and records. ‼️ FOUND is popping up at @arsenalyards on Sunday, November 17th with 50+ vendors for a holiday market and scavenger hunt! 🎁 📅 Sunday, November 17th ⏱️ 11AM-4PM 📍 130 Arsenal Yards Blvd, Watertown, MA 🚗 Free parking 🚍 Public transit: Take the Red Line to Central Square and take the 70 bus to the Watertown Mall stop PLUS we will be celebrating the grand opening of the new FOUND pop up store and jewelry bar at Arsenal Yards. We’re converting a former restaurant space into a unique and creative shopping experience for fans of diy projects and sustainable shopping. Make custom jewelry at the bar such as charm necklaces and Italian charm bracelets and shop vintage and collectibles throughout the former restaurant booths. Scavenge Hunt: We’re hiding 25 prize cards throughout Arsenal Yards. Turn in your FOUND card to the FOUND booth to claim prizes such as gift cards to Arsenal Yards businesses, vintage clothing and goods, and records.

name: Bears, Brews & Boys: THE GREAT BASTING
categories: Drinks, Good for Groups, LGBTQ+, Party
description: It’s Bears, Brews & Boys: THE GREAT BASTING featuring DJ Twisted Gleam! Join us at DBCo from 4pm-8pm on 11/17!Now, more than ever, we’re feeling extra grateful for being a part of and creating a community that celebrates folks for being their authentic selves, so join us in the taproom to GOBBLE up your favorite beer, hard seltzer, hard cider, hard slushies, and wine! Come for the party, stay for the turkey legs!NO TICKETS NEEDED! NO COVER – THIS IS A FREE EVENT!All are welcome. This is an open, inclusive gay-friendly event. This is a 21+ event. name: DX Arcade // Hello Open Market Presents Night Games
description: WE'RE BACK STARTING THIS FALL!Hello! Open Market is excited to provide local businesses, entrepreneurs, and creatives with a space to showcase their products.From vintage and sustainable apparel to streetwear, artwork, jewelry, and artisanal goods, we offer something for everyone. Our focus is on creating a vibrant, family-friendly atmosphere that’s always open to the public.Join us for our next series of events starting this Fall in collaboration with DX Arcade Harvard Square for NIGHT GAMES an indoor night market startingFriday, November 15th atThe Garage36 JFK St.Harvard SquareCambridge, MA7 PM to Midnight.This will be our first-ever INDOOR night market, featuring an arcade, a marketplace and entertainment until midnight! It’s the perfect destination for you to shop, socialize with friends, and connect with vendors from near and far, offering opportunities to buy, sell, and trade unique items.Our live DJ Mez.Wav Instagram @mez.wav will provide the soundtrack vibes for this epic event!Expect an amazing market experience with access to vendor spaces, light refreshments courtesy of our sponsors, Topo Chico and Red Bull, great music, and fun activities for everyone to enjoy.ATTENTION: THE FIRST 100 PEOPLE WHO SIGN UP here 10 PARTICIPANTS WILL BE ELIGIBLE TO WIN A FREE GIFT TOTE BAG STUFFED WITH GOODIES COURTESY OF US!!! UPON ARRIVAL OF THE EVENT YOU'LL RECEIVE A RAFFLE TICKET.Vendors can sign up here: Vendor Sign UpStay connected with us on Instagram: @helloopenmarketThis is a FREE weekly event, so spread the word and tell a friend to bring a friend—we can't wait to see you there! name: Somerville Winter Farmers Market
location: The Center for Arts at the Armory
categories: Farms, Festivals & Fairs, Food, Kid Friendly
description: The Center for the Arts at the Armory is proud to offer a weekly winter market with 71+ local food vendors with the best locally grown and regionally produced foods, including fresh produce, cheese, eggs, meats, fish, breads, tamales, pastries, chocolate, skincare products, and more. ​​PARKINGThere is a 2-hr street parking on Highland Ave, a free parking lot located directly behind the Armory, and an overflow lot at 75 Belmont St. ​PAYMENTPay with cash, card, check, and SNAP​SNAP + HIPOur market accepts SNAP/EBT and HIP benefits. We also offer a $15 SNAP match to customers each week. For more information, click here. name: 10 Cheap and Discounted Theater Tickets in Boston
categories: Art, Date Idea, Music, Seasonal, Shows
description: Boston has a rich culture of live performance, with a range of theater companies, ballet, live music, comedy shows, and more. And a night at the theater might be more accessible than you think. Use these ticket deals to get a classy date night at a huge discount. by Celina Colby1) $20 Rush Tickets for the Boston BalletWhere: DowntownInfo: When performances are not sold out, a limited number of $20 rush tickets are available to purchase two hours before the performance. Tickets are cash only and not available for all performances. Unfortunately they’re not available for The Nutcracker. 2) $30 Student & Under 25 Tickets for American Repertory TheatreWhere: Harvard SquareInfo: Full time students or theater goers under 25 can purchase tickets for $30 in advance of $20 on the day of the performance. 3) Blue Steal Blue Man Group TicketsWhere: DowntownInfo: There are select $50 tickets available for performances of the Blue Man Group, the comedic, immersive musical performance that’s generated national acclaim. 4) $25 Boston Pops Tickets Under 40 (pictured)Where: FenwayInfo: Music lovers under 40 can snag tickets to see the Boston Pops for $25. You can order two discounted tickets per order and must present a valid ID at the performance. 5) $29 Huntington Theatre TicketsWhere: South EndInfo: A limited number of $29 tickets are available for all Huntington Theatre performances. These are sold on a first come, first served basis online and in person. 6) $30 Tickets Under 35 and $15 Student Rush at Speakeasy StageWhere: South EndInfo: Patrons under $35 can purchase $30 tickets to Speakeasy Stage productions. $15 student rush tickets are available two hours before performances with a valid student ID. 7) $35 Under 35 Celebrity Series TicketsWhere: Around BostonInfo: Join the $35 Under 35 program with Celebrity Series to score up to two $35 tickets per performance. Celebrity Series hosts music and dance performances, concerts, lectures, and more in beautiful venues around Boston.8) $5 Fridays at Lyric StageWhere: Back BayInfo: At Lyric Stage, $5 tickets are available on the first Friday of every production using a code posted on the Lyric Instagram and Facebook pages. There’s a limit of four tickets per transaction. 9) $10 Rush Tickets at ArtsEmersonWhere: DowntownInfo: There are a limited number of $10 rush tickets to ArtsEmerson performances, available via Eventbrite starting at 10am the day of the performance. BONUS:10) BFD Tuesdays at Alamo DrafthouseWhere: SeaportInfo: Snag $7 tickets to regular 2D movies at Alamo Drafthouse every Tuesday. Best of all, you can see as many movies as you want, there’s no limit on tickets sold. --Photo by Boston Pops Boston has a rich culture of live performance, with a range of theater companies, ballet, live music, comedy shows, and more. And a night at the theater might be more accessible than you think. Use these ticket deals to get a classy date night at a huge discount. by Celina Colby 1) $20 Rush Tickets for the Boston Ballet Where: Downtown Info: When performances are not sold out, a limited number of $20 rush tickets are available to purchase two hours before the performance. Tickets are cash only and not available for all performances. Unfortunately they’re not available for The Nutcracker. 2) $30 Student & Under 25 Tickets for American Repertory Theatre Where: Harvard Square Info: Full time students or theater goers under 25 can purchase tickets for $30 in advance of $20 on the day of the performance. 3) Blue Steal Blue Man Group Tickets Where: Downtown Info: There are select $50 tickets available for performances of the Blue Man Group, the comedic, immersive musical performance that’s generated national acclaim. 4) $25 Boston Pops Tickets Under 40 (pictured) Where: Fenway Info: Music lovers under 40 can snag tickets to see the Boston Pops for $25. You can order two discounted tickets per order and must present a valid ID at the performance. 5) $29 Huntington Theatre Tickets Where: South End Info: A limited number of $29 tickets are available for all Huntington Theatre performances. These are sold on a first come, first served basis online and in person. 6) $30 Tickets Under 35 and $15 Student Rush at Speakeasy Stage Where: South End Info: Patrons under $35 can purchase $30 tickets to Speakeasy Stage productions. $15 student rush tickets are available two hours before performances with a valid student ID. 7) $35 Under 35 Celebrity Series Tickets Where: Around Boston Info: Join the $35 Under 35 program with Celebrity Series to score up to two $35 tickets per performance. Celebrity Series hosts music and dance performances, concerts, lectures, and more in beautiful venues around Boston. 8) $5 Fridays at Lyric Stage Where: Back Bay Info: At Lyric Stage, $5 tickets are available on the first Friday of every production using a code posted on the Lyric Instagram and Facebook pages. There’s a limit of four tickets per transaction. 9) $10 Rush Tickets at ArtsEmerson Where: Downtown Info: There are a limited number of $10 rush tickets to ArtsEmerson performances, available via Eventbrite starting at 10am the day of the performance. BONUS: 10) BFD Tuesdays at Alamo Drafthouse Where: Seaport Info: Snag $7 tickets to regular 2D movies at Alamo Drafthouse every Tuesday. Best of all, you can see as many movies as you want, there’s no limit on tickets sold. -- Photo by Boston Pops

name: 11 places to see fall foliage in/around Boston
description: 2024 fall foliage in Boston is expected to peak in mid to late October. Each year, Greater Boston plays host to some of the most vibrant fall foliage colors in the entire world. Besides stepping foot outside your door, or heading to a local park, here are some prime spots around the city to peep fall foliage.2024 fall foliage map for Boston: Head to newengland.com's peak foliage map to see when leaves are predicted to reach peak around Greater Boston.1) Mount Auburn CemeteryWith over 5,000 trees representing 600+ species, Mount Auburn Cemetery is one of the best places to peep fall foliage in the Boston area. Open in Google Maps. (Photo by @matthewraifman)2) Boston Public GardenBuilt in 1837, Boston Public Garden was the first botanical garden in the United States. Naturally, the park turns into a foliage wonderland in October. Be sure to check out the adjacent Boston Common for bonus foliage. Open in Google Maps. (Photo by @kylekleinphoto)3) Charles River EsplanadeWith a population of 1,700 trees, the Charles River Esplanade turns all sorts of shades of red, orange, and yellow throughout fall. Open in Google Maps.4) Commonwealth AvenueThe Comm Ave Mall (pictured) really steals the show as far as foliage goes in Back Bay. But the colors don’t stop there. You can peep spectacular foliage all throughout the Back Bay and its bordering neighborhood, the South End, in autumn. Look out for magnificent displays of pumpkins and gourds on residential steps in both neighborhoods. In the South End, check out Rutland Square and Southwest Corridor Park for all those foliage feels. Open in Google Maps. (Photo by @kylekleinphoto)5) Chandler Pond Hidden gem alert: The above photo might look like it was taken at a pond in a quaint Vermont town, but it’s actually Chandler Pond in Brighton, MA -- 6 miles from Downtown Boston. Open in Google Maps. (Photo by @jackdarylphotography)6) Arnold ArboretumThe Arboretum's collection of almost 5,000 different species put on a fiery display throughout most of the month of October. Open in Google Maps. (Photo by @arnold_arboretum)7) Memorial Drive CambridgeMemorial Drive, which runs along the Charles River in Cambridge, becomes quite the fall fairyland every October. Bonus: Every Sunday from the last Sunday of April until the second Sunday of November, Memorial Drive is closed to traffic between Western Avenue and Mount Auburn Street, and open for leaf peeping. Open in Google Maps.8) Acorn Street BostonPerhaps Boston’s most visually iconic street, Acorn Street in Beacon Hill is the epitome of New England fall lined with cobblestones and historic brick homes. In the fall the brilliant autumnal colors make it look even more magical. Do note: the neighbors on Acorn Street can get a little worn out by the tourism so keep a respectful distance when visiting. Open in Google Maps.9) Back Bay FensStroll through the country’s oldest continuously operating Victory Gardens and a series of lawns and greenspace around the Muddy River carefully designed by Frederick Law Olmsted. You’ll still be in the heart of Boston, but it feels like you’ve left the city for a natural oasis. Open in Google Maps. (Photo by Andrea Monari on Flickr)10) Harvard University’s CampusYou may recall the campus in its autumnal glory in 'The Social Network' when the Zuckerberg character gets dumped then runs across campus back to his dorm to begin coding Facebook for the first time. (The scene was actually filmed at Johns Hopkins University, but no worries, Harvard is still a fall foliage wonderland in October.) Come experience it for yourself! The bustling campus filled with fall foliage feels especially cozy in the autumn. Open in Google Maps.11) Cedar Grove CemeteryLocated on the banks of the Neponset River in Dorchester, Cedar Grove Cemetery is a beautiful and carefully maintained map of gardens, ponds, and resting places. It’s also the spot where you can see the retro Mattapan trolley driving through a foliage-flooded track. Find the bridge nearest Adams Street and you'll see the MBTA trolley tracks running through the Cemetery. Open in Google Maps. (Photo by @bucketlistboston)12) Charlestown The streets surrounding Bunker Hill Monument are particularly vibrant. Bonus: many brownstones in the area are also decked out in Halloween decor.  Happy peeping 🍁👀 2024 fall foliage in Boston is expected to peak in mid to late October. Each year, Greater Boston plays host to some of the most vibrant fall foliage colors in the entire world. Besides stepping foot outside your door, or heading to a local park, here are some prime spots around the city to peep fall foliage. 2024 fall foliage map for Boston: Head to newengland.com's peak foliage map to see when leaves are predicted to reach peak around Greater Boston. 1) Mount Auburn Cemetery With over 5,000 trees representing 600+ species, Mount Auburn Cemetery is one of the best places to peep fall foliage in the Boston area. Open in Google Maps. (Photo by @matthewraifman) 2) Boston Public Garden Built in 1837, Boston Public Garden was the first botanical garden in the United States. Naturally, the park turns into a foliage wonderland in October. Be sure to check out the adjacent Boston Common for bonus foliage. Open in Google Maps. (Photo by @kylekleinphoto) 3) Charles River Esplanade With a population of 1,700 trees, the Charles River Esplanade turns all sorts of shades of red, orange, and yellow throughout fall. Open in Google Maps. 4) Commonwealth Avenue The Comm Ave Mall (pictured) really steals the show as far as foliage goes in Back Bay. But the colors don’t stop there. You can peep spectacular foliage all throughout the Back Bay and its bordering neighborhood, the South End, in autumn. Look out for magnificent displays of pumpkins and gourds on residential steps in both neighborhoods. In the South End, check out Rutland Square and Southwest Corridor Park for all those foliage feels. Open in Google Maps. (Photo by @kylekleinphoto) 5) Chandler Pond Hidden gem alert: The above photo might look like it was taken at a pond in a quaint Vermont town, but it’s actually Chandler Pond in Brighton, MA -- 6 miles from Downtown Boston. Open in Google Maps. (Photo by @jackdarylphotography) 6) Arnold Arboretum The Arboretum's collection of almost 5,000 different species put on a fiery display throughout most of the month of October. Open in Google Maps. (Photo by @arnold_arboretum) 7) Memorial Drive Cambridge Memorial Drive, which runs along the Charles River in Cambridge, becomes quite the fall fairyland every October. Bonus: Every Sunday from the last Sunday of April until the second Sunday of November, Memorial Drive is closed to traffic between Western Avenue and Mount Auburn Street, and open for leaf peeping. Open in Google Maps. 8) Acorn Street Boston Perhaps Boston’s most visually iconic street, Acorn Street in Beacon Hill is the epitome of New England fall lined with cobblestones and historic brick homes. In the fall the brilliant autumnal colors make it look even more magical. Do note: the neighbors on Acorn Street can get a little worn out by the tourism so keep a respectful distance when visiting. Open in Google Maps. 9) Back Bay Fens Stroll through the country’s oldest continuously operating Victory Gardens and a series of lawns and greenspace around the Muddy River carefully designed by Frederick Law Olmsted. You’ll still be in the heart of Boston, but it feels like you’ve left the city for a natural oasis. Open in Google Maps. (Photo by Andrea Monari on Flickr) 10) Harvard University’s Campus You may recall the campus in its autumnal glory in 'The Social Network' when the Zuckerberg character gets dumped then runs across campus back to his dorm to begin coding Facebook for the first time. (The scene was actually filmed at Johns Hopkins University, but no worries, Harvard is still a fall foliage wonderland in October.) Come experience it for yourself! The bustling campus filled with fall foliage feels especially cozy in the autumn. Open in Google Maps. 11) Cedar Grove Cemetery Located on the banks of the Neponset River in Dorchester, Cedar Grove Cemetery is a beautiful and carefully maintained map of gardens, ponds, and resting places. It’s also the spot where you can see the retro Mattapan trolley driving through a foliage-flooded track. Find the bridge nearest Adams Street and you'll see the MBTA trolley tracks running through the Cemetery. Open in Google Maps. (Photo by @bucketlistboston) 12) Charlestown The streets surrounding Bunker Hill Monument are particularly vibrant. Bonus: many brownstones in the area are also decked out in Halloween decor. Happy peeping 🍁👀

name: Tree Farm Pop-up
description: Join us for a festive holiday kickoff on November 17th, as we partner with North Pole Xmas Trees to bring the magic of the season to JP! Not only will you have the chance to find your perfect Christmas tree, but you can also dive into the holiday spirit with our ornament-making class – a hands-on experience where you can craft unique decorations for your tree or to give as heartfelt gifts.The day will be packed with holiday cheer, featuring live music to set the mood and a lineup of local vendors! Join us for a festive holiday kickoff on November 17th, as we partner with North Pole Xmas Trees to bring the magic of the season to JP! Not only will you have the chance to find your perfect Christmas tree, but you can also dive into the holiday spirit with our ornament-making class – a hands-on experience where you can craft unique decorations for your tree or to give as heartfelt gifts. The day will be packed with holiday cheer, featuring live music to set the mood and a lineup of local vendors!

name: SNOWPORT: Curling
description: Come visit Snowport's iceless curling lanes brought to you by Mass General Brigham Health Plan.The curling lanes will be open from November 8th - February 28th.Monday-Thursday: 3-8pm, Friday-Saturday: 11am-9pm, Sunday: 11am-8pmClosed on Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day.Each time slot booking will provide you with 1 curling lane reservation for a group of up to 8 people for 30-minutes.Upon arrival, attendees will need to check in at the Guest Services Gondola. We recommend arriving 10 minutes before the start of class to ensure sufficient time for check in. After checking in, please make your way to the curling lanes.If you are unable to make your slot, or feel unwell, please do not worry. Simply cancel your reservation on Eventbrite to make room for someone on the waitlist.All ages are welcome and no experience is required. Warm, loose-fitting, comfortable clothing is recommended.Extended Hours: December 9th-31st and February 17th-28thSunday-Thursday: 11am-8pm, Friday-Saturday: 11am-9pm. Come visit Snowport's iceless curling lanes brought to you by Mass General Brigham Health Plan. The curling lanes will be open from November 8th - February 28th. Monday-Thursday: 3-8pm, Friday-Saturday: 11am-9pm, Sunday: 11am-8pm Closed on Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day. Each time slot booking will provide you with 1 curling lane reservation for a group of up to 8 people for 30-minutes. Upon arrival, attendees will need to check in at the Guest Services Gondola. We recommend arriving 10 minutes before the start of class to ensure sufficient time for check in. After checking in, please make your way to the curling lanes. If you are unable to make your slot, or feel unwell, please do not worry. Simply cancel your reservation on Eventbrite to make room for someone on the waitlist. All ages are welcome and no experience is required. Warm, loose-fitting, comfortable clothing is recommended. Extended Hours: December 9th-31st and February 17th-28th Sunday-Thursday: 11am-8pm, Friday-Saturday: 11am-9pm.

name: Veggie Galaxy $1 Breakfast Sandwiches
description: Veggie Galaxy’s extensive all-day menu reimagines classic diner favorites with vegetarian and vegan twists. To celebrate, Veggie Galaxy will offer $1 breakfast sandwiches (normally $9.99 - $11.99). All four varieties will be available from 9 AM to 11 AM, starting Monday, November 11th - Friday November 15th. One per customer. THE FOUR $1 BREAKFAST SANDWICHES: Great GalaxyOver-easy egg, hash browns, plant-based bacon, cheddar cheese, baby arugula, roasted garlic mayo on a griddled bunVegetarian, vegan optionEgg & CheeseScrambled eggs, Vermont sharp cheddar, baby arugula, roasted garlic mayo on toasted sourdough or English muffinVegetarian, vegan optionSouthwestern Breakfast BurritoChopped seitan corned beef, guacamole, home fries, scrambled egg, cheddar, pickled jalapenos, cilantro in a flour tortillaVegetarian, vegan optionThe CometOver-easy egg, seitan sausage, cheddar, avocado mash, red pepper sauce on a griddled bunVegetarian, vegan optionABOUT VEGGIE GALAXYEstablished in 2011, Veggie Galaxy is a beloved fixture in Boston’s vegetarian and vegan dining scene. The iconic diner and bakery is owned by founding partner Adam Penn, managing partner Michael Bissanti, who opened The Paramount on Charles Street,  The Blarney Stone in Dorchester, and  Four Burgers in Central Square and Deatrich Wise Jr. of the New England Patriots. Bios attached. ABOUT THE MENUVeggie Galaxy’s extensive menu reimagines classic diner favorites with a plant-based twist. The offerings include a variety of vegetarian and vegan dishes, from breakfast staples like vegan pancakes and seitan sausage to comfort food entrées such as veggie burgers and mac & cheese. With all items made from scratch, Veggie Galaxy serves hearty, indulgent meals that cater to both vegetarian and vegan diets, but are familiar and delicious enough to appeal to all. Chef offers daily and weekly specials to reflect the season. ABOUT THE BAKERY The Veggie Galaxy Bakery has an extensive selection of fully vegan pastries and confections, all crafted by pastry chef Miranda Gray. The bakery menu includes a variety of cakes, pies, cookies, cinnamon rolls, brownies and more—all made from scratch and 100% plant-based. Whether it's a decadent Taza Chocolate Layer Cake or the playful Funfetti Birthday Cake, every sweet treat is packed with flavor and free from animal products. Veggie Galaxy’s extensive all-day menu reimagines classic diner favorites with vegetarian and vegan twists. To celebrate, Veggie Galaxy will offer $1 breakfast sandwiches (normally $9.99 - $11.99). All four varieties will be available from 9 AM to 11 AM, starting Monday, November 11th - Friday November 15th. One per customer. THE FOUR $1 BREAKFAST SANDWICHES: Great Galaxy Over-easy egg, hash browns, plant-based bacon, cheddar cheese, baby arugula, roasted garlic mayo on a griddled bun Vegetarian, vegan option Egg & Cheese Scrambled eggs, Vermont sharp cheddar, baby arugula, roasted garlic mayo on toasted sourdough or English muffin Vegetarian, vegan option Southwestern Breakfast Burrito Chopped seitan corned beef, guacamole, home fries, scrambled egg, cheddar, pickled jalapenos, cilantro in a flour tortilla Vegetarian, vegan option The Comet Over-easy egg, seitan sausage, cheddar, avocado mash, red pepper sauce on a griddled bun Vegetarian, vegan option ABOUT VEGGIE GALAXY Established in 2011, Veggie Galaxy is a beloved fixture in Boston’s vegetarian and vegan dining scene. The iconic diner and bakery is owned by founding partner Adam Penn, managing partner Michael Bissanti, who opened The Paramount on Charles Street,  The Blarney Stone in Dorchester, and  Four Burgers in Central Square and Deatrich Wise Jr. of the New England Patriots. Bios attached. ABOUT THE MENU Veggie Galaxy’s extensive menu reimagines classic diner favorites with a plant-based twist. The offerings include a variety of vegetarian and vegan dishes, from breakfast staples like vegan pancakes and seitan sausage to comfort food entrées such as veggie burgers and mac & cheese. With all items made from scratch, Veggie Galaxy serves hearty, indulgent meals that cater to both vegetarian and vegan diets, but are familiar and delicious enough to appeal to all. Chef offers daily and weekly specials to reflect the season. ABOUT THE BAKERY The Veggie Galaxy Bakery has an extensive selection of fully vegan pastries and confections, all crafted by pastry chef Miranda Gray. The bakery menu includes a variety of cakes, pies, cookies, cinnamon rolls, brownies and more—all made from scratch and 100% plant-based. Whether it's a decadent Taza Chocolate Layer Cake or the playful Funfetti Birthday Cake, every sweet treat is packed with flavor and free from animal products.

name: Friendsgiving at The Fed at The Langham, Boston
categories: Date Idea, Food, Good for Groups, Nightlife
description: The Fed at The Langham, Boston announced today it will be celebrating the giving season by offering a Friendsgiving-themed dining experience starting November 16 through November 30. This Friendsgiving experience will feature a special pre-fixe menu at $60 per person served family-style based on number of guests. Friendsgiving reservations can be made via OpenTable or by calling (617) 956-8765. While reservations are preferred, walk-ins are welcome! The Fed at The Langham, Boston announced today it will be celebrating the giving season by offering a Friendsgiving-themed dining experience starting November 16 through November 30. This Friendsgiving experience will feature a special pre-fixe menu at $60 per person served family-style based on number of guests. Friendsgiving reservations can be made via OpenTable or by calling (617) 956-8765. While reservations are preferred, walk-ins are welcome!

name: 10+ Festive Pop-up Bars & Restaurants in Boston to Visit During the 2024 Holiday Season
description: There’s so much to love about the holiday season, but one of the hallmarks is certainly festive food and drink. These are some of the most fabulous holiday and winter pop-ups at bars and restaurants around the city, so you can bask in a winter wonderland of decor, craft cocktails, and celebratory snacks. by Celina ColbyExperiences listed by opening date 1) Festive Yurts at The BoweryWhen: 11/4-3/31Where: DorchesterInfo: The cold never bothered us anyway, certainly not at the cozy yurts at The Bowery. Surrounded by glowing Christmas trees and decked out for a holiday meal, these yurts make for a very special winter dining experience.2) Holiday-themed bars at the Seaport Holiday MarketWhen: 11/8-12/29Where: SeaportInfo: After you’ve shopped ‘till you drop at the Seaport Holiday Market, head to the food and beverage lounge inside the massive marketplace. You’ll find four holiday themed bars, including the classic Jingle Bar, mixing up special holiday drinks, plus tons of local food vendors.3) APRÈS…at Deck 12When: 11/11-3/3Where: SeaportInfo: Enjoy the apres part of skiing without having to leave Boston. Dine on sweet or savory fondue in a heated ski gondola on the roof of Yotel in the Seaport. Cozy up in blankets overlooking the Boston skyline and toast with warm and themed winter cocktails.4) Upside Down Holiday Trees at the Liberty Hotel Lobby BarWhen: 11/11-12/31Where: Beacon HillInfo: ‘Tis the season for the Liberty Hotel lobby bar to transform into a seasonal oasis. The hotel famously hangs dozens of glistening Christmas trees upside down from the ceiling, creating a magical setting for your evening cocktail.5) Santa's Cantina at Loco FenwayWhen: 11/14-1/13Where: FenwayInfo: The huge Loco Taqueria Fenway location has been transformed into a Santa-friendly winter wonderland this season. Sip on a holiday-themed cocktail and order of a holiday prix fixe lunch menu.6) Miracle Pop-up Bar at Mystic StationWhen: 11/20-12/31Where: MaldenInfo: The Mystic Station Eatery & Bar gets completely transformed every holiday season, decked out in thousands of twinkle lights and other decorations. Take shots off a ski, sample seasonal menu items, and much more.7) Holly Jolly Bar at HarpoonWhen: 11/21-1/4 Where: SeaportInfo: Immerse yourself in the holiday season at this pop-up bar where tinsel rains from floor to ceiling and ornaments glimmer from every corner. Your ticket includes a welcome cocktail but there are plenty of other festive cocktails and mocktails to try.8) Sippin' Santa at Shore LeaveWhen: 11/26-12/31Where: South EndInfo: Don your ugliest Christmas sweater and head to Shore Leave for their Sippin’ Santa holiday cocktail pop-up. The space is completely decked out in nostalgic holiday decor and the menu features goodies like hot buttered rum, a ginger snapper shot, and much more.9) Miracle Pop-up Bar at the Kimpton Marlowe HotelWhen: 11/29-12/24Where: CambridgeInfo: Miracles don’t only happen in Malden. Every year the Kimpton Marlowe Hotel transforms into a winter wonderland complete with a 6-foot-tall Santa, delightfully kitschy holiday decor, and festive themed cocktails served in whimsical glassware.10) Maccabee Hanukkah Pop-Up BarWhen: 12/2-1/1Where: Harvard SquareInfo: Celebrate Hanukkah with delightful themed drinks and snacks at the Maccabee pop-up bar in the Charles Hotel. Manischewitz takes on a whole new flavor when it’s shaken up in a craft cocktail.11) Publico’s Winter Market Holiday Pop-upWhen: 12/6-12/31Where: South BostonInfo: Skip the pricey air fare and visit a European-style winter market right here in Boston at the new Publico pop-up. Feature a massive 16-foot Christmas tree and twinkling lights hanging from every rafter, you can gather around a firepit and enjoy festive food and beverages all month long.TBA:The Holidays at One DaltonWhen: TBAWhere: Back BayInfo: One Dalton is celebrating the season with a few different festivities including a lavish bar of chocolate creations, 12 Days of Cocktails at Trifecta, Holiday Afternoon Tea, and more activities, all including holiday-themed food and drinks. Each space on the property is as lavishly decorated as the food served. OUTSIDE OF THE CITY: 12) Holiday Pop-Up at The VenetianWhen: 11/1-1/31Where: Weymouth, MAInfo: This neighborhood Italian restaurant on the South Shore goes all out for the holidays. The restaurant’s entire ceiling is draped with hundreds of yards of garland and almost 6,000 ornaments and each corner has a different themed installation. The menu pairs special holiday cocktails with classic Italian pastas and apps.13) INNgloo Wonderland at Inn at Hastings ParkWhen: 11/1-4/2Where: Lexington, MAInfo: Embrace the winter season by dining in one of Inn at Hastings Park’s outdoor igloos this season. Decorate like the interior of a charming ski lodge cabin, the igloos are fully heated and make a cozy background for winter dinner, lunch, or brunch. Each space on the property is as lavishly decorated as the food served. OUTSIDE OF THE CITY: 12) Holiday Pop-Up at The Venetian When: 11/1-1/31 Where: Weymouth, MA Info: This neighborhood Italian restaurant on the South Shore goes all out for the holidays. The menu pairs special holiday cocktails with classic Italian pastas and apps. 13) INNgloo Wonderland at Inn at Hastings Park When: 11/1-4/2 Where: Lexington, MA Info: Embrace the winter season by dining in one of Inn at Hastings Park’s outdoor igloos this season. name: 100 things to do in Boston for $10 or less: November 2024
categories: Animals, Art, Classes, Date Idea, Drinks, Farms, Festivals & Fairs, Food, Games, Good for Groups, History, Innovation, Kid Friendly, LGBTQ+, Lectures & Conferences, Meetup, Movies, Music, Nature, Nightlife, Outside, Party, Pet Friendly, Photoworthy, Rainy Day Ideas, Seasonal, Shopping, Shows, Social Good, Sports & Active Life
description: Happy November, my Boston friends. This month marks many seasons of change. Catch the final days of fall foliage before a Boston winter arrives. Enjoy autumn parties and festivities and welcome the holiday season with markets and city-wide lightings. As 2024 begins to draw to a close soon, enjoy time with friends and family with 100 free and cheap activities in November.By Yelena Nicolle Salvador1) Día de Los Muertos Celebration at Time OutWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: FenwayCost: FreeInfo: Head to Time Out Market for an evening of cultural festivities. Celebrate the Day of the Dead with live music, food and drink specials, and other fun surprises. There will be glitter tattoos and an evening of dance and laughs.2) Nauti Halloween Party on Dia de los MuertosWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: SeaportCost: FreeInfo: Head to Nautical Pier 4 in Seaport for a continuation of Boston Halloween right along the stunning waterfront. With no cover charge, this Nauti Halloween party will have spooky decor and a live DJ. Costumes are highly encouraged.3) SoWa First FridayWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: South EndCost: FreeInfo: Looking for the perfect way to feel inspired and hide away from the cold? Stroll through SoWa and hop into the open galleries where you can meet local artists, find your next gift, and enjoy the art around you.4) 20s & 30s Mingle and Social at Aeronaut BreweryWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: SomervilleCost: FreeInfo: Head to Aeronaut Brewery for a fun evening of getting to meet new friends. As you grab a brew, chat with young folks in the city and play some board games to break the ice. This is a great way to grow your community!5) Dock-tober Frights: A Halloween Bash with Downeast Cider!When: Fri. 11/1Where: The EsplanadeCost: $10Info: Downeast Cider is hosting the ultimate Halloween bash along the water of the Charles. Enjoy specialty and spooky cocktails, eerie music and games, a costume contest, and a whole lot of fun.6) Grrrl Talk at Remnant SatelliteWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: CambridgeCost: FreeInfo: Calling all my ladies! This event is made by women and for women. Listen to vinyl classics, grab a drink, and get to know other femmes at this evening experience for ladies, friends, and lovers! 7) Free Coworking Day at The SubstationWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: RoslindaleCost: FreeInfo: Looking to change the scenery of your WFH setup? Come test out a new space at the Substation where you can work while you enjoy free coffee, snacks, and pastries. Plus, you can meet other folks who WFH and make new friends!8) NaNoWriMo Write-InWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: RoxburyCost: FreeInfo: November is known as National Novel Writing Month. Get your story started and meet fellow writers at this community event. You’ll get to chat, brainstorm, and cheer each other on.9) Friday Night Trivia at TridentWhen: Every Friday, starting 11/1Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: Trivia nights are a cozy getaway from the cold. Head to the local favorite Trident to meet some new friends, learn some fun facts, and have a laugh.10) Voting, Democracy, Rights and RepresentationWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: WalthamCost: FreeInfo: Make your way to the Rose Art Museum at Brandeis for an evening of art and history. Stay for the discussion about certain pieces on view that touch on American politics, values, and more. Afterwards, there will be voter registration and absentee ballot resources.11) The 12 Best Neighborhoods in Boston to See Halloween DecorationsWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: BostonCost: FreeInfo: Yes, it’s November, but try to sneak in the final days of Halloween decorations around Boston before they’re gone for the season. It’s the perfect way to soak in some sun, explore Boston neighborhoods, and take photos before we must wait another year for spooky fun.12) 11 Places to See Fall Foliage in/around BostonWhen: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1Where: BostonCost: FreeInfo: Foliage is at its peak! Go outside for a solo stroll or a fun walk with friends and breathe in the crisp air. You’ll find stunning views of Boston and its fiery shades of orange and red at our favorite spots in this list.13) 11 Unique Places to Peep Fall Foliage in New EnglandWhen: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1Where: BostonCost: FreeInfo: Looking for a fall getaway? Have no fear, we got you covered. Head to these small towns for a stunning car ride. Chase some fall foliage around New England for great photos and memories.14) 10 Weekly Football Watch Parties in BostonWhen: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1Where: BostonCost: FreeInfo: There’s a lively place to cheer on your favorite teams every day around Boston. Check out our list of venues that host weekly watch parties where you can meet new friends, eat some bar food, and get rowdy as you show your pride. 15) How to Make Friends in Boston: Part 3 - Fall EditionWhen: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1Where: BostonCost: FreeInfo: Whether you just moved to the area or you’re looking to expand your community, here are some ideas for how to grow your social circle. There’s a lot of opportunities through book clubs, craft nights, conversation meet-ups, socials, and sporting events. 16) 9th Annual Waldocon Boston Bar CrawlWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: DowntownCost: FreeInfo: One of Boston’s favorite bar crawls is back for the 9th year – Waldocon! So, take out your red and white striped shirt (or make one using colored duct tape) and bar hop around Boston. It’s a great way to support a good cause since proceeds go to the Boston Children’s Hospital and you can meet new friends. 17) Día de los Muertos at Bow MarketWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: SomervilleCost: FreeInfo: Head to Bow Market for an evening of cultural celebrations for the Day of the Dead. Bring your friends and family to enjoy yummy food like the traditional pan de Muerto, drink specials, two DJs and a mariachi band performance, craft vendors, and so much more. There will be an ofrenda to pay your respects as well.18) Be-In Joy Boston FestivalWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: Boston CommonCost: FreeInfo: Make your way out to the Boston Common to relish in the beauty of a Boston fall and to rediscover joy at this new festival that’s all about spreading positivity and happiness. Take a moment away from the worries of the world and meet new people with conversational prompts, dance lessons, and other community-building activities that encourage you to take a break from the stressors in your life and be in the moment. 19) Día de los Muertos FestivalWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: CambridgeCost: FreeInfo: Learn about and experience Mexican culture at this Day of the Dead Festival in Cambridge. Sip on hot chocolate, munch on ‘bread of the dead,’ and cheer on a festive procession that celebrates the beauty of life. There will be music, craft vendors, and more. 20) FOUND Fall Vintage Market and Scavenger HuntWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: CambridgeCost: FreeInfo: Your favorite organizer of all-things vintage is popping up at Cambridge Crossing for their Fall Vintage Market event. Not only will there be 50 of New England’s best vintage sellers, but there will also be a beer garden, music, and a scavenger hunt where you can win prizes and discounts to local retailers.21) Vintage After Dark MarketWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: FenwayCost: FreeInfo: Head to Time Out Market after the sun sets for another vintage event. You can enjoy free Culture Pop sodas as you hunt for your next treasure amongst the lineup of great vendors. When you’re done, grab a bite and sip on special cocktails for the event at Time Out Market.22) Día de los Muertos at Naco TacoWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: Central SquareCost: FreeInfo: Naco Taco is hosting a Day of the Dead celebration that you do not want to miss. Head on over for free tequila tastings and an evening of music, dancing, and of course, great food. Don’t forget to RSVP to the event so you can enjoy free chips and salsa too!23) Veronica Rables Female Mariachi: Día de los MuertosWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: Listen to the beautiful sounds of Veronica Rables’s all-female mariachi band. You’ll be able to experience the spirit of the holiday as you enjoy this free concert and you can watch Mexican folkloric dance performances that will accompany the music. 24) GBH November Outspoken SaturdaysWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: Head to GBH at the Boston Public Library to meet fellow artists and writers. Whether you would like to perform a piece for the first time or you’re a seasoned spoken word artist or you just want to come and listen, everyone is welcome to join and feel inspired at this community event.25) Brewery Book Fair by BookwormWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: DorchesterCost: FreeInfo: Make your way to Dorchester Brewing Co. for a brewery book fair! Bookworm, a mobile bookstore from Quincy, will be popping up with new reads for you to enjoy during this cozy season.26) The Wicked Circular MarketWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: This unique market is focused on zero waste, so stop by and get your holiday shopping done early or find a gift for yourself. Shop from vendors that focus on upcycling, get your Halloween costume repaired or swap it, and meet local organizations that are working towards sustainability and a greener planet. 27) The Great Pumpkin SmashWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: Jamaica PlainCost: FreeInfo: Don’t let your pumpkins sit on your porch and rot. Come bring them to this family-friendly event where you can donate your pumpkins and watch them get smashed into compost! There will be other fun pumpkin-smashing activities and Olympic-style games for kids. 28) Pickleball Day Party at Club VoloWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: Assembly RowCost: FreeInfo: It’s the final Pickleball Day Party of the season at Club Volo. Come out, meet new friends, sip on a brew from Downeast, and try your hand at this popular sport. 29) Somerville Winter Farmers MarketWhen: Every Saturday, starting Sat. 11/2Where: SomervilleCost: FreeInfo: You heard it right, there’s still farmers markets to get fresh produce despite the chilly weather. Head to the Armory for this weekly market that will feature over 70 local vendors. It’s the perfect place to grab ingredients for a warm soup and other fun recipes. 30) All She Wrote x Juliet Book Club: Sacha Lamb's The Forbidden BookWhen: Sun. 11/3Where: SomervilleCost: $5Info: More book clubs, please! Come to this get together where you can discuss an exciting book about queerness, identity, and hope with the author themself. Learn about their writing process and enjoy cozy vibes with fellow book lovers.31) Dia de Muertos FestivalWhen: Sun. 11/3Where: EastieCost: FreeInfo: Eastie is hosting a festive celebration for Dia de Muertos. Stop by the ICA Watershed for a colorful procession, shop from local art and food vendors, and spend some quality time with friends and family at this community party.32) Open House at The Colonial Society of MAWhen: Sun. 11/3Where: Beacon HillCost: FreeInfo: Explore the historic floors of this 19th-century home. Built in 1807, The Colonial Society's Headquarters still stands strong with collections of 19th century furniture and art on display for you to enjoy. 33) SoWa Sundays When: Every Sunday, starting Sun. 11/3Where: South EndCost: FreeInfo: There’s four SoWa Sundays this month, so you’ll always have a cozy way to kick off your week. Feel inspired as you walk through the galleries of local artists and talk to the creators too! 34) Appraisal Day at the Loring Greenough HouseWhen: Sun. 11/3Where: Jamaica PlainCost: FreeInfo: Come watch the local version of ‘Antiques Roadshow’ at the Loring Greenough House. See what treasures your neighbors are housing or bring your own historic pieces of art, furniture, and other knick knacks to see how much they’re really worth. 35) Movie Mondays: The King's Speech (2011)When: Mon. 11/4Where: BrightonCost: FreeInfo: Enjoy a movie without the big price tag. Head to the Brighton Public Library for their Movie Monday events where you can watch a feature film with others.36) Slam AdamsWhen: Mon. 11/4Where: Jamaica PlainCost: $4Info: It’s time for a poetry slam competition. Come compete or just watch the exciting performances of artists on stage at the Sam Adams Brewery for their monthly Slam Adams event.37) Free Chicken Wings - Monday NightsWhen: Every Monday, starting 11/4 until 11/11Where: Back Bay and SeaportCost: FreeInfo: Cheer on your favorite teams at this weekly Monday night football event. Yes, you read it right — enjoy free chicken wings while supplies last as you kick off the week and watch some sports. 38) 50¢ Wings for Monday Night FootballWhen: Every Monday, starting 11/4Where: SomervilleCost: 50¢Info: Yes. You read it right. Chicken wings for less than a dollar, all while cheering for your favorite football team on the big screen. Head to Olde Magoun’s Saloon for some Monday Night Football shenanigans.39) Free Monday Night Football Watch Party at PrimitivWhen: Every Monday, starting 11/4 until 11/25Where: Financial DistrictCost: FreeInfo: RSVP to these small watch party gatherings at Primitiv where you can meet new friends and munch on complimentary snacks. This event is perfect for cannabis enthusiasts and football fans to hang out, grab a beer, watch some sports, and mingle. 40) Free Ping Pong on Election Day at SPIN BostonWhen: Tue. 11/5Where: SeaportCost: FreeInfo: Don’t forget to vote! And bring some proof like an ‘I Voted’ sticker to enjoy a free hour of ping pong at SPIN. This event is the perfect way to release some election anxiety, have a blast, and enjoy some food and drinks.41) Election Night Watch Party at MiddlesexWhen: Tue. 11/5Where: CambridgeCost: FreeInfo: Don’t stress about election night alone. Head to this watch party and stay for the after-party vibes for some democracy celebrations. This event is about being in community together, no matter the results — come through.42) Hooks and BooksWhen: Tue. 11/5Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: It’s getting chilly out there which makes it the perfect time to nest and craft. But who said you have to do it alone? Head to Trident for an evening of community crafting, reading, and chatting with new friends.43) Test Print TuesdayWhen: Every Tuesday, starting Tue. 11/5Where: AllstonCost: FreeInfo: Come learn about the printing process with local artists. Each week will feature new designs, new creators, and more fun. 44) Free Day at the Isabella Stewart Gardner MuseumWhen: Wed. 11/6Where: FenwayCost: FreeInfo: Looking for a place to relax after this election season? Head to the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum for free where you can find peace amongst art and a stunning, flowering courtyard. Learn about Isabella’s life of civic duty and stewardship and transport yourself to new worlds as you get lost in creative works from all over the world. 45) Cider in the City Community FestivalWhen: Wed. 11/6Where: BrooklineCost: FreeInfo: This small but mighty farm is hosting a favorite community event: their Cider in the City Festival. There will be a beer and cider garden featuring local crews and nonalcoholic options too. Bring your friends and family to enjoy an evening filled with craft vendors, firepits, music from JP Honk, cider pressing, and more!46) Indigenous Women's Healing EmpowermentWhen: Wed. 11/6Where: Long WharfCost: FreeInfo: Head to the New England Aquarium for this discussion about Indigenous healing practices. You’ll meet Sara Melcher, a Mi’kmaq nurse, coach, Reiki master, and entrepreneur who will guide you through self-care skills and techniques. 47) All She Wrote x Park 9 Book Club: Jessa Maxwell's The Golden SpoonWhen: Wed. 11/6Where: EverrettCost: $5Info: Yes! Another book club! We love it! Come to Park 9 Dog Bar for a fun chat about this month’s thriller. It’s a great way to get out with your pup and meet fellow book worms.48) Albertine French Film FestivalWhen: Select days, starting Wed. 11/6Where: WalthamCost: FreeInfo: Watch a series of movies from contemporary filmmakers at Brandeis. You’ll be able to enjoy talks with directors, film critics, and more after the feature.49) Night Cap Cafe Lounge Pop-UpWhen: Select days, starting Wed. 11/6 until Thu. 11/21Where: City HallCost: FreeInfo: An exciting limited-time pop-up night cafe is coming to City Hall for eight nights only. Every evening has a different activity from a listening lounge with rotating DJs, comedy nights, a collab night with Rebel-Rebel, and more. Don’t miss your chance to stop by and have a warm cup of Joe in community with others. Plus, bring a mug and get $1 off your brew. 50) Diwali at the Museum of Fine ArtsWhen: Thu. 11/7Where: FenwayCost: $5Info: Come celebrate the Festival of Lights at the MFA. This evening event will feature art, performances, and other cultural festivities. So stop by after a long day, wander through the galleries of South Asian art, and connect with folks in the community. 51) Space Age Exotica Lounge PartyWhen: Thu. 11/7Where: SomervilleCost: FreeInfo: Bring your intergalactic self and dance at this exotica lounge party featuring DJs spinning space age music tracks. Mid century attire is encouraged and prizes will be awarded to the best outfits!52 ) Free First Thursdays at the Isabella Stewart Gardner MuseumWhen: Thu. 11/7Where: FenwayCost: FreeInfo: Head to the Gardner for their free first Thursday event. If you didn’t snag a ticket, get there early to see if there are any available spots on site. You’ll be able to explore art from all over the world and rest in the stunning courtyard with colorful florals.53) New Girl TriviaWhen: Thu. 11/7Where: Back BayCost: $7Info: To all my ‘New Girl’ fans, we know it’s not fall without binge watching New Girl’s Halloween and Thanksgiving episodes. Put your knowledge to the test with other fans at Trident’s specially-themed trivia. Let’s see who gets crowned the ‘True American’!54) Fashionably LATE Fashion Shows at the LibertyWhen: Every Thursday, starting Thu. 11/7 until 11/21Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: Head to the Liberty lobby every Thursday to watch photo worthy fashion shows. Models will be wearing garments by local designers and strut their stuff on tables, down escalators, and through the hotel floors.
