Happy November, my Boston friends. This month marks many seasons of change. Catch the final days of fall foliage before a Boston winter arrives. Enjoy autumn parties and festivities and welcome the holiday season with markets and city-wide lightings. As 2024 begins to draw to a close soon, enjoy time with friends and family with 100 free and cheap activities in November. By Yelena Nicolle Salvador 1) Día de Los Muertos Celebration at Time Out When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Fenway Cost: Free Info: Head to Time Out Market for an evening of cultural festivities. Celebrate the Day of the Dead with live music, food and drink specials, and other fun surprises. There will be glitter tattoos and an evening of dance and laughs. 2) Nauti Halloween Party on Dia de los Muertos When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Seaport Cost: Free Info: Head to Nautical Pier 4 in Seaport for a continuation of Boston Halloween right along the stunning waterfront. With no cover charge, this Nauti Halloween party will have spooky decor and a live DJ. Costumes are highly encouraged. 3) SoWa First Friday When: Fri. 11/1 Where: South End Cost: Free Info: Looking for the perfect way to feel inspired and hide away from the cold? Stroll through SoWa and hop into the open galleries where you can meet local artists, find your next gift, and enjoy the art around you. 4) 20s & 30s Mingle and Social at Aeronaut Brewery When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Somerville Cost: Free Info: Head to Aeronaut Brewery for a fun evening of getting to meet new friends. As you grab a brew, chat with young folks in the city and play some board games to break the ice. This is a great way to grow your community! 5) Dock-tober Frights: A Halloween Bash with Downeast Cider! When: Fri. 11/1 Where: The Esplanade Cost: $10 Info: Downeast Cider is hosting the ultimate Halloween bash along the water of the Charles. Enjoy specialty and spooky cocktails, eerie music and games, a costume contest, and a whole lot of fun. 6) Grrrl Talk at Remnant Satellite When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Cambridge Cost: Free Info: Calling all my ladies! This event is made by women and for women. Listen to vinyl classics, grab a drink, and get to know other femmes at this evening experience for ladies, friends, and lovers! 7) Free Coworking Day at The Substation When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Roslindale Cost: Free Info: Looking to change the scenery of your WFH setup? Come test out a new space at the Substation where you can work while you enjoy free coffee, snacks, and pastries. Plus, you can meet other folks who WFH and make new friends! 8) NaNoWriMo Write-In When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Roxbury Cost: Free Info: November is known as National Novel Writing Month. Get your story started and meet fellow writers at this community event. You’ll get to chat, brainstorm, and cheer each other on. 9) Friday Night Trivia at Trident When: Every Friday, starting 11/1 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Trivia nights are a cozy getaway from the cold. Head to the local favorite Trident to meet some new friends, learn some fun facts, and have a laugh. 10) Voting, Democracy, Rights and Representation When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Waltham Cost: Free Info: Make your way to the Rose Art Museum at Brandeis for an evening of art and history. Stay for the discussion about certain pieces on view that touch on American politics, values, and more. Afterwards, there will be voter registration and absentee ballot resources. 11) The 12 Best Neighborhoods in Boston to See Halloween Decorations When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Boston Cost: Free Info: Yes, it’s November, but try to sneak in the final days of Halloween decorations around Boston before they’re gone for the season. It’s the perfect way to soak in some sun, explore Boston neighborhoods, and take photos before we must wait another year for spooky fun. 12) 11 Places to See Fall Foliage in/around Boston When: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1 Where: Boston Cost: Free Info: Foliage is at its peak! Go outside for a solo stroll or a fun walk with friends and breathe in the crisp air. You’ll find stunning views of Boston and its fiery shades of orange and red at our favorite spots in this list. 13) 11 Unique Places to Peep Fall Foliage in New England When: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1 Where: Boston Cost: Free Info: Looking for a fall getaway? Have no fear, we got you covered. Head to these small towns for a stunning car ride. Chase some fall foliage around New England for great photos and memories. 14) 10 Weekly Football Watch Parties in Boston When: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1 Where: Boston Cost: Free Info: There’s a lively place to cheer on your favorite teams every day around Boston. Check out our list of venues that host weekly watch parties where you can meet new friends, eat some bar food, and get rowdy as you show your pride. 15) How to Make Friends in Boston: Part 3 - Fall Edition When: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1 Where: Boston Cost: Free Info: Whether you just moved to the area or you’re looking to expand your community, here are some ideas for how to grow your social circle. There’s a lot of opportunities through book clubs, craft nights, conversation meet-ups, socials, and sporting events. 16) 9th Annual Waldocon Boston Bar Crawl When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Downtown Cost: Free Info: One of Boston’s favorite bar crawls is back for the 9th year – Waldocon! So, take out your red and white striped shirt (or make one using colored duct tape) and bar hop around Boston. It’s a great way to support a good cause since proceeds go to the Boston Children’s Hospital and you can meet new friends. 17) Día de los Muertos at Bow Market When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Somerville Cost: Free Info: Head to Bow Market for an evening of cultural celebrations for the Day of the Dead. There will be an ofrenda to pay your respects as well. 18) Be-In Joy Boston Festival When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Boston Common Cost: Free Info: Make your way out to the Boston Common to relish in the beauty of a Boston fall and to rediscover joy at this new festival that’s all about spreading positivity and happiness. Don’t forget to RSVP to the event so you can enjoy free chips and salsa too! 23) Veronica Rables Female Mariachi: Día de los Muertos When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Listen to the beautiful sounds of Veronica Rables’s all-female mariachi band. You’ll be able to experience the spirit of the holiday as you enjoy this free concert and you can watch Mexican folkloric dance performances that will accompany the music. 24) GBH November Outspoken Saturdays When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Head to GBH at the Boston Public Library to meet fellow artists and writers. Bookworm, a mobile bookstore from Quincy, will be popping up with new reads for you to enjoy during this cozy season. 26) The Wicked Circular Market When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: This unique market is focused on zero waste, so stop by and get your holiday shopping done early or find a gift for yourself. Yes, you read it right — enjoy free chicken wings while supplies last as you kick off the week and watch some sports. 38) 50¢ Wings for Monday Night Football When: Every Monday, starting 11/4 Where: Somerville Cost: 50¢ Info: Yes. But who said you have to do it alone? Head to Trident for an evening of community crafting, reading, and chatting with new friends. 43) Test Print Tuesday When: Every Tuesday, starting Tue. 11/5 Where: Allston Cost: Free Info: Come learn about the printing process with local artists. Each week will feature new designs, new creators, and more fun. 44) Free Day at the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum When: Wed. 11/6 Where: Fenway Cost: Free Info: Looking for a place to relax after this election season? Head to the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum for free where you can find peace amongst art and a stunning, flowering courtyard. Learn about Isabella’s life of civic duty and stewardship and transport yourself to new worlds as you get lost in creative works from all over the world. 45) Cider in the City Community Festival When: Wed. 11/6 Where: Brookline Cost: Free Info: This small but mighty farm is hosting a favorite community event: their Cider in the City Festival. There will be a beer and cider garden featuring local crews and nonalcoholic options too. Bring your friends and family to enjoy an evening filled with craft vendors, firepits, music from JP Honk, cider pressing, and more! 46) Indigenous Women's Healing Empowerment When: Wed. 11/6 Where: Long Wharf Cost: Free Info: Head to the New England Aquarium for this discussion about Indigenous healing practices. You’ll meet Sara Melcher, a Mi’kmaq nurse, coach, Reiki master, and entrepreneur who will guide you through self-care skills and techniques. 47) All She Wrote x Park 9 Book Club: Jessa Maxwell's The Golden Spoon When: Wed. 11/6 Where: Everrett Cost: $5 Info: Yes! Another book club! We love it! Come to Park 9 Dog Bar for a fun chat about this month’s thriller. It’s a great way to get out with your pup and meet fellow book worms. 48) Albertine French Film Festival When: Select days, starting Wed. 11/6 Where: Waltham Cost: Free Info: Watch a series of movies from contemporary filmmakers at Brandeis. You’ll be able to enjoy talks with directors, film critics, and more after the feature. 49) Night Cap Cafe Lounge Pop-Up When: Select days, starting Wed. 11/6 until Thu. 11/21 Where: City Hall Cost: Free Info: An exciting limited-time pop-up night cafe is coming to City Hall for eight nights only. Every evening has a different activity from a listening lounge with rotating DJs, comedy nights, a collab night with Rebel-Rebel, and more. Don’t miss your chance to stop by and have a warm cup of Joe in community with others. Plus, bring a mug and get $1 off your brew. 50) Diwali at the Museum of Fine Arts When: Thu. 11/7 Where: Fenway Cost: $5 Info: Come celebrate the Festival of Lights at the MFA. This evening event will feature art, performances, and other cultural festivities. So stop by after a long day, wander through the galleries of South Asian art, and connect with folks in the community. 51) Space Age Exotica Lounge Party When: Thu. 11/7 Where: Somerville Cost: Free Info: Bring your intergalactic self and dance at this exotica lounge party featuring DJs spinning space age music tracks. Mid century attire is encouraged and prizes will be awarded to the best outfits! 52 ) Free First Thursdays at the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum When: Thu. 11/7 Where: Fenway Cost: Free Info: Head to the Gardner for their free first Thursday event. If you didn’t snag a ticket, get there early to see if there are any available spots on site. You’ll be able to explore art from all over the world and rest in the stunning courtyard with colorful florals. 53) New Girl Trivia When: Thu. 11/7 Where: Back Bay Cost: $7 Info: To all my ‘New Girl’ fans, we know it’s not fall without binge watching New Girl’s Halloween and Thanksgiving episodes. Put your knowledge to the test with other fans at Trident’s specially-themed trivia. Let’s see who gets crowned the ‘True American’! 54) Fashionably LATE Fashion Shows at the Liberty When: Every Thursday, starting Thu. 11/7 until 11/21 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Head to the Liberty lobby every Thursday to watch photo worthy fashion shows. Models will be wearing garments by local designers and strut their stuff on tables, down escalators, and through the hotel floors. Get inspired to change up your wardrobe! 55) Boston International Antiquarian Book Fair When: Fri. 11/8 - Sun. 11/11 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: The 75th International Antiquarian Book Fair will be hosted at Hynes Convention Center. This event is perfect for all the bibliophiles in the city. Come look at old books, meet rare book dealers from all over the world, and enjoy the mysteries and surprises of this three-day market. 56) The Seaport Holiday Market at Snowport When: Every day, starting Fri. 11/8 Where: Seaport Cost: Free Info: The holiday season is officially upon us when Snowport opens! And this year, it’s back and bigger than ever. So, head to Seaport for this famously giant and illuminated winter market. Enjoy new seasonal cocktail bars, festive decor, live music, a heated patio, and of course, over 120 makers to shop from. 57) ‘Knives Out’ Screening When: Sat. 11/9 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Looking for the perfect cozy hideaway? Head to the beloved Trident for a free screening of the thrilling and funny murder mystery, ‘Knives Out.’ Come by and hang with folks to celebrate the autumn season with this feel-good whodunnit. 58) Boston Veterans Parade When: Sat. 11/9 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Honor the lives of the men and women who have served our country at the Boston Veterans Parade. Learn about local organizations, listen to live music, and cheer on the march that will make its way through Back Bay to City Hall. 59) Dancing Brushstrokes: Anubhava Dance Company Performance When: Sat. 11/9 Where: Cambridge Cost: Free Info: Stop by the Harvard Art Museums for a cultural performance featuring South Asian dance sets inspired by paintings from the South Asian collections. This show will blend historical commentary and music and provide a creative, immersive experience for audiences. 60) Arlington Open Studios 2024 When: Sat. 11/9 Where: Arlington Cost: Free Info: Arlington Open Studios is back for its 26th year. Come meet and shop from over 80 local artists as they showcase their talents in painting, sculpture, photography, ceramics, and more. There will also be live music, puppet shows, demos, and poetry performances for everyone to enjoy. 61) Veterans Day Cruise When: Sat. 11/9 Where: Boston Harbor Islands Cost: $5 Info: While it may be cold outside, you can still venture to the Boston Harbor Islands. Grab a ticket to this event for all ages, and enjoy a cruise to Peddocks Island where you can take a guided tour of Fort Andrews, learn about local history, and connect with others. Light snacks and warm beverages will be provided too. 62) Tartuffe When: Select days, starting Sat. 11/9 Where: South End Cost: Free Info: Have a laugh and watch this new theater production by the Hub Theatre Company of Boston. Filled with satire, witty jokes, and great costumes, Tartuffe will leave you out of breath from the giggles. While the show is free, gently used children’s books will be collected for donations too. 63) ND Football Watch Party When: Every Saturday, starting 11/9 Where: Charlestown Cost: Free Info: The Anchor is the official host for Notre Dame watch parties in Boston. Cheer on the Fighting Irish along the waterfront with brews in hand, giant screens so you can’t miss a play, and great company. 64) Fenway Open Studios Weekend Celebration When: Sat. 11/9 - Sun. 11/10 Where: Fenway Cost: Free Info: Fenway Studios is hosting their annual open studios event at their historic building that was built by artists for artists! Learn about the history of this Fenway landmark, stroll through galleries, and meet 20 artists in their elements. You’ll be able to purchase work if you wish or just chat and learn about the artistic process of local creators. Don’t forget to bring a nonperishable food item for donation! 65) Wilson Farm Harvest Festival When: Sat. 11/9 - Sun. 11/10 Where: Lexington Cost: Free Info: Wilson Farm turns 140 years old! Come wish this local farm a very happy birthday at their bash featuring delicious samples, local vendors, carnival games and rides, and other festivities. 66) Veterans Day Weekend at the U.S.S. Constitution Museum When: Sat. 11/9 - Mon. 11/11 Where: Fenway Cost: Free Info: Head to the U.S.S. Constitution Museum for a weekend that celebrates the service of veterans and their families. Veterans can enjoy free admission, guided tours, and other fun activities to honor everyone who has served. 67) 20s & 30s Walk Around Mt. Auburn Cemetery When: Sun. 11/10 Where: Cambridge Cost: Free Info: Fall foliage is still here! But catch it before it’s gone. Come meet new friends and enjoy the stunning views of the city from Mt. Auburn Cemetery. This event is a nice way to get outside, strike a conversation with friendly strangers, and bond! 68) Time Out Fall Festival When: Sun. 11/10 Where: Fenway Cost: Free Info: Join Time Out Market for their Fall Festival where there will be live music, dancing, a hot cocoa bar through Far Out, and other family-friendly activities. There will be giveaways too. Don’t miss the perfect way to say goodbye to the fall season. 69) Poetry Open Mic with Countertop Chants When: Sun. 11/10 Where: Somerville Cost: Free Info: Get cozy and meet new friends at this community event. Whether you’re a writer or poetry enthusiast, you can share something you’ve written or read your favorite poem by an author. Enjoy a beer, live music, art, and quality time with new friends. 70) All She Wrote Books: November Breakfast Club When: Sun. 11/10 Where: Somerville Cost: $5 Info: Head to All She Wrote Books for a breakfast book club to discuss the funny romcom, ‘Just as You Are.’ Coffee, pastries from French bakery Michette, and even better company are guaranteed with your ticket. 71) Boston River Run When: Sun. 11/10 Where: Allston Cost: Free Info: Tell your friends and family to put on their sneakers. It’s time for a fall 5k charity walk or run along the stunning Charles River. All ages and abilities are welcome — the trail is flat with no street-crossing required. 72) Karaoke at Satellite When: Every Sunday, starting Sun. 11/10 Where: Cambridge Cost: Free Info: All that practice in the shower can be put to good use at Satellite. Come to their karaoke events every Sunday to belt out your best song as you grab a bev and a burger. 73) Veggie Galaxy $1 Breakfast Sandwiches When: Every day, starting Mon. 11/11 until Fri. 11/15 Where: Cambridge Cost: Free Info: Veggie Galaxy is whipping up something special! Munch on their yummy breakfast sandwiches (usually $10) for only ONE dollar. It’s a perfect pick-me-up for fall, so don’t miss this great deal. 74) Brian De Lorenzo: Sammy & Sinatra at the Sands When: Tue. 11/12 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Enjoy an evening of cabaret and jazz music with Sammy & Sinatra at the Sands. Grab a drink at the bar and stay for this iconic vocal show. 75) ArtsThursdays: The place where the creek goes underground When: Thu. 11/14 Where: Cambridge Cost: Free Info: Stop by this event for an evening of art. You’ll receive a copy of the art publication that goes hand-in-hand with the exhibition on display. Hear from the artists themselves and mingle with other creatives. 76) November Romance Book Club When: Thu. 11/14 Where: Brighton Cost: Free Info: Another monthly book club has hit the Boston scene to provide you a cozy respite away from the cold. Meet new people, chat over romcom books, and join this bookish community party at the Annex on the Speedway. 77) Boyden Library Fall Book Sale When: Thu. 11/14 - Sat. 11/16 Where: Foxboro Cost: Free Info: Stock up your bookshelves with gently used books as you begin your reading marathon for winter. Head to Foxboro for their book sale and don’t miss their $5 fill-a-bag on Saturday. All proceeds will help towards library programming too. 78) ALTARS, The Live Experience When: Fri. 11/15 Where: Roxbury Cost: Free Info: Celebrate the City of Boston’s Wake Up the Night program with this unforgettable evening of performances featuring local talent. There will be dance pieces, poetry, a short film, music, and more for you to enjoy. 79) Cambridge Symphony Orchestra: Reflect When: Fri. 11/15 Where: Lowell Cost: Free Info: In honor of its 50th anniversary, Cambridge Symphony Orchestra is presenting their first concert of the season with Reflection: A Concert Reflection on War and Peace. Listen to moving music for the evening at this event. 80) 28th Annual New England Craft and Specialty Food Fair When: Fri. 11/15 - Sun. 11/17 Where: Topsfield Cost: $10 Info: You don’t want to miss this iconic annual fair at Topsfield. This three-day shopping event will feature some of the best businesses from the North Shore with over 225 booths and a “food sampling” extravaganza with good from the best chefs, bakers, and more. 81) Sam Adams Maple & Malts Weekend When: Fri. 11/15 - Sun. 11/17 Where: Downtown Cost: Free Info: Head to SA for a fall-themed weekend. Sip on two new exclusive maple brews and munch on a maple menu featuring maple chicken nachos and a maple bruschetta plate to celebrate a chilly New England autumn in Boston. 82) Huge Fall Vintage Clothing Pop-up Thrift Market When: Sat. 11/16 Where: Roxbury Cost: Free Info: Select Markets is hosting one of the biggest vintage markets in MA! Shop from over 90 vendors in a giant space, nibble on snacks from food trucks, grab some free drinks, get a temporary tattoo or a tooth gem, and more. There will be lots of pop-up stalls, immersive activities, $10 piles to thrift, and a whole lot of vintage treasures. 83) Romance Bookshop Pop-up & Free Wine Tasting When: Sat. 11/16 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Head to the Urban Grape to sip on some wine as you shop from a curated selection of books by Read My Lips. There will be merch, gifts, blind dates with a book, vino, and great company. 84) The Yappy Hour After Brunch at The Urban Grape When: Sat. 11/16 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Bring your pup, taste some vino, and learn about the history of wine at this beginner-friendly event for wine lovers and enthusiasts. Polkadog Bakery will be making an appearance with free dog treats too. 85) A Holly Jolly Good Time Holiday Market When: Sat. 11/16 Where: Fenway Cost: Free Info: Kick off the holiday season at Time Out Market where you can shop from queer vendors. There will be lots of unique handmade goods, perfect for holiday gifts, as well as festive cocktails, seasonal snacks, and more. 86) Lamplighter’s Magic 8th Birthday at CX When: Sat. 11/16 Where: Cambridge Cost: $10 Info: Lamplighter is turning 8 years old. Come join the party and wish this neighborhood staple a very happy birthday. There will be exclusive anniversary brews, a photo booth, fortune tellers, and other fun events at this magical, brewful bash. 87) caked up: fruitstand’s 1st birthday Queer Dance Party When: Sat. 11/16 Where: Cambridge Cost: $10 Info: Celebrate the birthday of this queer nightlife event curator: fruitstand! Bring your best moves, the glitter, and the fun, and they’ll provide the ultimate setlist of queer pop hits. Get ready to dance. 88) The Seltzer Factory: Film Screening + Conversation with Writer/Director Paloma Valenzuela When: Mon. 11/18 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Support a local based artist, Paloma Venezuela, and come watch her documentary about navigating family history and identity. There will be a Q&A after to learn more about her creative process and how she ended up in Boston. 89) Silent Disco with Republic Fitness at Somerville Theatre When: Wed. 11/20 Where: Somerville Cost: Free Info: Republic Fitness is hosting a silent disco dance party. Come join the fun, dance your heart out, meet new folks, and learn about upcoming fitness offerings in the neighborhood. 90) ArtsThursdays: Celebrating Native American Craft Brewers When: Thu. 11/21 Where: Cambridge Cost: Free Info: Head to the Harvard Museums of Science and Culture to learn about the art of craft beer making! Stroll through the galleries, meet Indigenous brewers, participate in beer-themed activities, and purchase some local brews. 91) Creatività Italiana When: Thu. 11/21 - Sat. 11/23 Where: South End Cost: Free Info: You don’t have to travel far to feel like you’re in Italy. This three-day festival celebrates everything ‘Made in Italy.’ Experience art, technology, culture, design, and of course, world-class food and wine at this celebration that honors Italian innovation and heritage. 92) Book Club Café When: Sat. 11/23 Where: Allston Cost: Free Info: Meet fellow book lovers at this community event! You can enjoy coffee, tea, light refreshments, and a whole lot of chatter about the best books to read right now. Break out of your reading rut, feel inspired, and connect with other bookish people. 93) SNOWPORT: Learn to Curl When: Every Saturday, starting Sat. 11/23 Where: Seaport Cost: Free Info: Free curling lessons are back this season in Snowport! Book your 30-minute lesson and practice the basics of this sport on the iceless lanes with guidance from the North End Curling Club! 94) 2024 Annual Trellis Lighting at Christopher Columbus Park When: Mon. 11/25 Where: Long Wharf Cost: Free Info: Winter is here. Come see the annual lighting tradition of the Christopher Columbus Park Trellis as it glows blue for all to see. Santa Claus will be making an appearance and you can enjoy hot cocoa, clam chowder, and cookies. 95) Boston’s Official Holiday Tree Arrival 2024 When: Tue. 11/26 Where: Boston Common Cost: Free Info: Come welcome Boston’s official holiday tree which has traveled many miles from Nova Scotia. Learn about the history of this tradition that has been occurring for over 50 years and welcome the Christmas season in our city. 96) Faneuil Hall Marketplace Tree Lighting When: Tue. 11/26 Where: Downtown Cost: Free Info: Bring your friends and family and watch the first Christmas tree light up for the season. There will be festive treats, live performances, and guest appearances to officially mark the beginning of the holiday season in Boston. 97) Boston Public Market’s Holiday Market When: Every Friday to Sunday, starting Fri. 11/29 Where: Downtown Cost: Free Info: Head to the Boston Public Market for your holiday shopping goodies. With a carefully selected lineup of vendors, you’ll find a gift that everyone will love from this holiday market. 98) Kilroy Square Holiday Market When: Fri. 11/29 - Sun. 12/1 Where: Quincy Cost: Free Info: Sip on festive cocktails as you meet Santa Claus and shop from over 90 local vendors. Find the best gift for loved ones this holiday season, enjoy a beer garden, and watch a Christmas parade at this winter market. 99) SoWa Winter Festival 2024 When: Every day, starting Fri. 11/29 Where: South End Cost: $10 Info: The 9th SoWa Winter Festival is back with over 100 local vendors, specialty food and cocktails, food trucks, festive decorations, and more. Shop til you drop at this beloved market favorite. 100) 4th Annual Holiday Ship Lighting at Martin's Park in Seaport When: Sat. 11/30 Where: Seaport Cost: Free Info: Head to Seaport for this annual holiday lighting event. Betty the Yetti and other special guests will be crossing the channel on a boat and landing at Martin’s Park to greet you. Sip on hot cocoa, listen to live music, and watch the kick-off of this holiday light display. BONUS: These things are worth the price! MFA First Friday When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Fenway Cost: $27 Info: Head to the MFA to celebrate the ‘Four Womxn: New Musings on Blackness’ exhibit, make some art, sip on a cocktail, and dance to tunes by DJ Slick Vick. ICA First Friday: Sweater Weather When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Seaport Cost: $35 Info: We love a good after-hours museum party. The ICA is throwing a bash perfectly on theme with fall: Sweater Weather. So, find your comfiest, fluffiest, silliest sweater and head to Seaport for an evening of contemporary art, a photobooth, some drinks, and a whole lot of dancing. Friday Night Yoga & Live Music at the Museum of Modern Renaissance When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Somerville Cost: $35 Info: Grab a ticket to relax at one of the most beautiful museums in Boston. Stretch, breathe, get lost in the sounds of live piano, and let your heart feel inspired by the stunning interior of the Museum of Modern Renaissance. Boston Art Review: Launch Event and Halloween Costume Party When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Chinatown Cost: $25+ Info: Boston Art Review is hosting the ultimate Halloween bash in Chinatown to celebrate their 13th issue. Come dressed in a costume and get ready to dance. Boston Lights: A Lantern Experience at the Zoo When: Fri. 11/1 - Sun. 11/3 Where: Franklin Park Cost: $19.95 Info: It’s the final days of the Boston Lights Lantern Experience at the Franklin Park Zoo. Wander through an illuminated wonderland where you can be transported to an underwater paradise and an enchanted forest kingdom. Renaissance Faire Day at Hammond Castle Museum When: Sat. 11/9 Where: Gloucester Cost: $35 Info: Step into a world of medieval times.Watch high-energy combat demonstrations, listen to Celtic music, explore the castle museum, and grab a bite at a food truck at this jam packed Renaissance day. MIT Museum After Dark: Junk When: Thu. 11/14 Where: Kendall Cost: $20 Info: This museum after party is all about celebrating the beauty of junk. Sip on a drink and listen to a performance by a bicycle rock band. Learn from artists creating fashion pieces out of chopsticks and banana crop waste. Create your own art with ‘MIT junk’ from across campus. And learn all about science and sustainability at this 21+ only event. Immersive Yoga @ The WNDR Museum When: Sat. 11/16 Where: Downtown Cost: $40 Info: Recharge your mind and soul at this yoga experience where you can enjoy a 60-minute practice in the WNDR’s immersive theater, surrounded by stunningly colorful and intricate visuals, as well as enchanting soundscapes.

name: Gingerbread House Decorating Workshop
description: Looking for a fun experience for friends and family? Look no further! Join our expert host and learn easy tips that will take your decorating game up a whole other level.  This workshop will showcase some of the techniques used to create the gorgeous gingerbread houses on display at our shop. What you learn will be transferrable to all future cake and cookie decorating as well.Each guest ticket should be accompanied by a full-priced ticket. Thank you!Materials Included:  Large Gingerbread House with generous amounts of candy, pair of gingerbread people and perfect royal icing.  Duration:  60minLocation:Craft Loft100 CambridgeSide Pl, 2nd floor near TJ MaxxCambridge, MA Parking: Street parking or garage. Unfortunately, we don't validate parking vouchers.*Please see our refund/reschedule policy here.Tipping is not expected but always appreciated! Looking for a fun experience for friends and family? Look no further! Join our expert host and learn easy tips that will take your decorating game up a whole other level.  This workshop will showcase some of the techniques used to create the gorgeous gingerbread houses on display at our shop. What you learn will be transferrable to all future cake and cookie decorating as well. Each guest ticket should be accompanied by a full-priced ticket. Thank you! Materials Included:  Large Gingerbread House with generous amounts of candy, pair of gingerbread people and perfect royal icing. Duration:  60min Location: Craft Loft 100 CambridgeSide Pl, 2nd floor near TJ Maxx Cambridge, MA Parking: Street parking or garage. Unfortunately, we don't validate parking vouchers. *Please see our refund/reschedule policy here. Tipping is not expected but always appreciated!

name: How to Make Friends in Boston: Part 3 - Fall Edition
categories: Art, Classes, Date Idea, Drinks, Games, Good for Groups, LGBTQ+, Meetup, Nature, Party, Photoworthy, Seasonal, Sports & Active Life
description: Your favorite How to Make Friends in Boston series is back with a little twist! Whether you’ve just moved to the city during the fall season or you’re looking for new pals to explore the beauty of Boston as it turns to shades of orange and red, this list has some ideas for how to put yourself out there and grow your community. 🎃By Yelena Nicolle Salvador1) Enjoy cozy activitiesAs the weather turns a bit cooler, you might be feeling the urge to begin to nest inside. No worries, there’s plenty of things to get you to meet folks as you huddle indoors.Check out Pottery With A Purpose, a lovely business that hosts make-your-own pottery mugs, vases, planters, and other containers. Most people come solo to these classes, which are usually small and intimate. It’s a fun way to create, sip on a brew while you channel your inner artist, and talk to your neighbor while having a laugh. Throughout the fall months, they host lots of events that are Halloween-themed like pumpkin pot making and a jack-o-lantern candle holder. Test your knowledge with some trivia around Boston at a different place every day of the week. It’s a nice way to hide away from the impending cold and have a laugh with groups of people over random fun facts.Wine always seems to taste better when it’s a bit chilly out, so stop by local wine shops that are hosting fun social events. Bonde Fine Wine Shop has a weekly Friday Social Club series where four tables are available on a first-come first served basis, so you can enjoy a flight and light bites in an intimate setting. You can bring your own vinyls to add to the ambiance but it must be in line with their weekly theme. Speaking of wine, learn about it in a judgment free zone at free weekly tastings. Local wine shops, like Georgie’s and Urban Grape, host regular classes to meet folks who want to get into the wine scene too.2) Meet others at community reading spacesFall is the perfect time to swaddle up with a book. Grab a tea or a coffee and get ready to chat over your must-reads!Meet some fellow bookworms at local book clubs! In fact, the months of fall usually inspire book clubs to host spooky meetings about thrillers, mysteries, and other haunting novels. Check out your favorite local bookstores who host pop-up book clubs and other events as well. For example, All She Wrote Books has lots of book club events at Juliet Social Club and Park-9. In fact, stop by Side Quest Books and Games, a new woman-owned, fantasy-focused bookstore, that hosts regular monthly book clubs and fun events like “Cozy Hours” where you can vibe with other folks in a small, quiet, heartwarming space. And the local favorite, Trident, hosts fun game nights, free movie showings, and other spooky activities like “Muder Mystery Dinners,” where you can meet new folks as you solve a classic whodunnit.Don’t forget to check out other Spooky Book Events in Boston.3) Cheer on your favorite sports teamsIf you’re looking for something fun and consistent, come cheer on your favorite sports teams at fun bars all over the city. As you sip on a brew, a cocktail, a mocktail, or a soda, and munch on some bar food noms, strike up some easy conversation with the people around you as you make some noise and rep your team.The Anchor hosts weekly Patriots Watch Parties and Notre Dame Watch Parties where you can enjoy waterfront views and some camaraderie. If you’re looking for a different venue to cheer on your favorite teams, join Monday Night Football Watch Parties for free at Primitiv where each evening is capped at 75 guests to ensure an intimate setting to mix and mingle with folks.For even more options for all the football fans, put these 10 Weekly Watch Parties in Boston in your rotation.Check out these spots in Fenway that are great for watching games of all kinds!Some local favorite spots include: ParlorSports, Scores, Phoenix Landing, and Cathedral Station – each with their own weekly updates about what games will be on view!Keep your eyes peeled for more events too as different seasons start throughout the fall months — let’s cheer on our C’s as they go after Banner 19. 4) Attend events for making new friendsLots of local organizations are popping up to host more opportunities for folks to meet new people! Check out these experiences that are coming up in the fall months.Club Volo hosts regular events to connect with others. Join a league while trying a new sport (use ‘JOYRAFT’ for $10 off your first league), head to organized bar outings, and enjoy watch parties too. Don’t forget to stop by one of their free Pickleball Day Parties that happen every Saturday (the last one for this year is on Nov.2). Strawberry Matcha is a new community group that’s hosting meet-ups for people to make friends. Head to their organized outing in Cambridge or at the Public Garden. Don’t forget to fill out their interest form, where they match you every month with a different group of 4-6 folks that they think ~vibe~.The local FB group, How to Make Friends After College, always hosts events that are usually in-theme with the season. Check their listings regularly for new experiences. Some fun ones coming up are a brewery social at Aeronaut Somerville and a foliage walk at Mt. Auburn Cemetery. The Civic Discussion Meetup group adds a twist to meeting people with a common topic already chosen to break the ice. Head to their next event that is promptly named, “How to Make Friends in Boston?,” for a lively chat with strangers about how to build community. Finally, Skip the Small Talk hosts some speed-friending events throughout the year! Head to upcoming experiences at Trident for one where you can meet folks across age groups or a 30s specific event. They bring the prompts, bring yourself and/or a friend!No matter what you choose to explore, just remember to be yourself. A smile and a warm hello can get you far in any of these events, so take a breath and put yourself out there. Happy friend making! Check out Part 1 and Part 2 for other ideas. Your favorite How to Make Friends in Boston series is back with a little twist! Whether you’ve just moved to the city during the fall season or you’re looking for new pals to explore the beauty of Boston as it turns to shades of orange and red, this list has some ideas for how to put yourself out there and grow your community. 🎃 By Yelena Nicolle Salvador 1) Enjoy cozy activities As the weather turns a bit cooler, you might be feeling the urge to begin to nest inside. No worries, there’s plenty of things to get you to meet folks as you huddle indoors. 2) Meet others at community reading spaces Fall is the perfect time to swaddle up with a book. Grab a tea or a coffee and get ready to chat over your must-reads! 3) Cheer on your favorite sports teams If you’re looking for something fun and consistent, come cheer on your favorite sports teams at fun bars all over the city. As you sip on a brew, a cocktail, a mocktail, or a soda, and munch on some bar food noms, strike up some easy conversation with the people around you as you make some noise and rep your team. 4) Attend events for making new friends Lots of local organizations are popping up to host more opportunities for folks to meet new people! Check out these experiences that are coming up in the fall months. No matter what you choose to explore, just remember to be yourself. A smile and a warm hello can get you far in any of these events, so take a breath and put yourself out there. Happy friend making! Check out Part 1 and Part 2 for other ideas.

name: Boston Jewish Film Festival 2024
description: Boston Jewish Film offers the finest in film programming, education, and conversation to audiences across the Greater Boston community. Created in 1989, as the Boston Jewish Film Festival and founded by filmmaker Michal Goldman, we are now the largest film-based organization in New England, welcoming more than 15,000 annually. Boston Jewish Film offers the finest in film programming, education, and conversation to audiences across the Greater Boston community. Created in 1989, as the Boston Jewish Film Festival and founded by filmmaker Michal Goldman, we are now the largest film-based organization in New England, welcoming more than 15,000 annually.

name: The Yappy Hour After Brunch at The Urban Grape
categories: Animals, Date Idea, Drinks, Pet Friendly
description: Join us on the third Saturday of each month for a special Yappy Hour edition of The After Brunch—and bring your furry friends! Polkadog Bakery will be there handing out free treats alongside a free public tasting and local maker pop-up. Join us on the third Saturday of each month for a special Yappy Hour edition of The After Brunch—and bring your furry friends! Polkadog Bakery will be there handing out free treats alongside a free public tasting and local maker pop-up.

name: SoWa Sundays
description: OPEN EVERY SUNDAY IN NOVEMBER.There is only one 450 Harrison Ave. In fact, we’re open every Sunday of the year, 11am-4pm. And in November, there are four SoWa Sundays. And Black Friday, November 29th 10am-9pm, and Small Business Saturday, November 30th 10am-10pm, will kick off our annual Winter Festival. Outdoor markets? Not until next spring. But the studios at 450 Harrison are open! Be the first to see new works. Experience the rewards of buying direct from the makers. Yes, it pays to be in the know. And the first Friday of every month is still and always will be First Friday Open Studios, 5pm-9pm. See you First Friday, November 1st! See you every Sunday! See you Winter Festival, beginning Black Friday, November 29th. name: Boston Queer Club Event Night
categories: Good for Groups, LGBTQ+, Meetup, Nightlife
description: This Friday is our weekly Boston Queer Club Event! Entry is $15 OR only $5 if you come with one mail painted pink. This week is live improv performances and a social!

name: Immersive Yoga @ The WNDR Museum
description: Step into a world where movement meets art and mindfulness meets creativity! Join WNDR Boston and Pete Sacco aka BulldogFlowBoston for a special yoga session on November 16th from 10-11AM hosted in our Immersive Theater, where you’ll flow through poses surrounded by stunning visuals and captivating soundscapes.Whether you’re a seasoned yogi or just starting your journey, this class promises to elevate your practice in a one-of-a-kind setting. Connect with your body, mind, and the art around you in an unforgettable yoga experience.Ticket price includes access to the full museum experience. Bring your own mat and water bottle! Step into a world where movement meets art and mindfulness meets creativity! Join WNDR Boston and Pete Sacco aka BulldogFlowBoston for a special yoga session on November 16th from 10-11AM hosted in our Immersive Theater, where you’ll flow through poses surrounded by stunning visuals and captivating soundscapes. Whether you’re a seasoned yogi or just starting your journey, this class promises to elevate your practice in a one-of-a-kind setting. Connect with your body, mind, and the art around you in an unforgettable yoga experience. Ticket price includes access to the full museum experience. Bring your own mat and water bottle!

name: Comic Book Happy Hour
description: "Sometimes you wanna go where everybody knows Thor's hammer's name." Join us for The Comic Book Happy Hour, happening every Friday from 5 to 7 pm at The Jungle in Union Square. It's a 21+ affair. Step into our cozy dive and dive into discussions about all things comic books. Plus, here's a sweet deal: Bring in new comics from any local comic shop, and The Jungle will slash HALF OFF your meal. plus Free Comic Book Day

name: Materials Lab Workshop: Black Magic
description: Join artist Adam Davis for an exploration of tintypes and image making as a means of documenting and celebrating communities. Taking inspiration from his project building one of the largest contemporary repositories of tintype portraits of Black Americans and Global Africans in the world, titled Black Magic, this workshop will serve as a pop-up tintype portrait session. The Materials Lab will be turned into a studio and dark room, and everyone will learn the basics of tintype photography by making portraits on an aluminum plate from start to finish. You’ll have the chance to add your own creative flourishes both to an image of a fellow participant and to a tintype made of you.Photography supplies will be provided. Beginners are warmly welcome.The hands-on session will take place in the Materials Lab on the Lower Level.$15 workshop fee. Registration is required and space is limited; registration will open on this form, beginning on Wednesday, November 6, at 10am. $15 workshop fee must be paid to confirm registration. Minimum age of 14; no previous experience required. Join artist Adam Davis for an exploration of tintypes and image making as a means of documenting and celebrating communities. Taking inspiration from his project building one of the largest contemporary repositories of tintype portraits of Black Americans and Global Africans in the world, titled Black Magic, this workshop will serve as a pop-up tintype portrait session. The hands-on session will take place in the Materials Lab on the Lower Level. $15 workshop fee. Minimum age of 14; no previous experience required.

name: caked up: fruitstand's 1st birthday
description: it’s our first birthgay 😱 and we want to celebrate 💕 with you!if you bring the cake 😜 we’ll bring the baked goods 🎂 and queer pop hits. so put on your party hat 🥳 do one extra squat 🦵 and head over to 52 Church to show off your assets 🍑 and celebrate in style. DJ Frazzo has your favorite hits from fellow scorpios 🦂 Carly Rae Jepsen and Tove Lo, and from Charli xcx, Chappell Roan, and more. presents can be given in the form of a $10 cover 💵 at the door.$10 cash only door tickets.RSVP to let us know you’re coming.21+ full bar. consent is sexy. this event will have flashing lights.about fruitstandhi, we’re fruitstand 🍒 your new favorite queer nightlife event! find us in Cambridge and Somerville📍hosting highly curated dance parties 🪩 with DJ Frazzo playing the queer bops you know and love. we’ll bring the intimacy of a house party 🛋️ and a space where you can be your full authentic self 💅 so come mingle and let loose!check us out on Instagram ⬇️@fruitstand.gay@djfrazzo it’s our first birthgay 😱 and we want to celebrate 💕 with you! if you bring the cake 😜 we’ll bring the baked goods 🎂 and queer pop hits. so put on your party hat 🥳 do one extra squat 🦵 and head over to 52 Church to show off your assets 🍑 and celebrate in style. DJ Frazzo has your favorite hits from fellow scorpios 🦂 Carly Rae Jepsen and Tove Lo, and from Charli xcx, Chappell Roan, and more. presents can be given in the form of a $10 cover 💵 at the door. $10 cash only door tickets. RSVP to let us know you’re coming. 21+ full bar. consent is sexy. this event will have flashing lights. about fruitstand hi, we’re fruitstand 🍒 your new favorite queer nightlife event! find us in Cambridge and Somerville📍hosting highly curated dance parties 🪩 with DJ Frazzo playing the queer bops you know and love. we’ll bring the intimacy of a house party 🛋️ and a space where you can be your full authentic self 💅 so come mingle and let loose! check us out on Instagram ⬇️ @fruitstand.gay @djfrazzo

name: Guided Sake Tasting
description: Come learn about and drink good sake with the MFA and the Koji Club! Taste three different styles of sake to find the glass (or bottle, or style, or category) you like best. Invite friends and join us for a 60-minute guided sake tasting with light bites. Afterward, explore art in the galleries—the Museum is open till 10 pm!The Koji Club is a community of sake enthusiasts who love to sip sake together all over the world. It has won numerous accolades since opening its brick-and-mortar location in Boston, New England’s only Japanese sake bar, in 2022. Come learn about and drink good sake with the MFA and the Koji Club! Taste three different styles of sake to find the glass (or bottle, or style, or category) you like best. Invite friends and join us for a 60-minute guided sake tasting with light bites. Afterward, explore art in the galleries—the Museum is open till 10 pm! The Koji Club is a community of sake enthusiasts who love to sip sake together all over the world. It has won numerous accolades since opening its brick-and-mortar location in Boston, New England’s only Japanese sake bar, in 2022.

name: 10 Weekly Football Watch Parties in Boston
categories: Drinks, Food, Good for Groups, Meetup, Sports & Active Life
description: Game day just got a whole lot more fun. Watch your favorite NFL or college football team duke it out at these regular watch parties around Boston. Even if you’re not a die-hard sports fan, there are beautiful views and special game day menus to enjoy at these local restaurants. by Celina ColbyFootball Watch Parties at Deck 12When: Thursdays-Mondays as games airWhere: SeaportInfo: Watch the game from the Deck 12 rooftop and cheer on your favorite team with the Boston skyline in the background. This rooftop bar is showing NFL and college games as they air Thursday-Monday, plus they’re serving game day bites like fried pickles and smash burgers.Football Season Free Wings at King’sWhen: Mondays, 6pm to closeWhere: Back Bay, SeaportInfo: King’s is showing Monday night football games every week and Kings Reward Members can get free wings while they root for their favorite team. Notre Dame Football Watch Party (pictured)When: Saturdays and select Sundays, game times varyWhere: CharlestownInfo: Notre Dame fans can get their weekly fix with Saturday (and the occasional Sunday) game viewings at The Anchor in Charlestown. Thursday Night Football Watch PartyWhen: Thursdays, 7:30pmWhere: DowntownInfo: Football fans and cannabis lovers unite at this free weekly party with game day snacks, adult beverages, and a different cannabis-industry partner every week. Patriots Watch PartyWhen: Sundays at game timeWhere: CharlestownInfo: Every Sunday head to The Anchor to cheer on the home team during Patriots games. The game will be live on a big screen and you can order up cold beers and food specials while watching on the waterfront.Football Weekends at LocoWhen: Saturdays and SundaysWhere: Fenway and South BostonInfo: Every Saturday from 10am-5pm and all day Sunday, celebrate game days at Loco South Boston and Fenway. In South Boston reserve a couch and a TV for a group and at Loco Fenway enjoy special pitchers of beer and margaritas. Both locations offer a festive game day menu. Sunday Funday Football at Stats BarWhen: Saturdays and SundaysWhere: South BostonInfo: Stats Bar has 24 TVs inside to get every angle of the NFL games on Sunday and the college football games on Saturday. While you’re at it, order classic football comfort food and local brews.Game Day at MJ O’Connor’sWhen: Saturdays and Sundays, select weekdaysWhere: Back BayInfo: It’s first game requested, first shown at MJ O’Connor’s Back Bay, so get in early to see your favorite team play. While you’re cheering them on, order a Guinness, wings, waffle fries, and other goodies.50¢ Wings for Monday Night FootballWhen: MondaysWhere: SomervilleInfo: Fuel up to cheer on your favorite team with 50¢ wings at Olde Magoun’s Saloon in Somerville in celebration of Monday Night Football. Football Sundays at Banner’s Kitchen & TapWhen: SundaysWhere: West EndInfo: Root for the Patriots on the huge screens at Banner’s Kitchen & Tap near TD Garden. Game day is also a perfect time to try out their fun foods like the torched bacon rack. BONUS:Harvard vs. Yale Football GameWhen: Saturday 11/23Where: AllstonInfo: The Harvard vs. Yale game is a classic Boston experience. These storied rivals will battle it out on the Harvard field for the 140th year. Tickets sell fast and early so plan ahead if you want to attend. Game day just got a whole lot more fun. description: Welcome to the Holiday Blowout Art Extravaganza. Shop Local and start your Holiday Shopping early! Join us at The Hidden Art Gallery for festive fun and unique finds. Discover one-of-a-kind gifts created by local artists. Handmade oil paintings, greeting cards, ornaments, professionally framed prints and original watercolors. There's something for everyone on your list. name: Rail Stop Restaurant & Bar Pop 2000s Brunch!
description: From Britney and Christina to O-Town and 98 Degrees, bring you and your beautiful souls down to Rail Stop for our Pancakes and Pop Stars brunch on November 16th where live DJ entertainment by The 617 Event Group will be getting the party started at 10:00 AM!Pull out those Uggs and Birks from your closet, throw on your pleated skirts, and whip out those Sidekicks, as you step into our throwback brunch complete with themed decor, specialty cocktails, and dishes with our DJ spinning tunes that remind you of your favorite 2000s playlist on your iPod Nano.Grab your MySpace Top 8 posse and book your reservation today to Spice Up Your Brunch!Reservations: https://www.railstopboston.com/reserve-a-table/ From Britney and Christina to O-Town and 98 Degrees, bring you and your beautiful souls down to Rail Stop for our Pancakes and Pop Stars brunch on November 16th where live DJ entertainment by The 617 Event Group will be getting the party started at 10:00 AM! Pull out those Uggs and Birks from your closet, throw on your pleated skirts, and whip out those Sidekicks, as you step into our throwback brunch complete with themed decor, specialty cocktails, and dishes with our DJ spinning tunes that remind you of your favorite 2000s playlist on your iPod Nano. Grab your MySpace Top 8 posse and book your reservation today to Spice Up Your Brunch! Reservations: https://www.railstopboston.com/reserve-a-table/

name: Maple & Malts Weekend
description: Fall in New England is prime time and the cooling temperatures and colorful foliage make for the perfect time to savor the maple flavors of harvest season! We decided to make the very best of the turning seasons with Maple and Malts Weekend. We'll be releasing 2 exclusive brews crafted in house, both featuring a maple sugar rim option:Maple Doublebock - a boozy winter beer! With a deep copper color, the Maple Doublebock has a rich, sweet malty flavor with notes of caramel and a lingering maple finish.Maple Porter - brewed with maple syrup and pecan-wood smoked wheat maltIn addition to two brand new brews, Chef Cody came up with a customized special maple menu for this weekend only! Here's what we got:Maple Cinnamon Sugar Pretzel SticksSignature nachos with Maple Glazed ChickenMaple Bruschetta Plate with crostini and Maple Bacon Habanero Jam! Fall in New England is prime time and the cooling temperatures and colorful foliage make for the perfect time to savor the maple flavors of harvest season! We decided to make the very best of the turning seasons with Maple and Malts Weekend. We'll be releasing 2 exclusive brews crafted in house, both featuring a maple sugar rim option: In addition to two brand new brews, Chef Cody came up with a customized special maple menu for this weekend only! Here's what we got:

name: The 19 Best “Happy Hour” Food & Drink Deals Around Boston That Are Actually Worth It
categories: Date Idea, Drinks, Food, Good for Groups
description: Although Boston technically doesn’t have Happy Hour, (for now, there’s legislation in the works about it) there are lots of deals on food and drinks to enjoy about town. Enjoy all the culinary and cocktail delights of Boston, without breaking the bank using these Happy Hour deals.Looking for oysters? Check out these $1 oyster deals around the city. by Celina Colby1) Happy Hour at BarcelonaWhen: Mon-Fri 4pm-6pm Where: South End, BrooklineInfo: During Happy Hour at Barcelona’s South End and Brookline locations you can get $7 martinis and espresso martinis, $4 beers, and a selection of tapas ranging from $5-$9 apiece. 2) Happy Hour 50¢ Dumplings at Banyan Bar + RefugeWhen: Mon-Sun 4pm-6pmWhere: South EndInfo: Satisfy your dumpling cravings every day at Banyan Bar + Refuge where you can get 10 dumplings for $5 as well as deals on other apps like a scallion pancake roll ($7) and prawn toast ($8). 3) $8 Spritzes at Tuscan Kitchen SeaportWhen: All day, every day through 8/31Where: SeaportInfo: Make the most of the last few weeks of summer with $8 spritzes all day every day at Tuscan Kitchen Seaport during the month of August. While you’re sipping, order up $2 oysters from the bar, 3-6pm daily. 4) $3 Tacos at Loco Taqueria & Oyster BarWhen: Tue 11am-1amWhere: Fenway, South BostonInfo: Celebrate Taco Tuesday with half off all tacos every Tuesday at Loco Taqueria in Fenway and South Boston. Those savings can go straight towards another round of margaritas! 5) Bottomless Pasta Wednesdays at Capo Restaurant & Supper ClubWhen: Wed 4-10pmWhere: South BostonInfo: For ust $32 you can eat unlimited plates of pasta every Wednesday at Capo Restaurant & Supper Club in South Boston. Try every flavor and then you’ll know your favorite for the next week!6) Bottomless Maki for $32 at Fat BabyWhen: Mon 4pm-10pmWhere: South BostonInfo: For just $32 per person you can eat UNLIMITED maki at Fat Baby. There are six rolls to choose from on this Happy Hour menu. The only rule is no sharing and honestly, why would you want to? 7) Bottomless Steak Frites at BatifolWhen: Sun 4-10pmWhere: Kendall SquareInfo: Every Sunday night at Batifol in Cambridge you can live your best (unlimited) Parisian life with bottomless steak frites. For $37 you’ll receive steak, French fries, and the restaurant’s secret sauce with unlimited refills.8) $5 Tapas at TascaWhen: Tue 4-6pmWhere: BrightonInfo: Try a little bit of everything with $5 tapas during this foodie happy hour every Tuesday at Tasca. It’s a great opportunity to try new things at this authentic Spanish restaurant.9) $5 Mimosas at Ward 8When: Sat-Sun 10am-3pmWhere: West EndInfo: Brunch just got a whole lot better with $5 mimosas at Ward 8 in the West End. There’s no better compliment to chicken and waffles, avocado toast, and breakfast burgers.10) Shy Hour at Shy Bird South BostonWhen: Mon-Fri 4-6pmWhere: South BostonInfo: Every weekday at the South Boston location of Shy Bird you can enjoy 50¢ fried chicken dunks, a $9.99 smash burger, $9 cocktails, $6 tall boys and more during their Shy Hour answer to Happy Hour.11) $10 Martinis at Petula'sWhen: Mon 5pm to closeWhere: South BostonInfo: Every Monday you can order $10 martinis at Petula’s in South Boston from 5pm to close. That includes everybody’s favorite, the espresso martini. They also offer free fries when you order a glass of bubbly Monday-Friday 11:30am-5pm.12) Half-off Sandwiches after 10pm at Parish CafeWhen: Sun-Wed 11:30am-12am, Thu-Sat 11:30am-2amWhere: Back BayInfo: Take advantage of this late night (for Boston) deal, where all sandwiches at Parish Cafe are 50% off after 10pm. On weekends they’re open late so it’s a great end-of-the-night spot to fuel up.13) 50% off the Full Menu at Grendel’s DenWhen: Mon-Sun 5pm-7:30pmWhere: Harvard SquareInfo: For two and half hours every day the entire menu at Grendel’s Den is 50% off. The only parameters are that you must order an alcoholic beverage to go with it and you can’t use to-go boxes to turn the deal into grocery shopping.14) Oysters & Prosecco for $18 at The BroadwayWhen: Sun 4-7pmWhere: South BostonInfo: Class it up on a budget with this Sunday Funday deal at The Broadway in South Boston. Get 6 oysters and a glass of prosecco for a grand total of $18. 15) Half-off Pizzas at The BroadwayWhen: Tue 11:30am-1amWhere: South BostonInfo: Every Tuesday you can get half-off all pizzas at The Broadway in South Boston. Grab some friends and prepare for the most affordable pizza party of all time.16) Happy Hour at Yard House FenwayWhen: Mon-Fri 3-6pmWhere: FenwayInfo: Every weekday you can enjoy half off select apps at Yard House in Fenway plus half off all pizzas, even the fancy truffle mushroom. Keep in mind this deal doesn’t apply during other Yard House events.17) Happy Hour at Local 149When: Tue-Thur 4pm-11pmWhere: South BostonInfo: Get Happy Hour deals three days a week at this local hub. On Tuesday get tacos for $3 apiece, on Wednesday get sliders for $4 apiece, and on Thursday get flatbreads for $10 apiece.18) Bottomless Bubbles, Bites & Flights Brunch at Flight ClubWhen: Sat-Sun 11am-3pmWhere: SeaportInfo: Book a brunch package for Flight Club’s Seaport location and get bottomless flatbreads for $45/per person, bottomless mimosas for $55/per person, or bottomless of both for $65/per person. Note, you need at least six people in the party and everyone needs to order this package. 19) Mucho Mondays at Painted BurroWhen: Mon 4-11:30pmWhere: Harvard SquareInfo: Try bottomless tapas at Painted Burro in Harvard Square every Monday night. Pay $21 for endless orders from the appetizers, salads, tacos, tortas, and enchiladas sections of the menu.--Photo by @bucketlistboston Although Boston technically doesn’t have Happy Hour, (for now, there’s legislation in the works about it) there are lots of deals on food and drinks to enjoy about town. Enjoy all the culinary and cocktail delights of Boston, without breaking the bank using these Happy Hour deals. Looking for oysters? Check out these $1 oyster deals around the city. by Celina Colby 1) Happy Hour at Barcelona When: Mon-Fri 4pm-6pm Where: South End, Brookline Info: During Happy Hour at Barcelona’s South End and Brookline locations you can get $7 martinis and espresso martinis, $4 beers, and a selection of tapas ranging from $5-$9 apiece. 2) Happy Hour 50¢ Dumplings at Banyan Bar + Refuge When: Mon-Sun 4pm-6pm Where: South End Info: Satisfy your dumpling cravings every day at Banyan Bar + Refuge where you can get 10 dumplings for $5 as well as deals on other apps like a scallion pancake roll ($7) and prawn toast ($8). 3) $8 Spritzes at Tuscan Kitchen Seaport When: All day, every day through 8/31 Where: Seaport Info: Make the most of the last few weeks of summer with $8 spritzes all day every day at Tuscan Kitchen Seaport during the month of August. While you’re sipping, order up $2 oysters from the bar, 3-6pm daily. 4) $3 Tacos at Loco Taqueria & Oyster Bar When: Tue 11am-1am Where: Fenway, South Boston Info: Celebrate Taco Tuesday with half off all tacos every Tuesday at Loco Taqueria in Fenway and South Boston. Those savings can go straight towards another round of margaritas! 5) Bottomless Pasta Wednesdays at Capo Restaurant & Supper Club When: Wed 4-10pm Where: South Boston Info: For ust $32 you can eat unlimited plates of pasta every Wednesday at Capo Restaurant & Supper Club in South Boston. Try every flavor and then you’ll know your favorite for the next week! 6) Bottomless Maki for $32 at Fat Baby When: Mon 4pm-10pm Where: South Boston Info: For just $32 per person you can eat UNLIMITED maki at Fat Baby. There are six rolls to choose from on this Happy Hour menu. The only rule is no sharing and honestly, why would you want to? 7) Bottomless Steak Frites at Batifol When: Sun 4-10pm Where: Kendall Square Info: Every Sunday night at Batifol in Cambridge you can live your best (unlimited) Parisian life with bottomless steak frites. For $37 you’ll receive steak, French fries, and the restaurant’s secret sauce with unlimited refills. 8) $5 Tapas at Tasca When: Tue 4-6pm Where: Brighton Info: Try a little bit of everything with $5 tapas during this foodie happy hour every Tuesday at Tasca. It’s a great opportunity to try new things at this authentic Spanish restaurant. 9) $5 Mimosas at Ward 8 When: Sat-Sun 10am-3pm Where: West End Info: Brunch just got a whole lot better with $5 mimosas at Ward 8 in the West End. There’s no better compliment to chicken and waffles, avocado toast, and breakfast burgers. 10) Shy Hour at Shy Bird South Boston When: Mon-Fri 4-6pm Where: South Boston Info: Every weekday at the South Boston location of Shy Bird you can enjoy 50¢ fried chicken dunks, a $9.99 smash burger, $9 cocktails, $6 tall boys and more during their Shy Hour answer to Happy Hour. 11) $10 Martinis at Petula's When: Mon 5pm to close Where: South Boston Info: Every Monday you can order $10 martinis at Petula’s in South Boston from 5pm to close. That includes everybody’s favorite, the espresso martini. They also offer free fries when you order a glass of bubbly Monday-Friday 11:30am-5pm. 12) Half-off Sandwiches after 10pm at Parish Cafe When: Sun-Wed 11:30am-12am, Thu-Sat 11:30am-2am Where: Back Bay Info: Take advantage of this late night (for Boston) deal, where all sandwiches at Parish Cafe are 50% off after 10pm. On weekends they’re open late so it’s a great end-of-the-night spot to fuel up. 13) 50% off the Full Menu at Grendel’s Den When: Mon-Sun 5pm-7:30pm Where: Harvard Square Info: For two and half hours every day the entire menu at Grendel’s Den is 50% off. The only parameters are that you must order an alcoholic beverage to go with it and you can’t use to-go boxes to turn the deal into grocery shopping. 14) Oysters & Prosecco for $18 at The Broadway When: Sun 4-7pm Where: South Boston Info: Class it up on a budget with this Sunday Funday deal at The Broadway in South Boston. Get 6 oysters and a glass of prosecco for a grand total of $18. 15) Half-off Pizzas at The Broadway When: Tue 11:30am-1am Where: South Boston Info: Every Tuesday you can get half-off all pizzas at The Broadway in South Boston. Grab some friends and prepare for the most affordable pizza party of all time. 16) Happy Hour at Yard House Fenway When: Mon-Fri 3-6pm Where: Fenway Info: Every weekday you can enjoy half off select apps at Yard House in Fenway plus half off all pizzas, even the fancy truffle mushroom. Keep in mind this deal doesn’t apply during other Yard House events. 17) Happy Hour at Local 149 When: Tue-Thur 4pm-11pm Where: South Boston Info: Get Happy Hour deals three days a week at this local hub. On Tuesday get tacos for $3 apiece, on Wednesday get sliders for $4 apiece, and on Thursday get flatbreads for $10 apiece. 18) Bottomless Bubbles, Bites & Flights Brunch at Flight Club When: Sat-Sun 11am-3pm Where: Seaport Info: Book a brunch package for Flight Club’s Seaport location and get bottomless flatbreads for $45/per person, bottomless mimosas for $55/per person, or bottomless of both for $65/per person. Note, you need at least six people in the party and everyone needs to order this package. 19) Mucho Mondays at Painted Burro When: Mon 4-11:30pm Where: Harvard Square Info: Try bottomless tapas at Painted Burro in Harvard Square every Monday night. Pay $21 for endless orders from the appetizers, salads, tacos, tortas, and enchiladas sections of the menu. -- Photo by @bucketlistboston

name: BSO, Open Rehearsal: Tchaikovsky Symphony No. 6, Pathétique
description: Canadian pianist Jan Lisiecki is the soloist in Mozart’s mysterious and stormy Piano Concerto No. 20 in D minor which owes much to the composer’s sensitivity to operatic drama and expressivity. This concerto was particularly admired by artists of the Romantic era. Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky said of his poignant Symphony No. 6, Pathétique, “I love it as I have never loved any of my musical children.” It was his last completed work; he led the premiere less than two weeks before his death Canadian pianist Jan Lisiecki is the soloist in Mozart’s mysterious and stormy Piano Concerto No. 20 in D minor which owes much to the composer’s sensitivity to operatic drama and expressivity. This concerto was particularly admired by artists of the Romantic era. description: The Fun Dodgeballs have went so well and we have had so much interest that it is now a 3rd Saturday Event(This will be our 66th now) (Next Upcoming 11/16)Come join in on the fun, no experience necessary, bring Family, Friends, Co-Workers!Early Bird Ticket Special, Go to Link to Purchase: https://fun-dodgeball-Nov-16-2024.eventbrite.com(You may Venmo DavidM0625(Can do Cash App too) & Save on Eventbrite Fees or If paying $20 cash Onsite, please have exact change, but no $1's!)If at all possible and you are definitely coming please message us NLT 10/14 to let us know. It will help us out a lot.Check-In at 7:00pm outside gymnasium and we generally get started at 7:30pm and finish around 9:30pm.(We play for approximately 90 Minutes to 2 Hours)Again, All Levels are Welcome this is a fun Dodgeball social atmosphere not the same as the dodgeball you may have played growing up or the movie.We will be playing against each other and having a fun time.How to find us:Fun Dodgeball will be in the Andrew Peabody School Gymnasium and it is located on the Cambridge/Somerville Line and near the Red Line in between Davis Square and Porter Square Stops.(Parking on Haskell Street 25 spots on left side by school and behind entrance to gym there as well)Please look for David at the entrance to the gym or inside the gym, if you need help finding us, please call 617 548 6208.This will be a joint event with several meet up groups.After Fun Dodgeball we head to:Joe Sent Me2388 Massachusetts AveCambridge, MA** Sorry No Refunds **Here are some of the basic rules to know in advance to coming to Fun Dodgeball:#1 Have Fun#2 Head Shots(From the neck up you are not out)#3 Only the person the ball that is throwing it, can catch it for another person to be out(it is live to catch until it hits the ground or another person)#4 If you use a ball to block a ball you are out if you drop the ball already in your hands or if it hits your hands/finger tips while blocking, ball is dead after that#5 You must stay within the boundaries setup to catch a ball or throw it#6 You may only go over the center black line if you throw the ball before go over or if your throw it before your feet touch the ground or you are out!!#7 When starting the game you are only going for the balls on the right and balls must clear the prescribed cone before they can be thrown#8 We may enforce a 10-15 Second holding time before you must throw the ball#9 All rules are subject to amendments or more rules to be added.Liability Release - name: Social at Bar Moxy then GO PARTY at BSMNT! FREE!
description: https://www.meetup.com/fuckitimsocial/events/304490612/These events are designed so people that actually want to come out, drink, party, and make new friends in Boston can, while mitigating some cost along the way. The goal is to bring together a welcoming social group of young professionals 21-35 to go out with on the weekend.Schedule:- Starting at 8p we'll meet up for a social at Bar Moxy (2nd floor of the Moxy Hotel) and grab some drinks.- Around 10p we'll leave the bar and head over to BSMNT!BSMNT is a club and may enforce their dress code that is dressy casual, general rule of thumb is:Gents: Shirt Up, Jeans/Pants, Dress Shoes(no work boots, shorts, hat, ripped clothing or athletic gear or tees/sandals)Ladies: Dress for a night club - they are generally less stringent for you compared to the guysTo get into the club with us you will need a WRISTBAND from me, cost for this night will be:FREE!This covers your wristband, the social at the bar, and entry into the club!This saves you $20-25 compared to the normal cover, but you must get a wristband and enter with me. Please note that once we're in it is hard if not impossible for me to get people that are late in the door. Make sure to get to the bar before BSMNT to ensure you get a wristband.Let's have a crazy and epic night! https://www.meetup.com/fuckitimsocial/events/304490612/ These events are designed so people that actually want to come out, drink, party, and make new friends in Boston can, while mitigating some cost along the way. The goal is to bring together a welcoming social group of young professionals 21-35 to go out with on the weekend. Schedule: - Starting at 8p we'll meet up for a social at Bar Moxy (2nd floor of the Moxy Hotel) and grab some drinks. - Around 10p we'll leave the bar and head over to BSMNT! BSMNT is a club and may enforce their dress code that is dressy casual, general rule of thumb is: Gents: Shirt Up, Jeans/Pants, Dress Shoes (no work boots, shorts, hat, ripped clothing or athletic gear or tees/sandals) Ladies: Dress for a night club - they are generally less stringent for you compared to the guys To get into the club with us you will need a WRISTBAND from me, cost for this night will be: FREE! This covers your wristband, the social at the bar, and entry into the club! This saves you $20-25 compared to the normal cover, but you must get a wristband and enter with me. Please note that once we're in it is hard if not impossible for me to get people that are late in the door. Make sure to get to the bar before BSMNT to ensure you get a wristband. Let's have a crazy and epic night!

name: Recomposing Home - an Uncommon Perspective of Musical Life in Germany
description: Trio Gaia performs works by Mauricio Kagel, Clara Iannotta & Clara SchumannIn Recomposing Home the Boston-based Trio Gaia presents an uncommon perspective of musical life in Germany, showcasing three global figures of classical and avant-garde art whose careers began, ended, or were shaped by their time in Germany.With her 61-year long career, Clara Schumann is at once an archetype of the 19th-century European virtuoso, yet also a formidable figure who defied social expectations by continuing to teach, travel, and perform in spite of the obligations of marriage and motherhood. Meanwhile, two “ausländers” from opposite ends of the 20th century present intriguing challenges to traditional assumptions of assimilation and homogeneity in German artistic life. Amidst significant cultural renewal post-World War II, we meet Mauricio Kagel of Argentina and Clara Iannotta of Italy; both are part of a new wave of artists drawn to Germany’s rapidly expanding avant-garde community who make Germany their new home in different ways. Kagel moves to West Germany at the age of 26 and stays on in Köln for the rest of his life, eventually succeeding Stockhausen as director of the Cologne Courses for New Music and making numerous indispensable contributions to the city’s musical life. Still based in Berlin today, Iannotta’s story stands worlds apart from her namesake, constantly crossing boundaries of geography and art as her music pushes the standards of experimentation and exploration. In tandem with Harvard Art Museum’s new Special Exhibition, Made in Germany?, this program takes a look at three composers whose varied careers offer a broader view of German artistic identity and recenters the migrant creatives who continue to redefine and enrich the cultural life of the country and beyond.Trio Gaia, New England Conservatory's most recent graduate piano trio in residence, formed in 2018 and is dedicated to offering audiences dynamic, personally relevant experiences inside and outside the concert hall. The trio has won 1st prize at the 2022 WDAV Young Chamber Musicians Competition, as well as prizes in the 2022 Premio Trio di Trieste International Music Competition, 2021 Chamber Music Yellow Springs Competition, and the 2019 Plowman National Chamber Music Competition. name: 13 Best Places to Watch the Sunset in Boston
description: Savor the transition of summer into fall by sitting outside and watching the sun set over the city. Boston looks gorgeous from every angle at golden hour, so add each and every one of these spots to your sunset bucket list.  Many of these recommendations come from a conversation over on Joyraft. Check out what else our users love.by Celina Colby1) Seaport Steps & Fan PierWhere: SeaportInfo: Golden hour has never looked as good as it does from the Seaport Steps overlooking the oceanside neighborhood and the financial district skyline. 2) The Esplanade﻿Where: Back BayInfo: One of Boston’s most beloved parks, the Charles River Esplanade is a classic spot to see the sunset with sailboats and the Cambridge side of the river on view. [Photo by @bretclancy]3) Tall Ship Boston﻿Where: East BostonInfo: Watch the sunset over the Boston city skyline with a cocktail in hand at this floating oyster bar in East Boston. [Photo by Tall Ship]4) Piers ParkWhere: East BostonInfo: This East Boston park and boat launch presents impeccable views of Boston that sparkle as the sun sets. You can also do sunset yoga for free at this park. 5) LoPresti ParkWhere: East BostonInfo: Right across the street from the Reelhouse restaurant in East Boston you’ll find a sprawling public park with gorgeous views of the Boston city skyline. 6) Museum of Science Parking GarageWhere: West End Info: Stay with us on this one. If you take the Museum of Science garage elevator to the fifth floor you can enjoy an incredible view of Boston’s Back Bay, featuring the Prudential Center and Hancock Tower, illuminated by the sunset.7) BU BridgeWhere: Brookline Info: From the BU Bridge you can see the sunset reflected in the glittering buildings of Back Bay for a beautiful and unconventional view. [Photo by @oschapov]8) Castle IslandWhere: South BostonInfo: Watch the sunset from the beach at Castle Island in South Boston. The colors reflecting on the Boston Harbor are stunning. 9) View BostonWhere: Back BayInfo: If you want to make a night of it, head up to View Boston (there is a $25 entrance fee) and see the sunset over the whole city from the bars and restaurants on the 52nd floor. [Photo by View Boston]10) North Point ParkWhere: East CambridgeInfo: This 8.5-acre park along the banks of the Charles River is a stunning spot to watch the sunset, plus it allows you to walk from Cambridge along the water to the North End.11) Larz Anderson ParkWhere: BrooklineInfo: Larz Anderson Park in Brookline. sits on a hill in Brookline. The elevation allows you to see the golden hour rays shining across the neighboring pond and parkland. [Photo by ksm86 on Reddit] 12) Corey Hill PlaygroundWhere: BrooklineInfo: Through the trees at Corey Hill Playground in Brookline you can watch the sunset over Brookline and Boston. Not to mention reconnect with your youthful self on the swings. [Photo by @viewfromcoreyhilloutlookpark] 13) Granite LinksWhere: QuincyInfo: For a more pastoral viewpoint, head to Granite Links Golf Club in Quincy where you can watch the sunset over the expansive green lawns with the Boston skyline in the distance.--Main photo by @bretclancy Savor the transition of summer into fall by sitting outside and watching the sun set over the city.
