Each space on the property is as lavishly decorated as the food served. OUTSIDE OF THE CITY: 12) Holiday Pop-Up at The Venetian When: 11/1-1/31 Where: Weymouth, MA Info: This neighborhood Italian restaurant on the South Shore goes all out for the holidays. The restaurant’s entire ceiling is draped with hundreds of yards of garland and almost 6,000 ornaments and each corner has a different themed installation. The menu pairs special holiday cocktails with classic Italian pastas and apps. 13) INNgloo Wonderland at Inn at Hastings Park When: 11/1-4/2 Where: Lexington, MA Info: Embrace the winter season by dining in one of Inn at Hastings Park’s outdoor igloos this season. Decorate like the interior of a charming ski lodge cabin, the igloos are fully heated and make a cozy background for winter dinner, lunch, or brunch.

name: 100 things to do in Boston for $10 or less: November 2024
categories: Animals, Art, Classes, Date Idea, Drinks, Farms, Festivals & Fairs, Food, Games, Good for Groups, History, Innovation, Kid Friendly, LGBTQ+, Lectures & Conferences, Meetup, Movies, Music, Nature, Nightlife, Outside, Party, Pet Friendly, Photoworthy, Rainy Day Ideas, Seasonal, Shopping, Shows, Social Good, Sports & Active Life
description: Happy November, my Boston friends. This month marks many seasons of change. Catch the final days of fall foliage before a Boston winter arrives. Enjoy autumn parties and festivities and welcome the holiday season with markets and city-wide lightings. As 2024 begins to draw to a close soon, enjoy time with friends and family with 100 free and cheap activities in November.By Yelena Nicolle Salvador1) Día de Los Muertos Celebration at Time OutWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: FenwayCost: FreeInfo: Head to Time Out Market for an evening of cultural festivities. Celebrate the Day of the Dead with live music, food and drink specials, and other fun surprises. There will be glitter tattoos and an evening of dance and laughs.2) Nauti Halloween Party on Dia de los MuertosWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: SeaportCost: FreeInfo: Head to Nautical Pier 4 in Seaport for a continuation of Boston Halloween right along the stunning waterfront. With no cover charge, this Nauti Halloween party will have spooky decor and a live DJ. Costumes are highly encouraged.3) SoWa First FridayWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: South EndCost: FreeInfo: Looking for the perfect way to feel inspired and hide away from the cold? Stroll through SoWa and hop into the open galleries where you can meet local artists, find your next gift, and enjoy the art around you.4) 20s & 30s Mingle and Social at Aeronaut BreweryWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: SomervilleCost: FreeInfo: Head to Aeronaut Brewery for a fun evening of getting to meet new friends. As you grab a brew, chat with young folks in the city and play some board games to break the ice. This is a great way to grow your community!5) Dock-tober Frights: A Halloween Bash with Downeast Cider!When: Fri. 11/1Where: The EsplanadeCost: $10Info: Downeast Cider is hosting the ultimate Halloween bash along the water of the Charles. Enjoy specialty and spooky cocktails, eerie music and games, a costume contest, and a whole lot of fun.6) Grrrl Talk at Remnant SatelliteWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: CambridgeCost: FreeInfo: Calling all my ladies! This event is made by women and for women. Listen to vinyl classics, grab a drink, and get to know other femmes at this evening experience for ladies, friends, and lovers! 7) Free Coworking Day at The SubstationWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: RoslindaleCost: FreeInfo: Looking to change the scenery of your WFH setup? Come test out a new space at the Substation where you can work while you enjoy free coffee, snacks, and pastries. Plus, you can meet other folks who WFH and make new friends!8) NaNoWriMo Write-InWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: RoxburyCost: FreeInfo: November is known as National Novel Writing Month. Get your story started and meet fellow writers at this community event. You’ll get to chat, brainstorm, and cheer each other on.9) Friday Night Trivia at TridentWhen: Every Friday, starting 11/1Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: Trivia nights are a cozy getaway from the cold. Head to the local favorite Trident to meet some new friends, learn some fun facts, and have a laugh.10) Voting, Democracy, Rights and RepresentationWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: WalthamCost: FreeInfo: Make your way to the Rose Art Museum at Brandeis for an evening of art and history. Stay for the discussion about certain pieces on view that touch on American politics, values, and more. Afterwards, there will be voter registration and absentee ballot resources.11) The 12 Best Neighborhoods in Boston to See Halloween DecorationsWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: BostonCost: FreeInfo: Yes, it’s November, but try to sneak in the final days of Halloween decorations around Boston before they’re gone for the season. It’s the perfect way to soak in some sun, explore Boston neighborhoods, and take photos before we must wait another year for spooky fun.12) 11 Places to See Fall Foliage in/around BostonWhen: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1Where: BostonCost: FreeInfo: Foliage is at its peak! Go outside for a solo stroll or a fun walk with friends and breathe in the crisp air. You’ll find stunning views of Boston and its fiery shades of orange and red at our favorite spots in this list.13) 11 Unique Places to Peep Fall Foliage in New EnglandWhen: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1Where: BostonCost: FreeInfo: Looking for a fall getaway? Have no fear, we got you covered. Head to these small towns for a stunning car ride. Chase some fall foliage around New England for great photos and memories.14) 10 Weekly Football Watch Parties in BostonWhen: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1Where: BostonCost: FreeInfo: There’s a lively place to cheer on your favorite teams every day around Boston. Check out our list of venues that host weekly watch parties where you can meet new friends, eat some bar food, and get rowdy as you show your pride. 15) How to Make Friends in Boston: Part 3 - Fall EditionWhen: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1Where: BostonCost: FreeInfo: Whether you just moved to the area or you’re looking to expand your community, here are some ideas for how to grow your social circle. There’s a lot of opportunities through book clubs, craft nights, conversation meet-ups, socials, and sporting events. 16) 9th Annual Waldocon Boston Bar CrawlWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: DowntownCost: FreeInfo: One of Boston’s favorite bar crawls is back for the 9th year – Waldocon! So, take out your red and white striped shirt (or make one using colored duct tape) and bar hop around Boston. It’s a great way to support a good cause since proceeds go to the Boston Children’s Hospital and you can meet new friends. 17) Día de los Muertos at Bow MarketWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: SomervilleCost: FreeInfo: Head to Bow Market for an evening of cultural celebrations for the Day of the Dead. Bring your friends and family to enjoy yummy food like the traditional pan de Muerto, drink specials, two DJs and a mariachi band performance, craft vendors, and so much more. There will be an ofrenda to pay your respects as well.18) Be-In Joy Boston FestivalWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: Boston CommonCost: FreeInfo: Make your way out to the Boston Common to relish in the beauty of a Boston fall and to rediscover joy at this new festival that’s all about spreading positivity and happiness. Take a moment away from the worries of the world and meet new people with conversational prompts, dance lessons, and other community-building activities that encourage you to take a break from the stressors in your life and be in the moment. 19) Día de los Muertos FestivalWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: CambridgeCost: FreeInfo: Learn about and experience Mexican culture at this Day of the Dead Festival in Cambridge. Sip on hot chocolate, munch on ‘bread of the dead,’ and cheer on a festive procession that celebrates the beauty of life. There will be music, craft vendors, and more. 20) FOUND Fall Vintage Market and Scavenger HuntWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: CambridgeCost: FreeInfo: Your favorite organizer of all-things vintage is popping up at Cambridge Crossing for their Fall Vintage Market event. Not only will there be 50 of New England’s best vintage sellers, but there will also be a beer garden, music, and a scavenger hunt where you can win prizes and discounts to local retailers.21) Vintage After Dark MarketWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: FenwayCost: FreeInfo: Head to Time Out Market after the sun sets for another vintage event. You can enjoy free Culture Pop sodas as you hunt for your next treasure amongst the lineup of great vendors. When you’re done, grab a bite and sip on special cocktails for the event at Time Out Market.22) Día de los Muertos at Naco TacoWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: Central SquareCost: FreeInfo: Naco Taco is hosting a Day of the Dead celebration that you do not want to miss. Head on over for free tequila tastings and an evening of music, dancing, and of course, great food. Don’t forget to RSVP to the event so you can enjoy free chips and salsa too!23) Veronica Rables Female Mariachi: Día de los MuertosWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: Listen to the beautiful sounds of Veronica Rables’s all-female mariachi band. You’ll be able to experience the spirit of the holiday as you enjoy this free concert and you can watch Mexican folkloric dance performances that will accompany the music. 24) GBH November Outspoken SaturdaysWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: Head to GBH at the Boston Public Library to meet fellow artists and writers. Whether you would like to perform a piece for the first time or you’re a seasoned spoken word artist or you just want to come and listen, everyone is welcome to join and feel inspired at this community event.25) Brewery Book Fair by BookwormWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: DorchesterCost: FreeInfo: Make your way to Dorchester Brewing Co. for a brewery book fair! Bookworm, a mobile bookstore from Quincy, will be popping up with new reads for you to enjoy during this cozy season.26) The Wicked Circular MarketWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: This unique market is focused on zero waste, so stop by and get your holiday shopping done early or find a gift for yourself. Shop from vendors that focus on upcycling, get your Halloween costume repaired or swap it, and meet local organizations that are working towards sustainability and a greener planet. 27) The Great Pumpkin SmashWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: Jamaica PlainCost: FreeInfo: Don’t let your pumpkins sit on your porch and rot. Come bring them to this family-friendly event where you can donate your pumpkins and watch them get smashed into compost! There will be other fun pumpkin-smashing activities and Olympic-style games for kids. 28) Pickleball Day Party at Club VoloWhen: Sat. 11/2Where: Assembly RowCost: FreeInfo: It’s the final Pickleball Day Party of the season at Club Volo. Come out, meet new friends, sip on a brew from Downeast, and try your hand at this popular sport. 29) Somerville Winter Farmers MarketWhen: Every Saturday, starting Sat. 11/2Where: SomervilleCost: FreeInfo: You heard it right, there’s still farmers markets to get fresh produce despite the chilly weather. Head to the Armory for this weekly market that will feature over 70 local vendors. It’s the perfect place to grab ingredients for a warm soup and other fun recipes. 30) All She Wrote x Juliet Book Club: Sacha Lamb's The Forbidden BookWhen: Sun. 11/3Where: SomervilleCost: $5Info: More book clubs, please! Come to this get together where you can discuss an exciting book about queerness, identity, and hope with the author themself. Learn about their writing process and enjoy cozy vibes with fellow book lovers.31) Dia de Muertos FestivalWhen: Sun. 11/3Where: EastieCost: FreeInfo: Eastie is hosting a festive celebration for Dia de Muertos. Stop by the ICA Watershed for a colorful procession, shop from local art and food vendors, and spend some quality time with friends and family at this community party.32) Open House at The Colonial Society of MAWhen: Sun. 11/3Where: Beacon HillCost: FreeInfo: Explore the historic floors of this 19th-century home. Built in 1807, The Colonial Society's Headquarters still stands strong with collections of 19th century furniture and art on display for you to enjoy. 33) SoWa Sundays When: Every Sunday, starting Sun. 11/3Where: South EndCost: FreeInfo: There’s four SoWa Sundays this month, so you’ll always have a cozy way to kick off your week. Feel inspired as you walk through the galleries of local artists and talk to the creators too! 34) Appraisal Day at the Loring Greenough HouseWhen: Sun. 11/3Where: Jamaica PlainCost: FreeInfo: Come watch the local version of ‘Antiques Roadshow’ at the Loring Greenough House. See what treasures your neighbors are housing or bring your own historic pieces of art, furniture, and other knick knacks to see how much they’re really worth. 35) Movie Mondays: The King's Speech (2011)When: Mon. 11/4Where: BrightonCost: FreeInfo: Enjoy a movie without the big price tag. Head to the Brighton Public Library for their Movie Monday events where you can watch a feature film with others.36) Slam AdamsWhen: Mon. 11/4Where: Jamaica PlainCost: $4Info: It’s time for a poetry slam competition. Come compete or just watch the exciting performances of artists on stage at the Sam Adams Brewery for their monthly Slam Adams event.37) Free Chicken Wings - Monday NightsWhen: Every Monday, starting 11/4 until 11/11Where: Back Bay and SeaportCost: FreeInfo: Cheer on your favorite teams at this weekly Monday night football event. Yes, you read it right — enjoy free chicken wings while supplies last as you kick off the week and watch some sports. 38) 50¢ Wings for Monday Night FootballWhen: Every Monday, starting 11/4Where: SomervilleCost: 50¢Info: Yes. You read it right. Chicken wings for less than a dollar, all while cheering for your favorite football team on the big screen. Head to Olde Magoun’s Saloon for some Monday Night Football shenanigans.39) Free Monday Night Football Watch Party at PrimitivWhen: Every Monday, starting 11/4 until 11/25Where: Financial DistrictCost: FreeInfo: RSVP to these small watch party gatherings at Primitiv where you can meet new friends and munch on complimentary snacks. This event is perfect for cannabis enthusiasts and football fans to hang out, grab a beer, watch some sports, and mingle. 40) Free Ping Pong on Election Day at SPIN BostonWhen: Tue. 11/5Where: SeaportCost: FreeInfo: Don’t forget to vote! And bring some proof like an ‘I Voted’ sticker to enjoy a free hour of ping pong at SPIN. This event is the perfect way to release some election anxiety, have a blast, and enjoy some food and drinks.41) Election Night Watch Party at MiddlesexWhen: Tue. 11/5Where: CambridgeCost: FreeInfo: Don’t stress about election night alone. Head to this watch party and stay for the after-party vibes for some democracy celebrations. This event is about being in community together, no matter the results — come through.42) Hooks and BooksWhen: Tue. 11/5Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: It’s getting chilly out there which makes it the perfect time to nest and craft. But who said you have to do it alone? Head to Trident for an evening of community crafting, reading, and chatting with new friends.43) Test Print TuesdayWhen: Every Tuesday, starting Tue. 11/5Where: AllstonCost: FreeInfo: Come learn about the printing process with local artists. Each week will feature new designs, new creators, and more fun. 44) Free Day at the Isabella Stewart Gardner MuseumWhen: Wed. 11/6Where: FenwayCost: FreeInfo: Looking for a place to relax after this election season? Head to the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum for free where you can find peace amongst art and a stunning, flowering courtyard. Learn about Isabella’s life of civic duty and stewardship and transport yourself to new worlds as you get lost in creative works from all over the world. 45) Cider in the City Community FestivalWhen: Wed. 11/6Where: BrooklineCost: FreeInfo: This small but mighty farm is hosting a favorite community event: their Cider in the City Festival. There will be a beer and cider garden featuring local crews and nonalcoholic options too. Bring your friends and family to enjoy an evening filled with craft vendors, firepits, music from JP Honk, cider pressing, and more!46) Indigenous Women's Healing EmpowermentWhen: Wed. 11/6Where: Long WharfCost: FreeInfo: Head to the New England Aquarium for this discussion about Indigenous healing practices. You’ll meet Sara Melcher, a Mi’kmaq nurse, coach, Reiki master, and entrepreneur who will guide you through self-care skills and techniques. 47) All She Wrote x Park 9 Book Club: Jessa Maxwell's The Golden SpoonWhen: Wed. 11/6Where: EverrettCost: $5Info: Yes! Another book club! We love it! Come to Park 9 Dog Bar for a fun chat about this month’s thriller. It’s a great way to get out with your pup and meet fellow book worms.48) Albertine French Film FestivalWhen: Select days, starting Wed. 11/6Where: WalthamCost: FreeInfo: Watch a series of movies from contemporary filmmakers at Brandeis. You’ll be able to enjoy talks with directors, film critics, and more after the feature.49) Night Cap Cafe Lounge Pop-UpWhen: Select days, starting Wed. 11/6 until Thu. 11/21Where: City HallCost: FreeInfo: An exciting limited-time pop-up night cafe is coming to City Hall for eight nights only. Every evening has a different activity from a listening lounge with rotating DJs, comedy nights, a collab night with Rebel-Rebel, and more. Don’t miss your chance to stop by and have a warm cup of Joe in community with others. Plus, bring a mug and get $1 off your brew. 50) Diwali at the Museum of Fine ArtsWhen: Thu. 11/7Where: FenwayCost: $5Info: Come celebrate the Festival of Lights at the MFA. This evening event will feature art, performances, and other cultural festivities. So stop by after a long day, wander through the galleries of South Asian art, and connect with folks in the community. 51) Space Age Exotica Lounge PartyWhen: Thu. 11/7Where: SomervilleCost: FreeInfo: Bring your intergalactic self and dance at this exotica lounge party featuring DJs spinning space age music tracks. Mid century attire is encouraged and prizes will be awarded to the best outfits!52 ) Free First Thursdays at the Isabella Stewart Gardner MuseumWhen: Thu. 11/7Where: FenwayCost: FreeInfo: Head to the Gardner for their free first Thursday event. If you didn’t snag a ticket, get there early to see if there are any available spots on site. You’ll be able to explore art from all over the world and rest in the stunning courtyard with colorful florals.53) New Girl TriviaWhen: Thu. 11/7Where: Back BayCost: $7Info: To all my ‘New Girl’ fans, we know it’s not fall without binge watching New Girl’s Halloween and Thanksgiving episodes. Put your knowledge to the test with other fans at Trident’s specially-themed trivia. Let’s see who gets crowned the ‘True American’!54) Fashionably LATE Fashion Shows at the LibertyWhen: Every Thursday, starting Thu. 11/7 until 11/21Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: Head to the Liberty lobby every Thursday to watch photo worthy fashion shows. Models will be wearing garments by local designers and strut their stuff on tables, down escalators, and through the hotel floors. Get inspired to change up your wardrobe!55) Boston International Antiquarian Book FairWhen: Fri. 11/8 - Sun. 11/11Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: The 75th International Antiquarian Book Fair will be hosted at Hynes Convention Center. This event is perfect for all the bibliophiles in the city. Come look at old books, meet rare book dealers from all over the world, and enjoy the mysteries and surprises of this three-day market. 56) The Seaport Holiday Market at SnowportWhen: Every day, starting Fri. 11/8Where: SeaportCost: FreeInfo: The holiday season is officially upon us when Snowport opens! And this year, it’s back and bigger than ever. So, head to Seaport for this famously giant and illuminated winter market. Enjoy new seasonal cocktail bars, festive decor, live music, a heated patio, and of course, over 120 makers to shop from. 57) ‘Knives Out’ ScreeningWhen: Sat. 11/9Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: Looking for the perfect cozy hideaway? Head to the beloved Trident for a free screening of the thrilling and funny murder mystery, ‘Knives Out.’ Come by and hang with folks to celebrate the autumn season with this feel-good whodunnit. 58) Boston Veterans ParadeWhen: Sat. 11/9Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: Honor the lives of the men and women who have served our country at the Boston Veterans Parade. Learn about local organizations, listen to live music, and cheer on the march that will make its way through Back Bay to City Hall.59) Dancing Brushstrokes: Anubhava Dance Company PerformanceWhen: Sat. 11/9Where: CambridgeCost: FreeInfo: Stop by the Harvard Art Museums for a cultural performance featuring South Asian dance sets inspired by paintings from the South Asian collections. This show will blend historical commentary and music and provide a creative, immersive experience for audiences. 60) Arlington Open Studios 2024When: Sat. 11/9Where: ArlingtonCost: FreeInfo: Arlington Open Studios is back for its 26th year. Come meet and shop from over 80 local artists as they showcase their talents in painting, sculpture, photography, ceramics, and more. There will also be live music, puppet shows, demos, and poetry performances for everyone to enjoy. 61) Veterans Day CruiseWhen: Sat. 11/9Where: Boston Harbor IslandsCost: $5Info: While it may be cold outside, you can still venture to the Boston Harbor Islands. Grab a ticket to this event for all ages, and enjoy a cruise to Peddocks Island where you can take a guided tour of Fort Andrews, learn about local history, and connect with others. Light snacks and warm beverages will be provided too. 62) TartuffeWhen: Select days, starting Sat. 11/9Where: South EndCost: FreeInfo: Have a laugh and watch this new theater production by the Hub Theatre Company of Boston. Filled with satire, witty jokes, and great costumes, Tartuffe will leave you out of breath from the giggles. While the show is free, gently used children’s books will be collected for donations too.63) ND Football Watch PartyWhen: Every Saturday, starting 11/9Where: CharlestownCost: FreeInfo: The Anchor is the official host for Notre Dame watch parties in Boston. Cheer on the Fighting Irish along the waterfront with brews in hand, giant screens so you can’t miss a play, and great company. 64) Fenway Open Studios Weekend CelebrationWhen: Sat. 11/9 - Sun. 11/10Where: FenwayCost: FreeInfo: Fenway Studios is hosting their annual open studios event at their historic building that was built by artists for artists! Learn about the history of this Fenway landmark, stroll through galleries, and meet 20 artists in their elements. You’ll be able to purchase work if you wish or just chat and learn about the artistic process of local creators. Don’t forget to bring a nonperishable food item for donation!65) Wilson Farm Harvest FestivalWhen: Sat. 11/9 - Sun. 11/10Where: LexingtonCost: FreeInfo: Wilson Farm turns 140 years old! Come wish this local farm a very happy birthday at their bash featuring delicious samples, local vendors, carnival games and rides, and other festivities.66) Veterans Day Weekend at the U.S.S. Constitution MuseumWhen: Sat. 11/9 - Mon. 11/11Where: FenwayCost: FreeInfo: Head to the U.S.S. Constitution Museum for a weekend that celebrates the service of veterans and their families. Veterans can enjoy free admission, guided tours, and other fun activities to honor everyone who has served.67) 20s & 30s Walk Around Mt. Auburn CemeteryWhen: Sun. 11/10Where: CambridgeCost: FreeInfo: Fall foliage is still here! But catch it before it’s gone. Come meet new friends and enjoy the stunning views of the city from Mt. Auburn Cemetery. This event is a nice way to get outside, strike a conversation with friendly strangers, and bond!68) Time Out Fall FestivalWhen: Sun. 11/10Where: FenwayCost: FreeInfo: Join Time Out Market for their Fall Festival where there will be live music, dancing, a hot cocoa bar through Far Out, and other family-friendly activities. There will be giveaways too. Don’t miss the perfect way to say goodbye to the fall season. 69) Poetry Open Mic with Countertop ChantsWhen: Sun. 11/10Where: SomervilleCost: FreeInfo: Get cozy and meet new friends at this community event. Whether you’re a writer or poetry enthusiast, you can share something you’ve written or read your favorite poem by an author. Enjoy a beer, live music, art, and quality time with new friends. 70) All She Wrote Books: November Breakfast ClubWhen: Sun. 11/10Where: SomervilleCost: $5Info: Head to All She Wrote Books for a breakfast book club to discuss the funny romcom, ‘Just as You Are.’ Coffee, pastries from French bakery Michette, and even better company are guaranteed with your ticket.71) Boston River RunWhen: Sun. 11/10Where: AllstonCost: FreeInfo: Tell your friends and family to put on their sneakers. It’s time for a fall 5k charity walk or run along the stunning Charles River. All ages and abilities are welcome — the trail is flat with no street-crossing required.72) Karaoke at SatelliteWhen: Every Sunday, starting Sun. 11/10Where: CambridgeCost: FreeInfo: All that practice in the shower can be put to good use at Satellite. Come to their karaoke events every Sunday to belt out your best song as you grab a bev and a burger. 73) Veggie Galaxy $1 Breakfast SandwichesWhen: Every day, starting Mon. 11/11 until Fri. 11/15Where: CambridgeCost: FreeInfo: Veggie Galaxy is whipping up something special! Munch on their yummy breakfast sandwiches (usually $10) for only ONE dollar. It’s a perfect pick-me-up for fall, so don’t miss this great deal.74) Brian De Lorenzo: Sammy & Sinatra at the SandsWhen: Tue. 11/12Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: Enjoy an evening of cabaret and jazz music with Sammy & Sinatra at the Sands. Grab a drink at the bar and stay for this iconic vocal show.75) ArtsThursdays: The place where the creek goes undergroundWhen: Thu. 11/14Where: CambridgeCost: FreeInfo: Stop by this event for an evening of art. You’ll receive a copy of the art publication that goes hand-in-hand with the exhibition on display. Hear from the artists themselves and mingle with other creatives.76) November Romance Book ClubWhen: Thu. 11/14Where: BrightonCost: FreeInfo: Another monthly book club has hit the Boston scene to provide you a cozy respite away from the cold. Meet new people, chat over romcom books, and join this bookish community party at the Annex on the Speedway.77) Boyden Library Fall Book SaleWhen: Thu. 11/14 - Sat. 11/16Where: FoxboroCost: FreeInfo: Stock up your bookshelves with gently used books as you begin your reading marathon for winter. Head to Foxboro for their book sale and don’t miss their $5 fill-a-bag on Saturday. All proceeds will help towards library programming too.78) ALTARS, The Live ExperienceWhen: Fri. 11/15Where: RoxburyCost: FreeInfo: Celebrate the City of Boston’s Wake Up the Night program with this unforgettable evening of performances featuring local talent. There will be dance pieces, poetry, a short film, music, and more for you to enjoy. 79) Cambridge Symphony Orchestra: ReflectWhen: Fri. 11/15Where: LowellCost: FreeInfo: In honor of its 50th anniversary, Cambridge Symphony Orchestra is presenting their first concert of the season with Reflection: A Concert Reflection on War and Peace. Listen to moving music for the evening at this event.80) 28th Annual New England Craft and Specialty Food FairWhen: Fri. 11/15 - Sun. 11/17Where: TopsfieldCost: $10Info: You don’t want to miss this iconic annual fair at Topsfield. This three-day shopping event will feature some of the best businesses from the North Shore with over 225 booths and a “food sampling” extravaganza with good from the best chefs, bakers, and more.81) Sam Adams Maple & Malts WeekendWhen: Fri. 11/15 - Sun. 11/17Where: DowntownCost: FreeInfo: Head to SA for a fall-themed weekend. Sip on two new exclusive maple brews and munch on a maple menu featuring maple chicken nachos and a maple bruschetta plate to celebrate a chilly New England autumn in Boston. 82) Huge Fall Vintage Clothing Pop-up Thrift MarketWhen: Sat. 11/16Where: RoxburyCost: FreeInfo: Select Markets is hosting one of the biggest vintage markets in MA! Shop from over 90 vendors in a giant space, nibble on snacks from food trucks, grab some free drinks, get a temporary tattoo or a tooth gem, and more. There will be lots of pop-up stalls, immersive activities, $10 piles to thrift, and a whole lot of vintage treasures. 83) Romance Bookshop Pop-up & Free Wine TastingWhen: Sat. 11/16Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: Head to the Urban Grape to sip on some wine as you shop from a curated selection of books by Read My Lips. There will be merch, gifts, blind dates with a book, vino, and great company. 84) The Yappy Hour After Brunch at The Urban GrapeWhen: Sat. 11/16Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: Bring your pup, taste some vino, and learn about the history of wine at this beginner-friendly event for wine lovers and enthusiasts. Polkadog Bakery will be making an appearance with free dog treats too.85) A Holly Jolly Good Time Holiday MarketWhen: Sat. 11/16Where: FenwayCost: FreeInfo: Kick off the holiday season at Time Out Market where you can shop from queer vendors. There will be lots of unique handmade goods, perfect for holiday gifts, as well as festive cocktails, seasonal snacks, and more.86) Lamplighter’s Magic 8th Birthday at CXWhen: Sat. 11/16Where: CambridgeCost: $10Info: Lamplighter is turning 8 years old. Come join the party and wish this neighborhood staple a very happy birthday. There will be exclusive anniversary brews, a photo booth, fortune tellers, and other fun events at this magical, brewful bash.87) caked up: fruitstand’s 1st birthday Queer Dance PartyWhen: Sat. 11/16Where: CambridgeCost: $10Info: Celebrate the birthday of this queer nightlife event curator: fruitstand! Bring your best moves, the glitter, and the fun, and they’ll provide the ultimate setlist of queer pop hits. Get ready to dance.88) The Seltzer Factory: Film Screening + Conversation with Writer/Director Paloma ValenzuelaWhen: Mon. 11/18Where: Back BayCost: FreeInfo: Support a local based artist, Paloma Venezuela, and come watch her documentary about navigating family history and identity. There will be a Q&A after to learn more about her creative process and how she ended up in Boston. 89) Silent Disco with Republic Fitness at Somerville TheatreWhen: Wed. 11/20Where: SomervilleCost: FreeInfo: Republic Fitness is hosting a silent disco dance party. Come join the fun, dance your heart out, meet new folks, and learn about upcoming fitness offerings in the neighborhood. 90) ArtsThursdays: Celebrating Native American Craft BrewersWhen: Thu. 11/21Where: CambridgeCost: FreeInfo: Head to the Harvard Museums of Science and Culture to learn about the art of craft beer making! Stroll through the galleries, meet Indigenous brewers, participate in beer-themed activities, and purchase some local brews. 91) Creatività ItalianaWhen: Thu. 11/21 - Sat. 11/23Where: South EndCost: FreeInfo: You don’t have to travel far to feel like you’re in Italy. This three-day festival celebrates everything ‘Made in Italy.’ Experience art, technology, culture, design, and of course, world-class food and wine at this celebration that honors Italian innovation and heritage. 92) Book Club CaféWhen: Sat. 11/23Where: AllstonCost: FreeInfo: Meet fellow book lovers at this community event! You can enjoy coffee, tea, light refreshments, and a whole lot of chatter about the best books to read right now. Break out of your reading rut, feel inspired, and connect with other bookish people. 93) SNOWPORT: Learn to CurlWhen: Every Saturday, starting Sat. 11/23Where: SeaportCost: FreeInfo: Free curling lessons are back this season in Snowport! Book your 30-minute lesson and practice the basics of this sport on the iceless lanes with guidance from the North End Curling Club!94) 2024 Annual Trellis Lighting at Christopher Columbus ParkWhen: Mon. 11/25Where: Long WharfCost: FreeInfo: Winter is here. Come see the annual lighting tradition of the Christopher Columbus Park Trellis as it glows blue for all to see. Santa Claus will be making an appearance and you can enjoy hot cocoa, clam chowder, and cookies. 95) Boston’s Official Holiday Tree Arrival 2024When: Tue. 11/26Where: Boston CommonCost: FreeInfo: Come welcome Boston’s official holiday tree which has traveled many miles from Nova Scotia. Learn about the history of this tradition that has been occurring for over 50 years and welcome the Christmas season in our city. 96) Faneuil Hall Marketplace Tree LightingWhen: Tue. 11/26Where: DowntownCost: FreeInfo: Bring your friends and family and watch the first Christmas tree light up for the season. There will be festive treats, live performances, and guest appearances to officially mark the beginning of the holiday season in Boston.97) Boston Public Market’s Holiday MarketWhen: Every Friday to Sunday, starting Fri. 11/29Where: DowntownCost: FreeInfo: Head to the Boston Public Market for your holiday shopping goodies. With a carefully selected lineup of vendors, you’ll find a gift that everyone will love from this holiday market.98) Kilroy Square Holiday MarketWhen: Fri. 11/29 - Sun. 12/1Where: QuincyCost: FreeInfo: Sip on festive cocktails as you meet Santa Claus and shop from over 90 local vendors. Find the best gift for loved ones this holiday season, enjoy a beer garden, and watch a Christmas parade at this winter market.99) SoWa Winter Festival 2024When: Every day, starting Fri. 11/29Where: South EndCost: $10Info: The 9th SoWa Winter Festival is back with over 100 local vendors, specialty food and cocktails, food trucks, festive decorations, and more. Shop til you drop at this beloved market favorite.100) 4th Annual Holiday Ship Lighting at Martin's Park in Seaport When: Sat. 11/30Where: SeaportCost: FreeInfo: Head to Seaport for this annual holiday lighting event. Betty the Yetti and other special guests will be crossing the channel on a boat and landing at Martin’s Park to greet you. Sip on hot cocoa, listen to live music, and watch the kick-off of this holiday light display. BONUS: These things are worth the price!MFA First FridayWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: FenwayCost: $27Info: Head to the MFA to celebrate the ‘Four Womxn: New Musings on Blackness’ exhibit, make some art, sip on a cocktail, and dance to tunes by DJ Slick Vick.ICA First Friday: Sweater WeatherWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: SeaportCost: $35Info: We love a good after-hours museum party. The ICA is throwing a bash perfectly on theme with fall: Sweater Weather. So, find your comfiest, fluffiest, silliest sweater and head to Seaport for an evening of contemporary art, a photobooth, some drinks, and a whole lot of dancing.Friday Night Yoga & Live Music at the Museum of Modern RenaissanceWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: SomervilleCost: $35Info: Grab a ticket to relax at one of the most beautiful museums in Boston. Stretch, breathe, get lost in the sounds of live piano, and let your heart feel inspired by the stunning interior of the Museum of Modern Renaissance.Boston Art Review: Launch Event and Halloween Costume PartyWhen: Fri. 11/1Where: ChinatownCost: $25+Info: Boston Art Review is hosting the ultimate Halloween bash in Chinatown to celebrate their 13th issue. Come dressed in a costume and get ready to dance.Boston Lights: A Lantern Experience at the ZooWhen: Fri. 11/1 - Sun. 11/3Where: Franklin ParkCost: $19.95Info: It’s the final days of the Boston Lights Lantern Experience at the Franklin Park Zoo. Wander through an illuminated wonderland where you can be transported to an underwater paradise and an enchanted forest kingdom.Renaissance Faire Day at Hammond Castle MuseumWhen: Sat. 11/9Where: GloucesterCost: $35Info: Step into a world of medieval times.Watch high-energy combat demonstrations, listen to Celtic music, explore the castle museum, and grab a bite at a food truck at this jam packed Renaissance day. MIT Museum After Dark: JunkWhen: Thu. 11/14Where: KendallCost: $20Info: This museum after party is all about celebrating the beauty of junk. Sip on a drink and listen to a performance by a bicycle rock band. Learn from artists creating fashion pieces out of chopsticks and banana crop waste. Create your own art with ‘MIT junk’ from across campus. And learn all about science and sustainability at this 21+ only event.Immersive Yoga @ The WNDR MuseumWhen: Sat. 11/16Where: DowntownCost: $40Info: Recharge your mind and soul at this yoga experience where you can enjoy a 60-minute practice in the WNDR’s immersive theater, surrounded by stunningly colorful and intricate visuals, as well as enchanting soundscapes. Happy November, my Boston friends. This month marks many seasons of change. Catch the final days of fall foliage before a Boston winter arrives. Enjoy autumn parties and festivities and welcome the holiday season with markets and city-wide lightings. As 2024 begins to draw to a close soon, enjoy time with friends and family with 100 free and cheap activities in November. By Yelena Nicolle Salvador 1) Día de Los Muertos Celebration at Time Out When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Fenway Cost: Free Info: Head to Time Out Market for an evening of cultural festivities. Celebrate the Day of the Dead with live music, food and drink specials, and other fun surprises. There will be glitter tattoos and an evening of dance and laughs. 2) Nauti Halloween Party on Dia de los Muertos When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Seaport Cost: Free Info: Head to Nautical Pier 4 in Seaport for a continuation of Boston Halloween right along the stunning waterfront. With no cover charge, this Nauti Halloween party will have spooky decor and a live DJ. Costumes are highly encouraged. 3) SoWa First Friday When: Fri. 11/1 Where: South End Cost: Free Info: Looking for the perfect way to feel inspired and hide away from the cold? Stroll through SoWa and hop into the open galleries where you can meet local artists, find your next gift, and enjoy the art around you. 4) 20s & 30s Mingle and Social at Aeronaut Brewery When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Somerville Cost: Free Info: Head to Aeronaut Brewery for a fun evening of getting to meet new friends. As you grab a brew, chat with young folks in the city and play some board games to break the ice. This is a great way to grow your community! 5) Dock-tober Frights: A Halloween Bash with Downeast Cider! When: Fri. 11/1 Where: The Esplanade Cost: $10 Info: Downeast Cider is hosting the ultimate Halloween bash along the water of the Charles. Enjoy specialty and spooky cocktails, eerie music and games, a costume contest, and a whole lot of fun. 6) Grrrl Talk at Remnant Satellite When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Cambridge Cost: Free Info: Calling all my ladies! This event is made by women and for women. Listen to vinyl classics, grab a drink, and get to know other femmes at this evening experience for ladies, friends, and lovers! 7) Free Coworking Day at The Substation When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Roslindale Cost: Free Info: Looking to change the scenery of your WFH setup? Come test out a new space at the Substation where you can work while you enjoy free coffee, snacks, and pastries. Plus, you can meet other folks who WFH and make new friends! 8) NaNoWriMo Write-In When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Roxbury Cost: Free Info: November is known as National Novel Writing Month. Get your story started and meet fellow writers at this community event. You’ll get to chat, brainstorm, and cheer each other on. 9) Friday Night Trivia at Trident When: Every Friday, starting 11/1 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Trivia nights are a cozy getaway from the cold. Head to the local favorite Trident to meet some new friends, learn some fun facts, and have a laugh. 10) Voting, Democracy, Rights and Representation When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Waltham Cost: Free Info: Make your way to the Rose Art Museum at Brandeis for an evening of art and history. Stay for the discussion about certain pieces on view that touch on American politics, values, and more. Afterwards, there will be voter registration and absentee ballot resources. 11) The 12 Best Neighborhoods in Boston to See Halloween Decorations When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Boston Cost: Free Info: Yes, it’s November, but try to sneak in the final days of Halloween decorations around Boston before they’re gone for the season. It’s the perfect way to soak in some sun, explore Boston neighborhoods, and take photos before we must wait another year for spooky fun. 12) 11 Places to See Fall Foliage in/around Boston When: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1 Where: Boston Cost: Free Info: Foliage is at its peak! Go outside for a solo stroll or a fun walk with friends and breathe in the crisp air. You’ll find stunning views of Boston and its fiery shades of orange and red at our favorite spots in this list. 13) 11 Unique Places to Peep Fall Foliage in New England When: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1 Where: Boston Cost: Free Info: Looking for a fall getaway? Have no fear, we got you covered. Head to these small towns for a stunning car ride. Chase some fall foliage around New England for great photos and memories. 14) 10 Weekly Football Watch Parties in Boston When: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1 Where: Boston Cost: Free Info: There’s a lively place to cheer on your favorite teams every day around Boston. Check out our list of venues that host weekly watch parties where you can meet new friends, eat some bar food, and get rowdy as you show your pride. 15) How to Make Friends in Boston: Part 3 - Fall Edition When: Ongoing, starting Fri. 11/1 Where: Boston Cost: Free Info: Whether you just moved to the area or you’re looking to expand your community, here are some ideas for how to grow your social circle. There’s a lot of opportunities through book clubs, craft nights, conversation meet-ups, socials, and sporting events. 16) 9th Annual Waldocon Boston Bar Crawl When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Downtown Cost: Free Info: One of Boston’s favorite bar crawls is back for the 9th year – Waldocon! So, take out your red and white striped shirt (or make one using colored duct tape) and bar hop around Boston. It’s a great way to support a good cause since proceeds go to the Boston Children’s Hospital and you can meet new friends. 17) Día de los Muertos at Bow Market When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Somerville Cost: Free Info: Head to Bow Market for an evening of cultural celebrations for the Day of the Dead. Bring your friends and family to enjoy yummy food like the traditional pan de Muerto, drink specials, two DJs and a mariachi band performance, craft vendors, and so much more. There will be an ofrenda to pay your respects as well. 18) Be-In Joy Boston Festival When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Boston Common Cost: Free Info: Make your way out to the Boston Common to relish in the beauty of a Boston fall and to rediscover joy at this new festival that’s all about spreading positivity and happiness. Take a moment away from the worries of the world and meet new people with conversational prompts, dance lessons, and other community-building activities that encourage you to take a break from the stressors in your life and be in the moment. 19) Día de los Muertos Festival When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Cambridge Cost: Free Info: Learn about and experience Mexican culture at this Day of the Dead Festival in Cambridge. There will be music, craft vendors, and more. 20) FOUND Fall Vintage Market and Scavenger Hunt When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Cambridge Cost: Free Info: Your favorite organizer of all-things vintage is popping up at Cambridge Crossing for their Fall Vintage Market event. Not only will there be 50 of New England’s best vintage sellers, but there will also be a beer garden, music, and a scavenger hunt where you can win prizes and discounts to local retailers. 21) Vintage After Dark Market When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Fenway Cost: Free Info: Head to Time Out Market after the sun sets for another vintage event. You can enjoy free Culture Pop sodas as you hunt for your next treasure amongst the lineup of great vendors. When you’re done, grab a bite and sip on special cocktails for the event at Time Out Market. 22) Día de los Muertos at Naco Taco When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Central Square Cost: Free Info: Naco Taco is hosting a Day of the Dead celebration that you do not want to miss. Head on over for free tequila tastings and an evening of music, dancing, and of course, great food. Don’t forget to RSVP to the event so you can enjoy free chips and salsa too! 23) Veronica Rables Female Mariachi: Día de los Muertos When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Listen to the beautiful sounds of Veronica Rables’s all-female mariachi band. You’ll be able to experience the spirit of the holiday as you enjoy this free concert and you can watch Mexican folkloric dance performances that will accompany the music. 24) GBH November Outspoken Saturdays When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Head to GBH at the Boston Public Library to meet fellow artists and writers. Bookworm, a mobile bookstore from Quincy, will be popping up with new reads for you to enjoy during this cozy season. 26) The Wicked Circular Market When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: This unique market is focused on zero waste, so stop by and get your holiday shopping done early or find a gift for yourself. Shop from vendors that focus on upcycling, get your Halloween costume repaired or swap it, and meet local organizations that are working towards sustainability and a greener planet. 27) The Great Pumpkin Smash When: Sat. 11/2 Where: Jamaica Plain Cost: Free Info: Don’t let your pumpkins sit on your porch and rot. Auburn Cemetery. This three-day shopping event will feature some of the best businesses from the North Shore with over 225 booths and a “food sampling” extravaganza with good from the best chefs, bakers, and more. 81) Sam Adams Maple & Malts Weekend When: Fri. 11/15 - Sun. 11/17 Where: Downtown Cost: Free Info: Head to SA for a fall-themed weekend. Sip on two new exclusive maple brews and munch on a maple menu featuring maple chicken nachos and a maple bruschetta plate to celebrate a chilly New England autumn in Boston. 82) Huge Fall Vintage Clothing Pop-up Thrift Market When: Sat. 11/16 Where: Roxbury Cost: Free Info: Select Markets is hosting one of the biggest vintage markets in MA! Shop from over 90 vendors in a giant space, nibble on snacks from food trucks, grab some free drinks, get a temporary tattoo or a tooth gem, and more. There will be lots of pop-up stalls, immersive activities, $10 piles to thrift, and a whole lot of vintage treasures. 83) Romance Bookshop Pop-up & Free Wine Tasting When: Sat. 11/16 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Head to the Urban Grape to sip on some wine as you shop from a curated selection of books by Read My Lips. There will be merch, gifts, blind dates with a book, vino, and great company. 84) The Yappy Hour After Brunch at The Urban Grape When: Sat. 11/16 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Bring your pup, taste some vino, and learn about the history of wine at this beginner-friendly event for wine lovers and enthusiasts. Polkadog Bakery will be making an appearance with free dog treats too. 85) A Holly Jolly Good Time Holiday Market When: Sat. 11/16 Where: Fenway Cost: Free Info: Kick off the holiday season at Time Out Market where you can shop from queer vendors. There will be lots of unique handmade goods, perfect for holiday gifts, as well as festive cocktails, seasonal snacks, and more. 86) Lamplighter’s Magic 8th Birthday at CX When: Sat. 11/16 Where: Cambridge Cost: $10 Info: Lamplighter is turning 8 years old. Come join the party and wish this neighborhood staple a very happy birthday. There will be exclusive anniversary brews, a photo booth, fortune tellers, and other fun events at this magical, brewful bash. 87) caked up: fruitstand’s 1st birthday Queer Dance Party When: Sat. 11/16 Where: Cambridge Cost: $10 Info: Celebrate the birthday of this queer nightlife event curator: fruitstand! Bring your best moves, the glitter, and the fun, and they’ll provide the ultimate setlist of queer pop hits. Get ready to dance. 88) The Seltzer Factory: Film Screening + Conversation with Writer/Director Paloma Valenzuela When: Mon. 11/18 Where: Back Bay Cost: Free Info: Support a local based artist, Paloma Venezuela, and come watch her documentary about navigating family history and identity. There will be a Q&A after to learn more about her creative process and how she ended up in Boston. 89) Silent Disco with Republic Fitness at Somerville Theatre When: Wed. 11/20 Where: Somerville Cost: Free Info: Republic Fitness is hosting a silent disco dance party. Come join the fun, dance your heart out, meet new folks, and learn about upcoming fitness offerings in the neighborhood. 90) ArtsThursdays: Celebrating Native American Craft Brewers When: Thu. 11/21 Where: Cambridge Cost: Free Info: Head to the Harvard Museums of Science and Culture to learn about the art of craft beer making! Stroll through the galleries, meet Indigenous brewers, participate in beer-themed activities, and purchase some local brews. 91) Creatività Italiana When: Thu. 11/21 - Sat. 11/23 Where: South End Cost: Free Info: You don’t have to travel far to feel like you’re in Italy. This three-day festival celebrates everything ‘Made in Italy.’ Experience art, technology, culture, design, and of course, world-class food and wine at this celebration that honors Italian innovation and heritage. 92) Book Club Café When: Sat. 11/23 Where: Allston Cost: Free Info: Meet fellow book lovers at this community event! You can enjoy coffee, tea, light refreshments, and a whole lot of chatter about the best books to read right now. Break out of your reading rut, feel inspired, and connect with other bookish people. 93) SNOWPORT: Learn to Curl When: Every Saturday, starting Sat. 11/23 Where: Seaport Cost: Free Info: Free curling lessons are back this season in Snowport! Book your 30-minute lesson and practice the basics of this sport on the iceless lanes with guidance from the North End Curling Club! 94) 2024 Annual Trellis Lighting at Christopher Columbus Park When: Mon. 11/25 Where: Long Wharf Cost: Free Info: Winter is here. Come see the annual lighting tradition of the Christopher Columbus Park Trellis as it glows blue for all to see. Santa Claus will be making an appearance and you can enjoy hot cocoa, clam chowder, and cookies. 95) Boston’s Official Holiday Tree Arrival 2024 When: Tue. 11/26 Where: Boston Common Cost: Free Info: Come welcome Boston’s official holiday tree which has traveled many miles from Nova Scotia. Learn about the history of this tradition that has been occurring for over 50 years and welcome the Christmas season in our city. 96) Faneuil Hall Marketplace Tree Lighting When: Tue. 11/26 Where: Downtown Cost: Free Info: Bring your friends and family and watch the first Christmas tree light up for the season. There will be festive treats, live performances, and guest appearances to officially mark the beginning of the holiday season in Boston. 97) Boston Public Market’s Holiday Market When: Every Friday to Sunday, starting Fri. 11/29 Where: Downtown Cost: Free Info: Head to the Boston Public Market for your holiday shopping goodies. With a carefully selected lineup of vendors, you’ll find a gift that everyone will love from this holiday market. 98) Kilroy Square Holiday Market When: Fri. 11/29 - Sun. 12/1 Where: Quincy Cost: Free Info: Sip on festive cocktails as you meet Santa Claus and shop from over 90 local vendors. Find the best gift for loved ones this holiday season, enjoy a beer garden, and watch a Christmas parade at this winter market. 99) SoWa Winter Festival 2024 When: Every day, starting Fri. 11/29 Where: South End Cost: $10 Info: The 9th SoWa Winter Festival is back with over 100 local vendors, specialty food and cocktails, food trucks, festive decorations, and more. Shop til you drop at this beloved market favorite. 100) 4th Annual Holiday Ship Lighting at Martin's Park in Seaport When: Sat. 11/30 Where: Seaport Cost: Free Info: Head to Seaport for this annual holiday lighting event. Betty the Yetti and other special guests will be crossing the channel on a boat and landing at Martin’s Park to greet you. Sip on hot cocoa, listen to live music, and watch the kick-off of this holiday light display. BONUS: These things are worth the price! MFA First Friday When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Fenway Cost: $27 Info: Head to the MFA to celebrate the ‘Four Womxn: New Musings on Blackness’ exhibit, make some art, sip on a cocktail, and dance to tunes by DJ Slick Vick. ICA First Friday: Sweater Weather When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Seaport Cost: $35 Info: We love a good after-hours museum party. The ICA is throwing a bash perfectly on theme with fall: Sweater Weather. So, find your comfiest, fluffiest, silliest sweater and head to Seaport for an evening of contemporary art, a photobooth, some drinks, and a whole lot of dancing. Friday Night Yoga & Live Music at the Museum of Modern Renaissance When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Somerville Cost: $35 Info: Grab a ticket to relax at one of the most beautiful museums in Boston. Stretch, breathe, get lost in the sounds of live piano, and let your heart feel inspired by the stunning interior of the Museum of Modern Renaissance. Boston Art Review: Launch Event and Halloween Costume Party When: Fri. 11/1 Where: Chinatown Cost: $25+ Info: Boston Art Review is hosting the ultimate Halloween bash in Chinatown to celebrate their 13th issue. Come dressed in a costume and get ready to dance. Boston Lights: A Lantern Experience at the Zoo When: Fri. 11/1 - Sun. 11/3 Where: Franklin Park Cost: $19.95 Info: It’s the final days of the Boston Lights Lantern Experience at the Franklin Park Zoo. Wander through an illuminated wonderland where you can be transported to an underwater paradise and an enchanted forest kingdom. Renaissance Faire Day at Hammond Castle Museum When: Sat. 11/9 Where: Gloucester Cost: $35 Info: Step into a world of medieval times.Watch high-energy combat demonstrations, listen to Celtic music, explore the castle museum, and grab a bite at a food truck at this jam packed Renaissance day. MIT Museum After Dark: Junk When: Thu. 11/14 Where: Kendall Cost: $20 Info: This museum after party is all about celebrating the beauty of junk. Sip on a drink and listen to a performance by a bicycle rock band. Learn from artists creating fashion pieces out of chopsticks and banana crop waste. Create your own art with ‘MIT junk’ from across campus. And learn all about science and sustainability at this 21+ only event. Immersive Yoga @ The WNDR Museum When: Sat. 11/16 Where: Downtown Cost: $40 Info: Recharge your mind and soul at this yoga experience where you can enjoy a 60-minute practice in the WNDR’s immersive theater, surrounded by stunningly colorful and intricate visuals, as well as enchanting soundscapes.

name: Gingerbread House Decorating Workshop
description: Looking for a fun experience for friends and family? Look no further! Join our expert host and learn easy tips that will take your decorating game up a whole other level.  This workshop will showcase some of the techniques used to create the gorgeous gingerbread houses on display at our shop. What you learn will be transferrable to all future cake and cookie decorating as well.Each guest ticket should be accompanied by a full-priced ticket. Thank you!Materials Included:  Large Gingerbread House with generous amounts of candy, pair of gingerbread people and perfect royal icing.  Duration:  60minLocation:Craft Loft100 CambridgeSide Pl, 2nd floor near TJ MaxxCambridge, MA Parking: Street parking or garage. Unfortunately, we don't validate parking vouchers.*Please see our refund/reschedule policy here.Tipping is not expected but always appreciated! Each guest ticket should be accompanied by a full-priced ticket. Thank you! Tipping is not expected but always appreciated!

name: How to Make Friends in Boston: Part 3 - Fall Edition
categories: Art, Classes, Date Idea, Drinks, Games, Good for Groups, LGBTQ+, Meetup, Nature, Party, Photoworthy, Seasonal, Sports & Active Life
description: Your favorite How to Make Friends in Boston series is back with a little twist! Whether you’ve just moved to the city during the fall season or you’re looking for new pals to explore the beauty of Boston as it turns to shades of orange and red, this list has some ideas for how to put yourself out there and grow your community. 🎃By Yelena Nicolle Salvador1) Enjoy cozy activitiesAs the weather turns a bit cooler, you might be feeling the urge to begin to nest inside. No worries, there’s plenty of things to get you to meet folks as you huddle indoors.Check out Pottery With A Purpose, a lovely business that hosts make-your-own pottery mugs, vases, planters, and other containers. Most people come solo to these classes, which are usually small and intimate. It’s a fun way to create, sip on a brew while you channel your inner artist, and talk to your neighbor while having a laugh. Throughout the fall months, they host lots of events that are Halloween-themed like pumpkin pot making and a jack-o-lantern candle holder. Test your knowledge with some trivia around Boston at a different place every day of the week. It’s a nice way to hide away from the impending cold and have a laugh with groups of people over random fun facts.Wine always seems to taste better when it’s a bit chilly out, so stop by local wine shops that are hosting fun social events. Bonde Fine Wine Shop has a weekly Friday Social Club series where four tables are available on a first-come first served basis, so you can enjoy a flight and light bites in an intimate setting. You can bring your own vinyls to add to the ambiance but it must be in line with their weekly theme. Speaking of wine, learn about it in a judgment free zone at free weekly tastings. Local wine shops, like Georgie’s and Urban Grape, host regular classes to meet folks who want to get into the wine scene too.2) Meet others at community reading spacesFall is the perfect time to swaddle up with a book. Grab a tea or a coffee and get ready to chat over your must-reads!Meet some fellow bookworms at local book clubs! In fact, the months of fall usually inspire book clubs to host spooky meetings about thrillers, mysteries, and other haunting novels. Check out your favorite local bookstores who host pop-up book clubs and other events as well. For example, All She Wrote Books has lots of book club events at Juliet Social Club and Park-9. In fact, stop by Side Quest Books and Games, a new woman-owned, fantasy-focused bookstore, that hosts regular monthly book clubs and fun events like “Cozy Hours” where you can vibe with other folks in a small, quiet, heartwarming space. And the local favorite, Trident, hosts fun game nights, free movie showings, and other spooky activities like “Muder Mystery Dinners,” where you can meet new folks as you solve a classic whodunnit.Don’t forget to check out other Spooky Book Events in Boston.3) Cheer on your favorite sports teamsIf you’re looking for something fun and consistent, come cheer on your favorite sports teams at fun bars all over the city. As you sip on a brew, a cocktail, a mocktail, or a soda, and munch on some bar food noms, strike up some easy conversation with the people around you as you make some noise and rep your team.The Anchor hosts weekly Patriots Watch Parties and Notre Dame Watch Parties where you can enjoy waterfront views and some camaraderie. If you’re looking for a different venue to cheer on your favorite teams, join Monday Night Football Watch Parties for free at Primitiv where each evening is capped at 75 guests to ensure an intimate setting to mix and mingle with folks.For even more options for all the football fans, put these 10 Weekly Watch Parties in Boston in your rotation.Check out these spots in Fenway that are great for watching games of all kinds!Some local favorite spots include: ParlorSports, Scores, Phoenix Landing, and Cathedral Station – each with their own weekly updates about what games will be on view!Keep your eyes peeled for more events too as different seasons start throughout the fall months — let’s cheer on our C’s as they go after Banner 19. 4) Attend events for making new friendsLots of local organizations are popping up to host more opportunities for folks to meet new people! Check out these experiences that are coming up in the fall months.Club Volo hosts regular events to connect with others. Join a league while trying a new sport (use ‘JOYRAFT’ for $10 off your first league), head to organized bar outings, and enjoy watch parties too. Don’t forget to stop by one of their free Pickleball Day Parties that happen every Saturday (the last one for this year is on Nov.2). Strawberry Matcha is a new community group that’s hosting meet-ups for people to make friends. Head to their organized outing in Cambridge or at the Public Garden. Don’t forget to fill out their interest form, where they match you every month with a different group of 4-6 folks that they think ~vibe~.The local FB group, How to Make Friends After College, always hosts events that are usually in-theme with the season. Check their listings regularly for new experiences. Some fun ones coming up are a brewery social at Aeronaut Somerville and a foliage walk at Mt. Auburn Cemetery. The Civic Discussion Meetup group adds a twist to meeting people with a common topic already chosen to break the ice. Head to their next event that is promptly named, “How to Make Friends in Boston?,” for a lively chat with strangers about how to build community. Finally, Skip the Small Talk hosts some speed-friending events throughout the year! Head to upcoming experiences at Trident for one where you can meet folks across age groups or a 30s specific event. They bring the prompts, bring yourself and/or a friend!No matter what you choose to explore, just remember to be yourself. A smile and a warm hello can get you far in any of these events, so take a breath and put yourself out there. Happy friend making! Check out Part 1 and Part 2 for other ideas. Your favorite How to Make Friends in Boston series is back with a little twist! Whether you’ve just moved to the city during the fall season or you’re looking for new pals to explore the beauty of Boston as it turns to shades of orange and red, this list has some ideas for how to put yourself out there and grow your community. 🎃 By Yelena Nicolle Salvador 1) Enjoy cozy activities As the weather turns a bit cooler, you might be feeling the urge to begin to nest inside. No worries, there’s plenty of things to get you to meet folks as you huddle indoors. 2) Meet others at community reading spaces Fall is the perfect time to swaddle up with a book. Grab a tea or a coffee and get ready to chat over your must-reads! 3) Cheer on your favorite sports teams If you’re looking for something fun and consistent, come cheer on your favorite sports teams at fun bars all over the city. As you sip on a brew, a cocktail, a mocktail, or a soda, and munch on some bar food noms, strike up some easy conversation with the people around you as you make some noise and rep your team. 4) Attend events for making new friends Lots of local organizations are popping up to host more opportunities for folks to meet new people! Check out these experiences that are coming up in the fall months. No matter what you choose to explore, just remember to be yourself. A smile and a warm hello can get you far in any of these events, so take a breath and put yourself out there. Happy friend making! Check out Part 1 and Part 2 for other ideas.

name: Boston Jewish Film Festival 2024
description: Boston Jewish Film offers the finest in film programming, education, and conversation to audiences across the Greater Boston community. Created in 1989, as the Boston Jewish Film Festival and founded by filmmaker Michal Goldman, we are now the largest film-based organization in New England, welcoming more than 15,000 annually. Boston Jewish Film offers the finest in film programming, education, and conversation to audiences across the Greater Boston community. Created in 1989, as the Boston Jewish Film Festival and founded by filmmaker Michal Goldman, we are now the largest film-based organization in New England, welcoming more than 15,000 annually.

name: The Yappy Hour After Brunch at The Urban Grape
categories: Animals, Date Idea, Drinks, Pet Friendly
description: Join us on the third Saturday of each month for a special Yappy Hour edition of The After Brunch—and bring your furry friends! Polkadog Bakery will be there handing out free treats alongside a free public tasting and local maker pop-up. Join us on the third Saturday of each month for a special Yappy Hour edition of The After Brunch—and bring your furry friends! Polkadog Bakery will be there handing out free treats alongside a free public tasting and local maker pop-up.

name: SoWa Sundays
description: OPEN EVERY SUNDAY IN NOVEMBER.There is only one 450 Harrison Ave. In fact, we’re open every Sunday of the year, 11am-4pm. And in November, there are four SoWa Sundays. And Black Friday, November 29th 10am-9pm, and Small Business Saturday, November 30th 10am-10pm, will kick off our annual Winter Festival. Outdoor markets? Not until next spring. But the studios at 450 Harrison are open! Be the first to see new works. Experience the rewards of buying direct from the makers. Yes, it pays to be in the know. And the first Friday of every month is still and always will be First Friday Open Studios, 5pm-9pm. See you First Friday, November 1st! See you every Sunday! See you Winter Festival, beginning Black Friday, November 29th. Check sowaartists.com for hours.   SoWa Artists Guild SoWa Artists Guild Facebook SoWa Artists Guild Instagram OPEN EVERY SUNDAY IN NOVEMBER. name: Boston Queer Club Event Night
categories: Good for Groups, LGBTQ+, Meetup, Nightlife
description: This Friday is our weekly Boston Queer Club Event! Entry is $15 OR only $5 if you come with one mail painted pink. This week is live improv performances and a social!

name: Immersive Yoga @ The WNDR Museum
description: Step into a world where movement meets art and mindfulness meets creativity! Join WNDR Boston and Pete Sacco aka BulldogFlowBoston for a special yoga session on November 16th from 10-11AM hosted in our Immersive Theater, where you’ll flow through poses surrounded by stunning visuals and captivating soundscapes.Whether you’re a seasoned yogi or just starting your journey, this class promises to elevate your practice in a one-of-a-kind setting. Connect with your body, mind, and the art around you in an unforgettable yoga experience.Ticket price includes access to the full museum experience. Bring your own mat and water bottle! Step into a world where movement meets art and mindfulness meets creativity! Join WNDR Boston and Pete Sacco aka BulldogFlowBoston for a special yoga session on November 16th from 10-11AM hosted in our Immersive Theater, where you’ll flow through poses surrounded by stunning visuals and captivating soundscapes. Whether you’re a seasoned yogi or just starting your journey, this class promises to elevate your practice in a one-of-a-kind setting. Connect with your body, mind, and the art around you in an unforgettable yoga experience. Ticket price includes access to the full museum experience. Bring your own mat and water bottle!

name: Comic Book Happy Hour
description: "Sometimes you wanna go where everybody knows Thor's hammer's name." Join us for The Comic Book Happy Hour, happening every Friday from 5 to 7 pm at The Jungle in Union Square. It's a 21+ affair. Step into our cozy dive and dive into discussions about all things comic books. Plus, here's a sweet deal: Bring in new comics from any local comic shop, and The Jungle will slash HALF OFF your meal. plus Free Comic Book Day

name: Materials Lab Workshop: Black Magic
description: Join artist Adam Davis for an exploration of tintypes and image making as a means of documenting and celebrating communities. Taking inspiration from his project building one of the largest contemporary repositories of tintype portraits of Black Americans and Global Africans in the world, titled Black Magic, this workshop will serve as a pop-up tintype portrait session. The Materials Lab will be turned into a studio and dark room, and everyone will learn the basics of tintype photography by making portraits on an aluminum plate from start to finish. You’ll have the chance to add your own creative flourishes both to an image of a fellow participant and to a tintype made of you.Photography supplies will be provided. Beginners are warmly welcome.The hands-on session will take place in the Materials Lab on the Lower Level.$15 workshop fee. Registration is required and space is limited; registration will open on this form, beginning on Wednesday, November 6, at 10am. $15 workshop fee must be paid to confirm registration. Minimum age of 14; no previous experience required. Join artist Adam Davis for an exploration of tintypes and image making as a means of documenting and celebrating communities. name: Guided Sake Tasting
description: Come learn about and drink good sake with the MFA and the Koji Club! Taste three different styles of sake to find the glass (or bottle, or style, or category) you like best. Invite friends and join us for a 60-minute guided sake tasting with light bites. Afterward, explore art in the galleries—the Museum is open till 10 pm!The Koji Club is a community of sake enthusiasts who love to sip sake together all over the world. It has won numerous accolades since opening its brick-and-mortar location in Boston, New England’s only Japanese sake bar, in 2022. Come learn about and drink good sake with the MFA and the Koji Club! Taste three different styles of sake to find the glass (or bottle, or style, or category) you like best. Invite friends and join us for a 60-minute guided sake tasting with light bites. Afterward, explore art in the galleries—the Museum is open till 10 pm! The Koji Club is a community of sake enthusiasts who love to sip sake together all over the world. It has won numerous accolades since opening its brick-and-mortar location in Boston, New England’s only Japanese sake bar, in 2022.

name: 10 Weekly Football Watch Parties in Boston
categories: Drinks, Food, Good for Groups, Meetup, Sports & Active Life
description: Game day just got a whole lot more fun. Watch your favorite NFL or college football team duke it out at these regular watch parties around Boston. Even if you’re not a die-hard sports fan, there are beautiful views and special game day menus to enjoy at these local restaurants. by Celina ColbyFootball Watch Parties at Deck 12When: Thursdays-Mondays as games airWhere: SeaportInfo: Watch the game from the Deck 12 rooftop and cheer on your favorite team with the Boston skyline in the background. This rooftop bar is showing NFL and college games as they air Thursday-Monday, plus they’re serving game day bites like fried pickles and smash burgers.Football Season Free Wings at King’sWhen: Mondays, 6pm to closeWhere: Back Bay, SeaportInfo: King’s is showing Monday night football games every week and Kings Reward Members can get free wings while they root for their favorite team. Notre Dame Football Watch Party (pictured)When: Saturdays and select Sundays, game times varyWhere: CharlestownInfo: Notre Dame fans can get their weekly fix with Saturday (and the occasional Sunday) game viewings at The Anchor in Charlestown. Thursday Night Football Watch PartyWhen: Thursdays, 7:30pmWhere: DowntownInfo: Football fans and cannabis lovers unite at this free weekly party with game day snacks, adult beverages, and a different cannabis-industry partner every week. Patriots Watch PartyWhen: Sundays at game timeWhere: CharlestownInfo: Every Sunday head to The Anchor to cheer on the home team during Patriots games. The game will be live on a big screen and you can order up cold beers and food specials while watching on the waterfront.Football Weekends at LocoWhen: Saturdays and SundaysWhere: Fenway and South BostonInfo: Every Saturday from 10am-5pm and all day Sunday, celebrate game days at Loco South Boston and Fenway. In South Boston reserve a couch and a TV for a group and at Loco Fenway enjoy special pitchers of beer and margaritas. Both locations offer a festive game day menu. Sunday Funday Football at Stats BarWhen: Saturdays and SundaysWhere: South BostonInfo: Stats Bar has 24 TVs inside to get every angle of the NFL games on Sunday and the college football games on Saturday. While you’re at it, order classic football comfort food and local brews.Game Day at MJ O’Connor’sWhen: Saturdays and Sundays, select weekdaysWhere: Back BayInfo: It’s first game requested, first shown at MJ O’Connor’s Back Bay, so get in early to see your favorite team play. While you’re cheering them on, order a Guinness, wings, waffle fries, and other goodies.50¢ Wings for Monday Night FootballWhen: MondaysWhere: SomervilleInfo: Fuel up to cheer on your favorite team with 50¢ wings at Olde Magoun’s Saloon in Somerville in celebration of Monday Night Football. Football Sundays at Banner’s Kitchen & TapWhen: SundaysWhere: West EndInfo: Root for the Patriots on the huge screens at Banner’s Kitchen & Tap near TD Garden. Game day is also a perfect time to try out their fun foods like the torched bacon rack. BONUS:Harvard vs. Yale Football GameWhen: Saturday 11/23Where: AllstonInfo: The Harvard vs. Yale game is a classic Boston experience. These storied rivals will battle it out on the Harvard field for the 140th year. Tickets sell fast and early so plan ahead if you want to attend. Game day just got a whole lot more fun. Watch your favorite NFL or college football team duke it out at these regular watch parties around Boston. Even if you’re not a die-hard sports fan, there are beautiful views and special game day menus to enjoy at these local restaurants. by Celina Colby Football Watch Parties at Deck 12 When: Thursdays-Mondays as games air Where: Seaport Info: Watch the game from the Deck 12 rooftop and cheer on your favorite team with the Boston skyline in the background. This rooftop bar is showing NFL and college games as they air Thursday-Monday, plus they’re serving game day bites like fried pickles and smash burgers. Football Season Free Wings at King’s When: Mondays, 6pm to close Where: Back Bay, Seaport Info: King’s is showing Monday night football games every week and Kings Reward Members can get free wings while they root for their favorite team. Notre Dame Football Watch Party (pictured) When: Saturdays and select Sundays, game times vary Where: Charlestown Info: Notre Dame fans can get their weekly fix with Saturday (and the occasional Sunday) game viewings at The Anchor in Charlestown. Thursday Night Football Watch Party When: Thursdays, 7:30pm Where: Downtown Info: Football fans and cannabis lovers unite at this free weekly party with game day snacks, adult beverages, and a different cannabis-industry partner every week. Patriots Watch Party When: Sundays at game time Where: Charlestown Info: Every Sunday head to The Anchor to cheer on the home team during Patriots games. The game will be live on a big screen and you can order up cold beers and food specials while watching on the waterfront. Football Weekends at Loco When: Saturdays and Sundays Where: Fenway and South Boston Info: Every Saturday from 10am-5pm and all day Sunday, celebrate game days at Loco South Boston and Fenway. In South Boston reserve a couch and a TV for a group and at Loco Fenway enjoy special pitchers of beer and margaritas. Both locations offer a festive game day menu. Sunday Funday Football at Stats Bar When: Saturdays and Sundays Where: South Boston Info: Stats Bar has 24 TVs inside to get every angle of the NFL games on Sunday and the college football games on Saturday. While you’re at it, order classic football comfort food and local brews. Game Day at MJ O’Connor’s When: Saturdays and Sundays, select weekdays Where: Back Bay Info: It’s first game requested, first shown at MJ O’Connor’s Back Bay, so get in early to see your favorite team play. While you’re cheering them on, order a Guinness, wings, waffle fries, and other goodies. 50¢ Wings for Monday Night Football When: Mondays Where: Somerville Info: Fuel up to cheer on your favorite team with 50¢ wings at Olde Magoun’s Saloon in Somerville in celebration of Monday Night Football. Football Sundays at Banner’s Kitchen & Tap When: Sundays Where: West End Info: Root for the Patriots on the huge screens at Banner’s Kitchen & Tap near TD Garden. Game day is also a perfect time to try out their fun foods like the torched bacon rack. BONUS: Harvard vs. Yale Football Game When: Saturday 11/23 Where: Allston Info: The Harvard vs. Yale game is a classic Boston experience. These storied rivals will battle it out on the Harvard field for the 140th year. Tickets sell fast and early so plan ahead if you want to attend.
