name: Crafts for Humanity
description: 📅 Sunday- November 17, 2024🕖 11:00 AM to 1:00 PMWe're coming together to decorate canvas bags and fill them with gifts to be donated to children served by MGH Chelsea Prenatal Department. Join us in spreading holiday cheer through our Crafts for Humanity volunteer event!What to Expect: You’ll receive a 13”x13” canvas bag and a set of fabric markers to unleash your creativity. We’ll provide holiday-themed stencils for inspiration. Whether you're a beginner or experienced crafter, you'll have fun personalizing bags with holiday designs.How You Can Help: For the Moms and newborns: Diaper bags, baby bottles, swaddles, nasal aspirators, humidifiers, thermometersA little extra: Gift cards: supermarket, pharmacy, coffee (a treat for mom), Something to relax AKA comfy: socks, slippers, candle, Breastfeeding support kit, Items for Pampering: bath salts, bubble bath.Let’s come together to create something special and make the holidays brighter for new families. Your creativity, time, and generosity will add a touch of joy to their lives. 📅 Sunday- November 17, 2024 🕖 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM We're coming together to decorate canvas bags and fill them with gifts to be donated to children served by MGH Chelsea Prenatal Department. Join us in spreading holiday cheer through our Crafts for Humanity volunteer event! What to Expect: You’ll receive a 13”x13” canvas bag and a set of fabric markers to unleash your creativity. We’ll provide holiday-themed stencils for inspiration. Whether you're a beginner or experienced crafter, you'll have fun personalizing bags with holiday designs. How You Can Help: For the Moms and newborns: Diaper bags, baby bottles, swaddles, nasal aspirators, humidifiers, thermometers A little extra: Gift cards: supermarket, pharmacy, coffee (a treat for mom), Something to relax AKA comfy: socks, slippers, candle, Breastfeeding support kit, Items for Pampering: bath salts, bubble bath. Let’s come together to create something special and make the holidays brighter for new families. Your creativity, time, and generosity will add a touch of joy to their lives.

name: Turkey Time!
description: Turkeys are all around us, and that's good! Turkeys eat ticks, as well as lots of other animals and plants. Did you know that turkeys can fly and they sleep in trees at night? Let's look for the turkeys at the BNC and learn how they live in this bustling city. We will look at turkey feather up close and follow the turkey tracks across the sanctuary.This program is free if you are a member of Dot Rx. Please email [email protected] to register.Registration is required.Register! Turkeys are all around us, and that's good! Turkeys eat ticks, as well as lots of other animals and plants. Did you know that turkeys can fly and they sleep in trees at night? Let's look for the turkeys at the BNC and learn how they live in this bustling city. We will look at turkey feather up close and follow the turkey tracks across the sanctuary. This program is free if you are a member of Dot Rx. Please email [email protected] to register. Registration is required. Register!

name: Free Admission to the Harvard Art Museums
categories: Accessible Spots, Art, Kid Friendly, University
description: Free every day (open Tuesday to Sunday, 10am–5pm) and just steps away from Harvard Square, the Harvard Art Museums welcome visitors from around the corner and around the world to enjoy one of the largest and most renowned art collections in North America.Masterpieces from our collection of more than a quarter million works include paintings by Vincent van Gogh, Claude Monet, Georgia O’Keeffe, and Jackson Pollock; contemporary works by living artists such as Bosco Sodi, Ai Wei Wei, and Kerry James Marshall; and a variety of remarkable objects from ancient cultures in the Mediterranean, Near East, and Far East. In addition, an exciting lineup of special exhibitions gives us the chance to showcase an even wider range of works spanning diverse media, genres, and erasJust steps away from Harvard Square in Cambridge, Massachusetts, the Harvard Art Museums welcome visitors from around the corner and around the world. Visitors can enjoy the many amenities that greet them upon entering the museums’ beautifully restored Calderwood Courtyard on the first floor—our own version of a town square. From there, grab a coffee or snack in Jenny’s Cafe or browse the many unique gifts in the museum shop before exploring over 50 galleries of art across three floors.In addition to the galleries, visitors can view works of art not currently on display by appointment in the expansive Art Study Center. Conveniently browse the collections and make an appointment. Many engaging public programs take place throughout the year, from gallery tours to artist talks to workshops in our Materials Lab, a hands-on environment for art making. Once each month, we keep our doors open until 9pm for an evening of art, music, food, special activities, and more. By offering unparalleled access to our collections and resources, the Harvard Art Museums encourage the enjoyment of art by everyone!The museums are open Tuesday through Sunday, from 10am to 5pm, and are free to all visitors every day. Plan your next visit. Once each month, we keep our doors open until 9pm for an evening of art, music, food, special activities, and more. By offering unparalleled access to our collections and resources, the Harvard Art Museums encourage the enjoyment of art by everyone! The museums are open Tuesday through Sunday, from 10am to 5pm, and are free to all visitors every day. Plan your next visit.

name: 30+ Trivia Nights in Boston for Every Day of the Week
categories: Date Idea, Drinks, Food, Games, Good for Groups, Meetup, Nightlife, University
description: A little friendly competition can be good for you. It’s time to assess your IQ with the very best trivia nights around the city. We've rounded up 31 trivia nights in the Boston area for every day of the week so you don't have to. Have fun!By Kenneal Patterson and Celina ColbyMONDAY:  The BurrenWhere: Davis SquareInfo: The Burren is a Somerville treasure trove with great nightly music and delicious dishes. This authentic Irish pub also hosts trivia nights every Monday starting at 8pm.The HavenWhere: Jamaica PlainInfo: Every Monday at 7pm, you can check out The Haven for some “Scottish food, drink, and great banter!” Don’t miss out on this JP gem. ArcadeWhere: Central SquareInfo: Formerly known as A4cade, Arcade was recently acquired by Roxy's Grilled Cheese. Every Monday, visit the speakeasy-style arcade bar for Drag Queen Trivia, drinks, and bites!Trillium Brewing CompanyWhere: Fort PointInfo: Every Monday at 7pm, Trillium Fort Point and Geeks Who Drink host trivia nights that blend knowledge and camaraderie while you enjoy a drink with friends.Remnant BrewingWhere: Union SquareInfo: Every Monday at 7pm, host Meredith will lead brain-twisting questions for your chance to claim victory with prizes, local bites from Bow Market, and the perfect atmosphere for a lively night of quizzing and camaraderie.TUESDAY:Aeronaut Brewing Co. (pictured)Where: Union SquareInfo: Every Tuesday at 8pm, a community of players & hosts gather at the taproom for Aeronaut's famous independent trivia games. Each week's questions and rounds are conceived by crack players-turned trivia-masters: the hosts.Remnant SatelliteWhere: East CambridgeInfo: Get ready for challenging questions, good vibes, and the chance to win gift cards for the top two teams every Tuesday at 7:30 pm at Remnant Satellite. Gather your team or come solo, reserve your spot, and prove your knowledge supremacy.Irish VillageWhere: BrightonInfo: Exercise your brain and have a blast every Tuesday at The Village Pub for Trivia Night, starting at 7pm, with a wide array of questions to challenge all knowledge levels, plus delightful drinks and delicious toasties.Olde Magoun's SaloonWhere: MedfordInfo: Enjoy trivia every Tuesday night at 8pm at this craft beer and spirits bar in Somerville.The BiltmoreWhere: NewtonInfo: This historic Newton bar—established in 1914—was recently remodeled to become Newton’s chicest place for American cuisine and craft cocktails. Stop by on Tuesday nights for an amazing round of Ponder’s Trivia. The Local 149Where: SouthieInfo: Join the marvelous, “exceptionally local” bar, The Local 149, for their trivia nights— both at 7pm on Monday for OpinioNation or Tuesday for Stump! Trivia. High Street PlaceWhere: DowntownInfo: Head to Boston's coolest new food hall for a game of Stump! Trivia every Tuesday at 6pm and 7pm. Prizes go to the top winners, of course!Sam Adams Downtown Boston TaproomWhere: DowntownInfo: Every Tuesday from 6-8pm, Sam Adams Downtown Boston Taproom and Geeks Who Drink host the nation's premier live-hosted pub quiz featuring 7 rounds of trivia, bonus questions, and gift card prizes for top teams.Lucky's LoungeWhere: SeaportInfo: Bring your trivia aficionado crew to this underground speakeasy's Tuesday night trivia. Kick off with happy hour from 4-6 pm and reserve your spot for an evening of competitive camaraderie and the chance to win Red Sox tickets, gift cards, and more.WEDNESDAY:Boston Public MarketWhere: DowntownInfo: Boston Public Market doesn’t only have various food and unique drink options. Every Wednesday night at 6pm and 7pm, you and your buddies can try your hand at Stump Trivia. Grab some snacks and shoot for that grand prize. Over the Charles Rooftop BarWhere: AllstonInfo: Participate in trivia at Over the Charles Rooftop Bar every week during the summer. While you’re testing your knowledge, take in stunning views of the Boston skyline. This bar is open seasonally, so check back for when it re-opens!Long Live Roxbury Brewery & TaproomWhere: RoxburyInfo: Gather your crew for trivia Wednesday nights at 7pm at Long Live Roxbury, featuring engaging rounds, audio & video challenges, and a food popup by Vaz & Mac Tex-Mex, promising two hours of PG-13-rated fun covering every topic under the sun.City Tap HouseWhere: South BostonInfo: Every Wednesday at 6pm, dive into a night of brain-teasing questions, friendly competition, and fun at City Tap's new trivia series with awesome prizes.Dorchester Brewing CompanyWhere: DorchesterInfo: Since opening in 2016, DBCo has met production demands for the local craft beer industry while supporting the economic development of its local community. Show the brewery some of your own support by showing up on Wednesday nights at 7pm for their Hump Day Trivia. Winning teams will win DBco gift cards.Rocco’s Cucina & BarWhere: North End Info: You’ll feel transported to Italy at this cozy North End bistro, so make sure to sample their cheesy slices before gearing up for Wednesday night trivia at 7pm. Charlie’s KitchenWhere: Harvard SquareInfo: For over 65 years, Charlie’s Kitchen has been the best spot in town for comfort food, jukebox music, delicious brews, and old-school feels. Check out the 50s diner ambiance while trying your hand at Wednesday night trivia at 8pm. PKL BostonWhere: South BostonInfo: You may have tried trivia at every restaurant, pub, or bistro in Boston. But have you ever competed in a pickleball bar? Warm up by hitting some pickleball balls before winning PKL Boston’s trivia night— every Wednesday at 7 p.m.The BebopWhere: Fenway–KenmoreInfo: On Wednesday nights, head to Back Bay for a little post-workday fun. The cozy Bebop is a hidden gem for folksy live music, welcoming people, wonderful decorations, and the very best brews. Trivia begins at 7 p.m.CitySide TavernWhere: BrightonInfo: CitySide Tavern has been the go-to bar in Cleveland Circle since 1985. It offers a vibrant and lively spot for drinks and snacks, as well as Wednesday night trivia with gift cards as prizes. The questions begin at 8 p.m. at the upstairs bar.Bleacher BarWhere: Fenway–KenmoreInfo: Every Wednesday at 7pm, bring your crew and join trivia nights at Bleacher Bar while enjoying a unique "Cheeky & Trivial" cocktail, a chance to win a Bleacher Bar gift card, and the perfect backdrop overlooking the stadium.Shoppers CafeWhere: WalthamInfo: Every Wednesday at 8pm, Shoppers Cafe hosts Think About It! Trivia, a 13-year tradition featuring fun and challenging questions and the chance to win first-place prizes or gamble on the mystery bucket.THURSDAY:GrandTen DistillingWhere: SouthieInfo: Sip some of Boston’s best spirits during GrandTen Distilling’s trivia nights. every Thursday at 7pm. Their game consists of seven rounds, including a Picture round, a Guess Who round, and General Knowledge rounds. The top three teams will win prizes.Short Path DistilleryWhere: Everett Info: Every Thursday is a chance to win prizes for your trivia prowess at Short Path Distillery. Play inside or outside, where your pup can join you on the dog-friendly patio. Plus you get a free slice of cheese pizza with every cocktail order.FRIDAY:Trident Booksellers & CafeWhere: Back BayInfo: Test your brain power at one of Boston’s best scholarly hubs every Friday at 7 p.m. Trident Booksellers & Cafe is a literary haven, full of books and encyclopedias galore. Their weekly trivia features seven rounds of general knowledge trivia with a few wildcards along the way and excellent prizes for the top three teams.SATURDAY:The Puddingstone TavernWhere: Fenway–KenmoreInfo: Take the green line right to a cozy little pub at the base of Mission Hill. Every Saturday night, The Puddingstone Tavern hosts a trivia night starting at 7pm. Make sure to sip on some stout or cider– the perfect brain fuel to win the game.SUNDAY:An SibinWhere: East CambridgeInfo: An Sibin only opened last September, but it became a smash hit fast. Locals love the American speakeasy meets Irish pub ambiance, the unforgettable whisky list, delicious food, and the Sunday night trivia with Jeopardy contestant host Brennan Harkin!https://www.thebostoncalendar.com/eventshttps://www.thebostoncalendar.comhttps://www.thebostoncalendar.com/?search=trivia+night--Photo: Trivia at Aeronaut A little friendly competition can be good for you. Locals love the American speakeasy meets Irish pub ambiance, the unforgettable whisky list, delicious food, and the Sunday night trivia with Jeopardy contestant host Brennan Harkin! https://www.thebostoncalendar.com/events https://www.thebostoncalendar.com https://www.thebostoncalendar.com/?search=trivia+night -- Photo: Trivia at Aeronaut

name: Free Fridays at Trinity Organ Concerts
description: Join us in our Copley Square home on Friday afternoons at 12:15 pm for this weekly series of midday organ concerts featuring innovative programs by recitalists from across the United States and abroad. There is no charge for admission, but we invite a donation of $10. All performances take place in Trinity Church Boston's sanctuary, accessible via the Copley Square entrance.No concert on Fri., Nov. 29, the day after Thanksgiving. name: DIY Screen Print Night
description: Join us at DARK MODE’S Bow Market storefront for DIY Screenprinting night. We provide one t-shirt, but feel free to bring your own if you wish. You can also customize your own hoodie, which we provide for $20 extra. We have dozens of full screens and design elements to choose from. Please see the video below for some of the options available. https://vimeo.com/944549513Our screenprint night is an experience you won’t find anywhere else. Tap into your creative side to customize your own look. Make a night of it with your friends or bring a date!Tickets $45. name: Paint & Sip
description: Join artist and instructor Halle Cooper for a night of guided painting and wine! If you haven’t heard of a “Paint and Sip,” it’s basically a Bob-Ross-style painting lesson. We will all be painting the same beginner-friendly picture, and the teacher will guide you through, step by step. Follow along exactly, or add your own twist as you go. It will be so easy you can even do it a little tipsy! (but not if you drove!) It’s a great time for non-painters and professional artists alike. Just a fun, low-stakes, creative activity to do with your friends (or a great way to make new ones!) Supplies included.To register, please scroll to the Workshops tab on the website! name: Boston’s Best Places to Work Remotely that Aren't a Coffee Shop
description: With most people working hybrid or remote roles, third spaces to get work done outside your house have become even more important. And although we love a local coffee shop, small businesses can’t sustain endless laptop traffic. We’ve chosen great remote workspaces that go beyond the typical cafe, offering free WiFi, printing options, bookable conference rooms, or other amenities. Plus, trying out a designed-for-remote work spot allows you to meet other remote workers. Who says you need an office to have a work bestie?  by Celina Colby1) Shy BirdWhere: South Boston & Kendall SquareInfo: Choose from 3 all-day work packages with varying perks from bottomless espresso beverages to free WiFi, free printing, second screens, and more. On the first Friday of each month, you can get free lunch at Shy Bird with a remote work reservation. 2) Capital One CafeWhere: SeaportInfo: Yes, this is technically a cafe, but don’t be fooled by the name, this isn’t your typical coffee stop. You can get coffee and espresso beverages and order off a full food menu, but you can also hook up to free WiFi, utilize plentiful outlets, and even book a nook workspace or small conference room. 3) Venture Café Cambridge: Thursday GatheringWhere: Kendall SquareInfo: Work from the Venture Cafe at the Cambridge Innovation Center on Thursdays and you can attend an after-hours networking event with other creators, entrepreneurs, and visionaries. Each gathering is themed and many feature a guest speaker. 4) The Boston Public Library Kirstein Business Library & Innovation CenterWhere: Back Bay Info: The Boston Public Library is a beloved workplace with tons of seating and outlets, an on-site coffee shop, free WiFI and printing, and WGBH live broadcasting. But the Kirstein Business Library & Innovation Center is an underutilized remote workspace. Book a private conference room or workspace and get access to a 3-D printer, small business coaching, Adobe software, and more, all for free. 5) The Harvard University Richard A. and Susan F. Smith Campus CenterWhere: Harvard SquareInfo: This meeting ground for the Harvard community (and visitors!) offers a wide array of flexible spaces. Cafe-style tables are great for solo work sessions and coffee intake, and groupings of couches and comfortable chairs are great for team brainstorming sessions or on-site meetings. You may even get a free concert if someone gets to work at the on-site piano. 6) CultureHouse Union SquareWhere: Union SquareInfo: This pop-up community space (test driving for a more permanent community center) offers free co-working space and complimentary coffee and tea. They also have a robust schedule of programs like a LGBTQ soup dinner and a craft group, so it’s a great place to meet like minded people. And although we love a local coffee shop, small businesses can’t sustain endless laptop traffic. name: Art and Architecture Tour at BPL
categories: Art, Date Idea, Good for Groups, History, Meetup
description: The landmark Central Library in Copley Square features notable architecture and design components spanning three centuries, as well as significant art and decorative installations. A summary of key points of interest can be found on our Art & Architecture page.Regularly scheduled public Art & Architecture tours, led by trained BPL guides, are free and do not require a reservation for parties of five or fewer people. Tours last approximately one hour and start in the McKim Building Vestibule, just through the Dartmouth Street entrance. Group sizes will be limited to twenty-five people per guide and are subject to guide availability. To secure a place on a tour, please visit the McKim Welcome Desk any time in the hour leading up to the start time to receive a tour sticker for you and any members of your party. Please note that we are unable to accommodate individual parties larger than five people on these tours.Unauthorized guides are not permitted to lead tours within the library. When planning your visit, please make note of days when the library will be closed due to holidays; inclement weather may also affect opening hours. Information on accessibility and other tour details can be found on our Tours page.Accessibility Notice: We strive to make our events accessible. To request a disability accommodation and/or language services, contact the department listed in the "Contact Info" pane on the right. Please allow at least two weeks to arrange accommodation.All stops on the Art & Architecture tour are wheelchair accessible. To inquire about borrowing a wheelchair, please check in with the security desk (opposite the McKim Welcome Desk) upon your arrival.Suitable for:All AdultsCollege StudentsOlder AdultsTeens (Ages 13-18)VisitorsYoung Adults (Ages 20-34)Additional Details:Tours start from the McKim Vestibule (right through the Dartmouth Street entrance). Information on accessibility and other tour details can be found on our Tours page. Accessibility Notice: We strive to make our events accessible. To request a disability accommodation and/or language services, contact the department listed in the "Contact Info" pane on the right. Please allow at least two weeks to arrange accommodation. All stops on the Art & Architecture tour are wheelchair accessible. To inquire about borrowing a wheelchair, please check in with the security desk (opposite the McKim Welcome Desk) upon your arrival. Suitable for: All Adults College Students Older Adults Teens (Ages 13-18) Visitors Young Adults (Ages 20-34) Additional Details: Tours start from the McKim Vestibule (right through the Dartmouth Street entrance).

name: Traditional Irish Music Sessions at The Druid
categories: Date Idea, Drinks, Meetup, Music, Nightlife
description: Traditional Irish Sessions are a long-standing tradition and well-known event at the Druid. These take place every Wednesday evening at 8pm, every Saturday afternoon at 4pm, and every Sunday at 12pm.Each week it’s something new! Come in and ask your bartender for more information! Traditional Irish Sessions are a long-standing tradition and well-known event at the Druid. These take place every Wednesday evening at 8pm, every Saturday afternoon at 4pm, and every Sunday at 12pm. Each week it’s something new! Come in and ask your bartender for more information!

name: Seaport Smalls
description: Back by popular demand, Boston Seaport's children's programming series, Seaport Smalls: Free Fun for your Tiny Crew.Join us Saturdays, from 10AM-11AM in The Paseo at 111 Harbor Way, for a rotating selection of free children's programming for ages 0-8 years old. Our programming partners include Bonaparte Magic with magic, Little Groove Music, music for kids, Curious Creatures for live animal education, and Family Yoga with Emily Haight Yoga. Refreshments will be available for purchase at Blue Bottle Coffee.Schedule:November 2: Bonaparte, Magic ShowNovember 9: Little Groove, Music for KidsNovember 16: Bonaparte, Magic ShowNovember 23: Little Groove, Music For KidsNovember 30: Music at the Blissful, Music For KidsDecember 7: Little Groove, Music For KidsDecember 14: Little Groove, YogaDecember 21: Spanish Fun Program, with facepainting by Sully Paints available from 11am-12pm.December 28: Music at the Blissful, Music For KidsConvenient parking can be found at the 111 Harbor Way Garage.Please be sure to register on Eventbrite to receive program updates & schedule changes. name: Boston Swing Central- Friday Dance
categories: Classes, Good for Groups, Music, Sports & Active Life
description: Boston Swing Central is a dancer-formed, non-profit, volunteer-run organization dedicated to promoting positive and fun swing dancing experiences in Boston.Weekly Friday night dance, beginner lesson included. Lesson from 8-9, dance from 9-11:45pmPrices vary from 10-30$ depending on if the music is a live band or a DJ. Everyone 18+ welcome. Dry venue.See the website or Facebook page for more details on weekly events and special holiday events! Weekly Friday night dance, beginner lesson included. Lesson from 8-9, dance from 9-11:45pm Prices vary from 10-30$ depending on if the music is a live band or a DJ. Everyone 18+ welcome. Dry venue. See the website or Facebook page for more details on weekly events and special holiday events!

name: Soulful Sister Collective x Dance Cardio Pop Up
categories: Classes, Good for Groups, Meetup, Music
description: Welcome to the Soulful Sister Collective!A community dedicated to the inclusion, appreciation and empowerment of Black Women, through curated wellness events.The Event: Get ready to move with Nicole in a high-energy, dance cardio class set to global beats! From Afrobeat to Salsa, Hip Hop to belly dance, you’ll explore rhythms and moves from around the world. No dance experience? No problem! Just bring your authentic self, some sneakers, and let the music take over.Join us Saturday Nov 16th for Dance Fitness Pop Up🗓️Tickets available via Eventbrite 🎟️See you there! 😊 Welcome to the Soulful Sister Collective! A community dedicated to the inclusion, appreciation and empowerment of Black Women, through curated wellness events. The Event: Get ready to move with Nicole in a high-energy, dance cardio class set to global beats! From Afrobeat to Salsa, Hip Hop to belly dance, you’ll explore rhythms and moves from around the world. No dance experience? No problem! Just bring your authentic self, some sneakers, and let the music take over. Join us Saturday Nov 16th for Dance Fitness Pop Up🗓️ Tickets available via Eventbrite 🎟️ See you there! 😊

name: 20+ Rooftop Bars & Restaurants Around Boston
categories: Date Idea, Drinks, Good for Groups, Outside, Seasonal
description: We’ve rounded up every rooftop bar in Boston, so you can watch the sun set over the city skyline with a drink in hand. By Kenneal Patterson1) Lifted Restaurant at Omni Boston Hotel at the SeaportWhen: Open now | Tu-Sa from 11a-10pWhere: SeaportWhat: Omni Boston Hotel’s fifth-floor open-air Lifted Pool Bar, one of the only rooftop pool bars in Boston, is now open to the public. 2) Lamplighter CX Patio & Rooftop When: Open now | Mo–We from 1p-10p, Th–Sa from 1p-12a, Su from 12p-10pWhere: Cambridge CrossingWhat: Lamplighter’s new location in Cambridge Crossing has the best of both worlds: expansive patio & roof deck and a beautiful interior. Perfect for sipping a craft beer on a warm weather day. 3) Roof Deck @ Pier 6When: Open now | Mo–Su from 11a-1aWhere: CharlestownWhat: Pier 6, right on the beautiful Charlestown Marina Waterfront, has unbeatable views of both the city and the harbor. If you’re looking for a classic New England meal, this won’t disappoint. 4) Felipe’s TaqueriaWhen: Officially open May 5 but already informally open when the weather is nice | Su–We from 11a-12a; Th–Sa from 11a-2aWhere: Harvard SquareWhat: Ola, Felipe’s! A Cambridge favorite, this Mexican Taqueria has perhaps the best margs in Boston. Sit on the roof and sip your drink while admiring Harvard Square's hustle & below.  5) Long Bar & TerraceWhen: Now open | Mo-Fr from 6a-12a, Sa & Su from 7a-12aWhere: Back BayWhat: Boston gains a new rooftop bar located on the 17th floor of the new Raffles Hotel. The hotel is home to the historic Long Bar, which invented the iconic Singapore Sling.6) The Lexington’s Rooftop BarWhen: Open now | Su–We from 4p-10p, Th–Sa from 4p-11p, Sa–Su brunch from 11a-2pWhere: Cambridge CrossingWhat: With gorgeous views of Cambridge Common, The Lexington is a great spot for after-work drinks and late-night dates. 7) Mia Roofdeck at Umbria SteakhouseWhen: Open now | Su–We from 4p-10p, Th–Sa from 4p-11p, Sa–Su brunch from 11a-2pWhere: Cambridge CrossingWhat: North End’s only roof deck bar, Mia, located inside Umbria Steakhouse offers specialty apps, signature cocktails, music, and the vibrant nightlife of the neighborhood.8) Daedalus Rooftop BarWhen: Open now | Su–We from 5p-11p, Th–Sa from 5p-12aWhere: Harvard SquareWhat: It’s Harvard Square’s hidden gem. At Daedalus, you can enjoy modern American food and top-notch cocktails with open-air seating above Cambridge. 9) Colonnade Hotel Rooftop PoolWhen: TBA. Typically opens during Memorial Day WeekendWhere: Back Bay What: "Discover the ultimate urban oasis at The Colonnade's RTP, Boston's famous rooftop pool.10) Rooftop @ Revere HotelWhen: Set to open May 2Where: Downtown BostonWhat: The Rooftop at the Revere is the largest roof deck in all of Boston, and it’s definitely one of the best. Lounge with a drink in your hand and panoramic views of Boston Common and Back Bay. 11) The Layover @ Cunard TavernWhen: Set to open May 3Where: East BostonWhat: Cunard Tavern is transforming its roofdeck into East Boston's newest tropical rooftop destination this season.12) Dorchester Brewing CompanyWhen: Open now | Mo & Su from 11:30a-9p; Tu–Th from 11:30a-10p; Fr & Sa from 11:30a-11pWhere: DorchesterWhat: Dorchester Brewing Co. is known for its “brews with a view.” Their incredible open-air roof deck is a great space to sample some of the very best craft beers in the city.13) Rooftop at the Envoy Hotel When: Open now | Mo-Su from 11a-11:30pWhere: SeaportWhat: The line to get up is long, but the view of Boston Harbor and the city skyline just might be worth it. 14) YOTEL Rooftop Terrace When: Open now | Mo–Fr from 5p-10:30p; Sa from 10a-11:30p; Su from 10a-10:30pWhere: Seaport  What: Enjoy beautiful views of Boston’s downtown and waterfront at YOTEL Boston's Deck 12, where you can admire the view all year round. 15) TerraWhen: Opening date TBAWhere: Back BayWhat: Mama mia! If you’re craving great Italian food from Eataly—plus an amazing view of Back Bay—Terra’s your place. The outdoor rooftop is straight out of Roman Holiday.16) Mex Taqueria & BarWhen: Open now | Mo–We from 11a-10p, Th & Fr from 11a-11p, Sa from 10a-11p, Su from 10a-4pWhere: Kendall SquareWhat: Looking for a lil Spanish flair? MEX Taqueria has the best of both worlds: retro and modern, with authentic recipes and tacos with a twist. The roof deck is unmatched. (Photo by Eric Luciano)17) Sam Adams Taproom Rooftop Beer GardenWhen: Open only weekends for now, full season opening on May 18 Where: Faneuil Hall What: One of the only rooftop beer gardens is now open for the season18) Overlook Roofdeck at Legal HarborsideWhen: Open year round | Mo-Th 4p-10p, Fr 4-11p, Sa 12p-11p, Su 12p-10p.Where: SeaportWhat: Experience the newly renovated Overlook at Legal Harborside, Legal Sea Food’s flagship property on the Boston Waterfront, offering three floors under one (retractable) roof and an abundance of unique seafood dishes. 19) Over the Charles Rooftop BarWhen: Opening date TBA.Where: AllstonWhat: Set on the 16th floor of the recently updated DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Boston-Cambridge, enjoy a laid-back atmosphere while taking in stunning views of the scenic Charles River and Boston city skyline at this outdoor rooftop bar in Boston.20) Trillium Fort PointWhen: Open now | Mo–Th from 12p-10p; Fr & Sa from 12p-11p; Su from 12p-8p Where: Fort PointWhat: Trillium Fort Point’s outdoor courtyard and roof deck is open for full-service dining, draft pours, and food 7 days a week. (Photo by Simone Migliori) 21) View Boston at the Prudential CenterWhere: Back BayWhen: Mo-Su from 10a-10pWhat: Going up…. To the 52nd floor. View Boston at the Pru gives you a panoramic view of our beloved city. Stop in at Stratus Rooftop Bar or The Beacon Bistro for some good bites and good vibes. BONUS:  Contessa (It’s technically indoors… but it’s worth it.)Where: Back BayWhen: Open now | Su–We from 7:30a-12a, Fr & Sa from 7:30-1aWhat: Known as Newbury Street’s “Crown Jewel,” Contessa brings a delicious Northern Italian flare to Boston. Enjoy one-of-a-kind views from the top of the beautiful Newbury Hotel, tucked into a glass sky-terrarium with views of the Boston Public Garden. We’ve rounded up every rooftop bar in Boston, so you can watch the sun set over the city skyline with a drink in hand. If you’re looking for a classic New England meal, this won’t disappoint. 4) Felipe’s Taqueria When: Officially open May 5 but already informally open when the weather is nice | Su–We from 11a-12a; Th–Sa from 11a-2a Where: Harvard Square What: Ola, Felipe’s! (Photo by Eric Luciano) 17) Sam Adams Taproom Rooftop Beer Garden When: Open only weekends for now, full season opening on May 18 Where: Faneuil Hall What: One of the only rooftop beer gardens is now open for the season 18) Overlook Roofdeck at Legal Harborside When: Open year round | Mo-Th 4p-10p, Fr 4-11p, Sa 12p-11p, Su 12p-10p. Where: Seaport What: Experience the newly renovated Overlook at Legal Harborside, Legal Sea Food’s flagship property on the Boston Waterfront, offering three floors under one (retractable) roof and an abundance of unique seafood dishes. 19) Over the Charles Rooftop Bar When: Opening date TBA. Where: Allston What: Set on the 16th floor of the recently updated DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Boston-Cambridge, enjoy a laid-back atmosphere while taking in stunning views of the scenic Charles River and Boston city skyline at this outdoor rooftop bar in Boston. 20) Trillium Fort Point When: Open now | Mo–Th from 12p-10p; Fr & Sa from 12p-11p; Su from 12p-8p Where: Fort Point What: Trillium Fort Point’s outdoor courtyard and roof deck is open for full-service dining, draft pours, and food 7 days a week. (Photo by Simone Migliori) 21) View Boston at the Prudential Center Where: Back Bay When: Mo-Su from 10a-10p What: Going up…. To the 52nd floor. View Boston at the Pru gives you a panoramic view of our beloved city. Stop in at Stratus Rooftop Bar or The Beacon Bistro for some good bites and good vibes. BONUS: Contessa (It’s technically indoors… but it’s worth it.) Where: Back Bay When: Open now | Su–We from 7:30a-12a, Fr & Sa from 7:30-1a What: Known as Newbury Street’s “Crown Jewel,” Contessa brings a delicious Northern Italian flare to Boston. Enjoy one-of-a-kind views from the top of the beautiful Newbury Hotel, tucked into a glass sky-terrarium with views of the Boston Public Garden.

name: $5 mimosas at Ward 8 | West End
categories: Drinks, Good for Groups, Party, Rainy Day Ideas
description: No weekend plans? Put this on your calendar: Ward 8 has brunch, complete with $5 mimosas (they’re basically bottomless at that price!) every Saturday and Sunday from 10:00am-3:00pm. The American brasserie perched on the edge of Boston’s North and West Ends will be serving up a host of tasty dishes this weekend and every weekend. Think: chicken & waffles with whipped cream, avo toast with chipotle aioli, roasted tomatoes and a poached egg and a tender, juicy breakfast burger, if your brunch cravings lean more towards lunch. Be sure to make a reservation here, because weekends fill up fast!📷: ward8bos No weekend plans? name: Sunday Morning Yoga @ Museum Of Modern Renaissance!
categories: Art, Classes, Date Idea, Good for Groups
description: Welcome to Sunday Morning Yoga at the Museum of Modern Renaissance! Join Pete Sacco aka @bulldogflowboston for a relaxing and rejuvenating yoga session surrounded by beautiful art and inspiring vibes. This in-person event is the perfect way to unwind after a long week and connect with your inner zen. Whether you're a seasoned yogi or a beginner, everyone is welcome to join us for this special evening of self-care and community. This class will run for 75 mins total including a sweet yoga nidra/ extended shavasana. There will be plenty of time for pictures after the class is over. Phones are discouraged during the actual yoga practice. Come stretch, breathe, and find your center with us at the Museum of Modern Renaissance!Please arrive 10-15 mins early to not hold up the class please. Phones are discouraged during the actual yoga class. Tix are available through eventbrite below or to buy direct DM @buddoglowboston and venmo . name: Thrift (S)hop
description: Join us for our Thrift (S)hop event where craft beer, unique finds, and live music come together. Every third Sunday we have a curated selection of local vintage and thrift stores that offer one of a kind treasures for everyone. This month's vendors are Fresh Vintage Supply, Bodystone & Soul, Gold Star Designs, and Vico Style. Support sustainability, community , and good vibes here at the brewery!
